title: Senior Backend Engineer
subTitle: AppsFlyer
description:
AppsFlyer is known for its massive backend production. In any given second, our servers produce valuable insights from millions of incoming events, crunching our users’ data, serving requests and communicating on a massive scale. We value ownership, transparency and striving for quality.

Our teams deploy fast and often, having code deployed in production shortly after it was written, focusing on safety, robustness and proper architecture of our backend that handles over a hundred of billions of events daily at a fast pace.

Backend developers at AppsFlyer shape and improve our microservices architecture daily to provide the leading mobile analytics solution. To do this, we use cutting-edge technologies such as Clojure, Go, Kafka, Spark, Redis, BigQuery, GraphQL, GRPC, SQL and NoSQL databases, in addition to hosted solutions that AWS and GCP have to offer and more…

We encourage engineering excellence and promote industry best practices, and we’re looking for great backend developers with a passion for challenging themselves while solving technical problems at a large scale.

At AppsFlyer we emphasize Personal growth - Enrich and expand your technical knowledge and stack by developing with the most cutting edge and versatile technologies and participating in various courses and learning programs.

Have an impact on the Ad-Tech industry - Along with working together with top-notch Software Engineers, you will cooperate with giants of the industry such as Facebook, Google, Twitter, Snapchat and Tencent.

Make an impact on your team by mentoring others, leading projects and promoting engineering best practices
If you're up for the challenge - Speak at meetups/conferences, write blog posts, contribute to existing open-source projects and release new open-source software

5+ years of development experience with a passion for excellence
Strong server-side skills
Experience with high throughput, low latency, mission-critical distributed systems
Experience with large-scale production databases
B.Sc. in computer science or an equivalent.
A drive to get things done, especially as part of a team, while leading others
Tendency to shine in ambiguous environments and to embrace changes while helping others cope with them
Solid system design/architecture skills and a technological expertise
Passion for mentoring and setting an example to your peers
Drive to promote quality and lead continuous improvements in your team’s ways of work

Bonus points

Experience in functional programming
Recommended by an AppsFlyer employee

 You’re a master C# programmer. You've written high-performance, concurrent applications leveraging the Task Parallel Library and squeezed every bit of performance from your system. You've written piles of clean, correct, well-tested, performant, idiomatic C# code. 
 You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution.

title: R&D Product Owner

description:
Who We Are




CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR ) is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management , CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. What Will You Do




CyberArk’s Product Owner (PO), a member of R&D development team responsible for filling the gap between the market requirements as presented by Product Management and the solution that determines how to implement these requirements in our products. Using comprehensive business and technical knowledge, the PO accompanies the entire development process starting from the planning phase, through the development and testing process to successful release to our customers. Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. title: Senior System Engineer
subTitle: General Motors
description:
Job Description

General Motors Israel (Herzliya)  takes a significant part in shaping the autonomous vehicle. We impact the future vehicles in diverse fields by developing cutting edge technologies. Within GM Israel, over 600 people working in a hybrid flexible mode on one of the most exciting challenges of our days.

Our Software Defined Vehicle IL (SDV IL) – Energy and Mobility Application Group develops a broad range of Web and Mobile based connected vehicle systems, including autonomous fleet management, mobility services, electric vehicle digital user experience, as well as next generation of OnStar online services for consumers and Cars.

As a System Engineer, you will be the primary line of engineering support for Vehicle Architecture. You will be responsible for the execution of a specific compartment by ensuring the proper interface occurs between engineering functions and Vehicle Design Studios.

What will you do?

Manage the overall EV product line architecture and system engineering activities including in-vehicle, Backoffice, web and mobile applications
Create the system level architecture in collaboration with vehicle engineering and SW engineering architects
Monitor upcoming vehicle program technologies and analyze the impact on the current EV system architecture and product lineup
Manage feature request architecture process through the corporate process and IT tools until approval
Prepare a system requirements specification that breakdown the work items between the different platforms and embedded controls
Upon system requirements approval, review the requirements with each impacted development team towards implementation


Additional Job Description

If you don’t meet 100% of the requirements below - that’s ok!

We believe in hiring by potential, on the job training and development, so, If you find the position exciting and think you can contribute and evolve,

Please continue the application! We promise to consider your application even if you are missing a skill or two :-)

For any question, please contact the TA team: ta.israel@GM.com

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering
Over 5 years of multi-disciplinary system engineering in the embedded, cloud and web/mobile domains in a global corporate
Knowledge of cyber security systems
Proven ability to consolidate multiple system engineers from different domains to a cohesive system design in a matrix management environment
Experience working in SAFe methodology
Fluent English speaker and outstanding verbal and written communication skills


About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

title: Backend Engineer - Pro
subTitle: Similarweb
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions are used by companies like Google, eBay, and Adidas.




We help our customers succeed in today’s digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights, competitive benchmarks, strategic analysis, and more.




In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven’t stopped growing since!




We’re looking for a Server Foundations Engineer to help us develop tools, libraries and architecture to support the platform’s group engineering teams.




Why is this role so important at Similarweb?




You will be working on Similarweb's core B2B platform that serves tens of thousands of customers, serving hundreds of terabytes in production. Our backend engineers are responsible for the entire data lifecycle - from our endless datatlakes, through choosing the right serving methods and databases, all the way to our api services.




You will impact the work of these engineers by designing, building and maintaining the core infrastructure of our solution and leading the research and development of new technologies as well as maintaining code standards and practices.




So, what will you be doing all day?




Your role as part of the Server Foundations Engineer team means your daily responsibilities may include:




Developing our Architecture ensuring development velocity and scale
Developing tools and libraries to support business logic development
Define and develop best practices for healthy production and rapid development without compromising code quality and performance
Perform POCs on new technologies and ensure they are implemented in dev teams
Sharing knowledge and enforcing coding standards and practices




This Is The Perfect Job For Someone Who




Has 5 years server-side developer experience: You need to have at least 5 years of experience developing web applications and tooling using Python/C#/Ruby/Java/Node.js/Go
Experience building large scale web applications : advantage for working with Micro Services architecture, AWS and databases (DynamoDB, Redis, MySQL, ElasticSearch)
Object Oriented Design Patterns : Experience writing and designing OO code, advantage for C# and .NET.
Familiarity with Big Data technologies: A familiarity with Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, Databricks and Airflow is a big advantage.
Good understanding of CI/CD pipelines: an advantage
Functional Programming Experience: an advantage




*All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model, so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face to face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.*




Why You’ll Love Being a Similarwebber




You’ll actually love the product you work with : Our customers aren’t our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said “the product.” Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.




You’ll find a home for your big ideas : We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You’ll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.




We offer competitive perks & benefits: We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.




You can grow your career in any direction you choose: Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it’s Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you’ll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.




Diversity isn’t just a buzzword: People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We s trive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.

We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.




With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies® 2022.




Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.




Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.




Job Description




What you get to do in this role:  




Product execution: Work with engineering team to implement and deliver products.
Market and Competitive Analysis: Figure out what’s happening out there speaking with end users, customers, partners, and industry experts
Partnership Evaluation: Pursue inorganic approaches to deliver solutions where appropriate.
Product Enablement & Success: Collaborate with outbound product management, Marketing, and Pre/Post Sales teams for cementing product success.




Qualifications




To be successful in this role you have:




2+ years of product management experience and/or equivalent experience as a solutions consultant in the ITOM domain.
Familiarity with cloud-based solutions, including log and metric analytics tools.
Understanding of various AI/ML technologies and their application to IT Operations tools.
Understanding and hands on experience with system, network and application management solutions.
The ability to make trade-off decisions between possible and desirable, which requires a good sense of what is technically feasible
Thinks strategically, fast-learning and communicates with impact.
Thrives in ambiguity and operates fluently




Additional Information




ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.

All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.

title: Technical Services Engineer
subTitle: MongoDB
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (database as a service), or Cloud Manager (which helps customers with automation, backup and monitoring of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humor to help our customers to be successful with MongoDB.

We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Tel Aviv for our hybrid working model of 3 days a week in the office.

Cool things you’ll do

You'll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex challenges - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You'll be an expert resource on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You'll be an advocate for customers' needs - interfacing with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you'll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.

What You Need

We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.

The ideal candidates should have strong technical experience in one (or more) of the following areas

Systems administration
Distributed systems
Network administration
Database architecture and administration
Application architecture
Data architecture and design
Performance tuning and benchmarking
Extra bonus points if you experience in one or more of: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, PHP, or Perl


If you have an operations background, we prefer experience administering large-scale production environments, including hardware, operating systems (e.g. Linux, Windows), networks (including firewalls and load balancers), as well as cloud-based resources (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform).

It’s crucial for every candidate that they can check off all of these boxes

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Genuine desire to help people
Uncontrollable urge to investigate and solve problems, with advanced diagnostic and troubleshooting skills
Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time
Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills
Strong teamwork: willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Senior Product Designer - Social Impact
subTitle: monday.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




The Social Impact team at monday.com is looking for a Senior Product Designer to join us in helping nonprofits around the world scale their impact with a digital transformation.




As our first designer, you’ll be joining a unique startup aimed at bridging the gap between how nonprofits use technology to scale their impact. You will design end-to-end user experiences and optimizations – from early prototypes to final implementation – and contribute to the development of our brand, style guidelines, and design system. You’ll join our Social Impact Team based in our headquarters in Tel Aviv, Israel.




The mission




Let’s be honest: nonprofits are the real MVPs. They work to make the world a better place every day, and most do it with little to no resources or funding. Our mission is to help nonprofits around the world solve their biggest challenges through the use of technology. With the proper digital tools, nonprofits are able to increase productivity, automate their processes, and ultimately scale their impact.Some numbers




We currently work with 15K nonprofits globally
We develop solutions for these nonprofits in 70+ countries
After launching in February 2022 we’re up to 76K sign-ups to Digital Lift




The team




We’re a group of entrepreneurial thinkers, go-getters, and creatives who just won’t give it a rest. We believe the work we do is important and we’re always working towards one common goal, whether that means working individually or collaborating as a group.Digital Lift website: https://digital-lift.org/monday.com , Eswatini (Swaziland), and the race to vaccinate a nation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ivMN6a9emxs&t=6sOperations Management for Displacement Centers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XQtkF87Y-J0




About The Role




Mission driven: wake up every morning with the mission of helping thousands of nonprofits around the world scale their impact with technology
Startup mindset: you’ll be playing a key role in founding Digital Lift – our startup within monday.com – that builds products and services on a global scale, from scratch
Part of the larger monday.com ecosystem: work in one of the fastest growing public companies with a revolutionary product surrounded by the passionate and talented people
Own the Digital Lift product’s UX/UI
Own the Digital Lift brand design
Work closely with Product, Engineering, Data science, and Marketing teams to develop a smooth user experience with high-end look and feel
Brainstorm and design new products, from conception to production
Multitask on several projects at a time and maintain a positive attitude




Requirements




3+ years of experience designing a complex system/platform
High level of written and spoken English
Passionate about social impact
Ability to adapt, switch gears, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
A positive attitude and great social skills, with a willingness to put aside ego for the sake of what’s best for the team
Advantage: experience in owning the design of products from early stage startups
Advantage: experience as a marketing designer

At Brainnest, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. title: Media DevOps Engineer
subTitle: Wix
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
We Are

Wix's Media group. We’re responsible for storing and organizing the images, videos, audio and data of our 220+ million users. We handle petabytes of data and use the latest cloud technology and methodologies. Our cloud services power Wix's APIs for all of our web, mobile and desktop client applications.

We're looking for a bright, solution-oriented DevOps Engineer to join the team and build, run, manage and monitor security aspects of our cloud-based environments.

You Are

A DevOps Engineer with 4+ years of experience in live production systems. You’re passionate about automating things to make life simple and have experience with at least one programming language - Python, Ruby, Golang, etc. You’re familiar with Kubernetes, EKS, GKE and great with Linux system internals and shell scripting (bash/sh/etc). You also have experience running production systems over the cloud and have used configuration management/deployment tools like Chef/Puppet/Ansible. You know how to use provisioning tools like Terraform and have spent a lot of time managing scalable web applications.

You like to dig into security aspects of cloud and physical environments.

You’ll get bonus points if you have

Strong networking foundations: TCP/IP, DNS, Load-balancers, network security
Docker or other container-based technologies
Experience with SQL/NoSQL technologies like MySQL, ElasticSearch, etc.
Experience with RabbitMQ, Kafka, Zookeeper
Experience with monitoring tools


As a DevOps Engineer, you will:

Build multi-data center architecture with hundreds of servers
Quickly identify and resolve infrastructural bugs
Get a chance to work with virtually all aspects of our rapidly-developing infrastructure
Drive the success of our systems’ advancements, cooperating with the development, support and QA teams


About Wix

With over 30 different products, Wix makes it easy for anyone to succeed online. We build web creation tools and business solutions, mobile apps, payment processing technologies, as well as CRM and marketing tools that help our users in different business sectors and compete online. Our technologies are based on massive infrastructure required to securely and resiliently serve over 220 million users, and their visitors across the globe - instantly. Our scale is enormous, and our plans for the future are even bigger.

Wix’s product development teams work in a dev-centric culture, deploy code hundreds of times every day using advanced automation tools, and create methodologies that enable a fast-to-production environment. We operate in small highly-collaborative teams, but belong to professional groups called guilds, dedicated to personal and professional growth.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcome, and anyone has the right to succeed.

title: Software Development Manager – Data (Bangkok based)
subTitle: Agoda
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.




The Opportunity:




We are looking for top notch development managers to lead the teams of our data services. We use big data and ML for most of our applications – fraud, recommendation, marketing, ranking, supply management and many more. Each of these bring their own challenges of combining a distributed, multi-dc, scalable and performant solution with the needs of modern cutting-edge algorithms (such as deep learning).




You will manage a team of engineers in joint scrums with the best data scientists around to achieve these goals and since Agoda is the fastest growing travel company in the world you can imagine the challenges of tomorrow will be even more demanding.




Our ideal candidates are experienced agile development managers who master technology to the point where you can make a trade off and decide when to use which technology, and push our platform forward. At the same time, also have solid agile experience to deliver at rapid pace.




We believe that managers should be professionals at technology, should be able to jump into any project and understand the bits & bolts of the technologies their teams use. If you are one of those people that don’t want to “just manage” and still excited about building things along with building teams, you will fit here very well.




In this Role, you’ll get to:




Lead team of at 6 – 12 energetic developers
Drive design and architecture of the system
Create a robust, scalable and blazing-fast API.
Drive the execution of the team toward the vision. Visionary and pragmatic.
Grow and coach team members. Always challenge team to be higher performer.
Work closely with product owner to provide technical direction
Be able to work with data scientists, understand and contribute to modern machine learning development lifecycle




Technologies we love




Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Impala)
Machine learning technologies (E.g. Python scikit, SparkML, Tensorflow)
Micro-services development languages & technologies (E.g.: Java, Scala/Akka, Python/Django/flask)
Relational database (E.g.: SQL Server, Postgres)
NoSQL database technologies (E.g.: Cassandra, Couchbase, Aerospike)
Message queueing technologies (E.g.: Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ)
Continuous Integration (Jenkins / Teamcity)
Performance and load testing




What you’ll Need to Succeed:




Passionate about technology and building software
5-10 years’ experience in software development and a mix of the above mentioned technologies.
At least 3 years’ experience in a leadership/influencer position: team lead, development manager or architect.
Must have worked in an Agile environment and understands Scrum




It’s Great if You Have:




Familiarity with travel industry and rate system is a plus
Experience in ML development is a plus
#sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #boston #seattle #newyork #telaviv #manchester #london #dublin #sydney #melbourne #perth #saopaolo #hongkong #montreal #toronto #vancouver #jakarta #dubai #manila #kualalumpur #HCMC #IT #4 #5




Equal Opportunity Employer




At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Manufacturing Product Leader
subTitle: Stratasys
description:
Stratasys is a world leader in 3D printing!

Stratasys is leading the global shift to additive manufacturing with innovative 3D printing solutions for industries such as aerospace, automotive, consumer products and healthcare. Through smart and connected 3D printers, polymer materials, a software ecosystem, and parts on demand, Stratasys solutions deliver competitive advantages at every stage in the product value chain. The world’s leading organizations turn to Stratasys to transform product design, bring agility to manufacturing and supply chains, and improve patient care.

As a member of Ops. Engineering and Quality group, in you role as Manufacturing Product Leader you will be responsible for production line engineering of one or more Stratasys systems.

The position is located in Stratasys' Kiryat Gat site, IL.

As part of this role you will:

Provide engineering support at system level for multidisciplinary products
Define machines integration process, improvements and maintenance
Manage products' ECO processes and implementation
Implement new product revisions and escort new developed products to the production floor
Monitor, interact, report and provide support to the production line
Analyze quality issues and manage remedial activities to enable production line continuity
Lead 2nd source & cost saving activities from engineering aspects
Manage sub-contractors for assembly lines and mechanical/ electromechanical parts manufacturing
Manage and control TK activities for system building/subunits local and overseas
Be responsible for timelines and deliverables in order to meet product’s goals in aspect of DFX objectives
Coordinates and participates with local R&D and NPI teams on design for production activities
Support the Production line on an on-going basis including escalations management
Responsible for building Product/Production file, Product documentation, BOM, jigs and tools design
Generate/gather necessary documentation for new products production

Essential Education, Skills and Experience:

Degree in Mechanical engineering- mandatory. Msc degree in Mechanical / systems Engineering- an advantage.
Minimum 5 years of proven experience in mechanical design / R&D environment
Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in mechanical or production Engineering
Strong written and verbal English language communications skills. Strong ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships on a multi-level basis
Ability to present technical information and effectively communicate across all levels of the organization

title: Principal Software Engineer - Kubernetes at Edge
subTitle: Red Hat
description:
About The Job

The Red Hat Engineering team is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join us.

In this role, you will contribute to the engineering of features related to the deployment and life cycle management of Red Hat OpenShift / Kubernetes clusters.

You will play a central part in defining the architecture for OpenShift deployment infrastructure and in developing our offerings from inception, through upstream development, to delivery.

We are very focused on delivery and execution, great in collaboration with other Red Hat groups and continuously engaged with the field and customers to improve our products and services.

Part of our solution is SaaS based, hence our development flow and our release cadence is adjusted to be very agile, with fundamentals of CI and CD.

The other part of the product is focused on provisioning OpenShift at scale, using the same technology as we have in our SaaS solution but on-premise on the far edge. Hence, it involves intensive development of kubernetes operators, controllers, and the integration of multiple open source products that are part of Red Hat’s portfolio

Our stack is mostly based on Go, with some Python, and a whole lot around Containers and OpenShift / Kubernetes.

To see how we work, you are welcome to explore some of the OpenShift GitHub repositories:

https://github.com/openshift/assisted-service
Please notice our code review process, external collaboration and upstream CI testing.

Some Of The Recent Group Achievements

Assisted Installer as Red Hat SaaS offering to deploy OpenShift on prem
Single Node OpenShift (SNO) as another variant of OpenShift Demo: How to try out single-node OpenShift from Red Hat
Zero Touch Provisioning of OpenShift - Telco grade deployment at scale of OpenShift Cluster for telecommunication purposes

https://cloud.redhat.com/blog/telco-5g-zero-touch-provisioning-ztp

All the relevant efforts are open source

What You Will Do

The exact area of the product that you work on will depend on your skills and interests. Some of your responsibilities may include:

Develop new features to OpenShift and various other Red Hat products, while contributing to the design, development and testing upstream and downstream
Working closely with various Red Hat engineering groups, QA, Integration teams, UI and partners in order to deliver valuable solutions to Red Hat customers
Participate in analysis, triage, and customers and internal stakeholders support effort with a goal of increasing our product adoption and customer satisfaction
Design and implement complex features, requiring both development and integration work
Contribute to team’s CI and release lifecycle.

What You Will Bring

Principal developer with deep understanding and coding experience in either of the languages: Golang, Python, Java, or C or C++
Experience with microservices architectures and concepts including APIs, versioning, monitoring, etc.
Good understanding of Linux and debugging skills
Capabilities to work on various projects, with different requirements, different priorities, and technical stack
The following are considered a plus

Experience with container ecosystem like Docker, Kubernetes or Red Hat OpenShift
Experience with developing cloud-native applications at scale
Experience with developing kubernetes operators
Experience with CI methodologies
Familiarity with virtualization, networking, or storage
Background in DevOps or site reliability engineering (SRE)

title: Product Manager - Athena Developer Platform (Executive Director)
subTitle: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
description:
Athena Platform




Athena is a cross-asset risk and trade management platform transforming technology at JP Morgan. It delivers innovative and efficient applications to a wide range of the firm's business, including sales, trading, operations, risk and research. Athena combines the best of open source technologies with innovative components developed internally, which gives you the ability to contribute to wide range of exciting projects. Our technologists enjoy working with front office, quants and other technology teams.




Athena is actively used by over 4,000 software engineers and quantitative developers who deploy over 700 releases to production every day and maintain one of the largest Python codebases in the world. Making them as efficient as possible, while at the same time enforcing compliance with policies and regulations is one of the key enablers for platform's agility and stability.




Athena Developer Platform provides a set of tools, controls and best practices that streamline development, debugging, testing, deployment and maintenance across Athena. These provide an opinionated environment that nudges developers to work in a consistent way, reduces duplication and encourages collaboration between teams.




Our strategy is to continue enhancing the development environment based on feedback from the developer community, industry standards, and requests from our controls partners. These continue to be driven by the key principles of opinionated consistency, small and incremental changes, reducing time-to-market, and strong focus on automated testing.




We are seeking a senior product manager responsible to maximize the value of Athena Developer Platform work, prioritization, transparency, and stakeholder engagement and communication across four Athena Developer Platform Delivery teams and the business and stakeholder community of over 4,500. In addition, as a member of Athena platform leadership team you will join an exciting transformation journey aimed at establishment of product management roles and evolution of our ways of working.




Responsibilities




Articulate and communicate Athena Developer Platform vision, strategy and technical future state in partnership with engineering leads
Establish and manage longer and mid term roadmap, quarterly plans, and team backlogs
Conduct product discovery and analysis to understand business and stakeholder needs
Define measurable outcomes, facilitate assessment of product solution options and definition of preferred solution
Prioritize demand from the developer community and technology controls partners across all asset classes
Ensure balance of feature delivery, controls and non-functional platform targets
Review high level design documents against the demand, and identify gaps and opportunities
Run annual planning, demos and review; and quarterly planning, demos and review
Articulate MVPs and features
Provide guidance to Athena Developer Platform delivery teams
Establish definition of done for key roadmap deliveries, and accept completed work
Ensure that Developer Platform services and capabilities are successful; valuable and viable
Answer questions about Athena Developer Platform current and future state
Provide regular updates and roadshows to customers, stakeholders and management
Drive product, cloud, agile delivery, SRE and DevOps transformation including establishment of this role in partnership with Athena leadership team and Markets Technology transformation & agility leadership




Requirements




Experience working with SDLC, CICD, DevOps and Developer Tooling products and technologies in a product, architect/systems engineer and/or developer role at scale for 15+ years combined
Experience supporting, providing services and products, and partnering with trade and risk management businesses across all asset classes; or experience working at a large scale customer and stakeholder base, for 10+ years combined
Experience leading transformation and change management at scale : product, agile, cloud, DevOps, SRE
Strong analytical skills and ability to prioritize and plan at Athena's scale
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills and ability to engage effectively at all levels up to senior MD
Knowledge of product management, agile delivery, DevOps and SRE practices and ways of working
Experience articulating mission, vision, strategy, objectives and measurable outcomes, roadmap, quarterly plans, backlogs
Experience managing delivery at scale e.g. roadmap course-corrections, issue and risk management, timely escalations and reporting i.e. the ability to convey complex events/circumstances succinctly and to various stakeholder roles/levels
Experience leading efforts collaboratively, with confidence and empathy




J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.




We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Cycode
description:
About Cycode

Cycode is a rapidly growing cybersecurity startup and creator of the world’s first complete software supply chain security solution. According to Gartner, software supply chain attacks (like the one that impacted Solarwinds) will affect 45% of organizations and grow three-fold by 2025. Unfortunately, traditional AppSec offers little protection against these devastating threats. That’s where Cycode comes in. Our platform provides customers with complete visibility, security, and integrity across all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) — to prevent them from becoming the next Solarwinds.

Cycode was founded in 2019 and is backed by top venture capital firms YL Ventures and Insight Partners. We’ve received numerous awards and recognition including being named one of the top cybersecurity startups in the Cyber Defense Magazine Top 100 (2020), Accel 2021 Euroscape Top 100, Analytics Insight “Top Cybersecurity Companies to Watch in 2021”, winner of the 2021 Cyber Defender Award and a finalist for the 2021 CISO Choice in Application Security.

About the position

As a Senior Product Manager at Cycode, you will be leading the design and delivery of the next big features of our product, end-to-end: From the discovery phase of understanding the customer needs, through defining the user experience with the product design and finding the right technical solution with R&D, to deliver the value to our customers and GTM teams.

You will be expected to conceptualize, design, and prioritize product initiatives as well as to own a technical vision and roadmap for the company's platforms and infrastructure.

Responsibilities

Develop product backlogs, drive execution to results, and manage outcomes in an agile \ship it" environment.
Work with customers to help direct product roadmap and improve customer experience.
Work with UX designers, engineers, and security experts to design and deliver product features.
Support marketing and sales activities.

Qualifications

3+ years in product management roles in B2B products, in either cyber security or related industries such DevOps, Compliance or Cloud infrastructure
Strong technical background in software architecture and enterprise software products
Is customer obsessed! Have in-depth understanding of how successful developer/user experience are defined and have a passion for understanding developers – their capabilities, needs, and how they work
Experience in delivering UI/UX design (as wireframes) while working closely with the UI/UX experts to ensure requirements are met
Have a proven track record of delivering SaaS products to market from business case through to GTM and successful customer adoption
Solid understanding of software development life cycle and ecosystem – strong advantage
Understanding of CI/CD workflows and DevOps technologies - strong advantage"

title: Senior Product Designer - SDV
subTitle: General Motors
description:
Job Description

General Motors Israel (Herzliya) takes a significant part in shaping the electric and autonomous vehicle. We impact the future vehicles in diverse fields by developing cutting edge technologies. Within GM Israel, over 600 people work in an hybrid flexible mode on one of the most exciting challenges of our days.

The Software Defined Vehicle IL (SDV IL) – Energy and Mobility Application Group develops a broad range of web and mobile based connected vehicle systems, including autonomous fleet management, mobility services, electric vehicle digital user experience, as well as the next generation of OnStar online services for consumers and cars.

SDV – ‘Software Defined Vehicle’ is a new group that is developing a vehicle intelligence platform whose features and functions are primarily enabled through software. This is a significant part of the ongoing transformation of vehicles from being mainly hardware-based to a software-centric electronic device on wheels. The SDV teams are supporting the definition, design, and development of a continuously improving mobility service.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to join the group!

What will you do

Work hand in hand with our product managers from the first phases of product ideation, through concept design to detailed product design (wireframing) and ending with pixel perfect visual design.
Design user flows and all interactive elements that make up the human-computer interaction.
Create the look and feel of the interface through color, typeface, illustration, photography, and layout
Help create and manage a design system to be implemented across the group's products.
Generate graphic design specifications for fonts, color, and layout and deliver graphical assets required to build interfaces across multiple digital platforms.
Work on multiple designs/projects at one time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately with a demonstrated ability to think strategically about the overall experience.
Collaborate with a team of product managers, developers and the team leadership to ensure timely delivery and alignment with product strategy.
Respect standards but constantly push where new ideas will improve the design.


Additional Job Description

What are we looking for:

If you don’t meet 100% of the requirements below - that’s ok!

We believe in hiring by potential, on the job training and development, so, If you find the position exciting and think you can contribute and evolve,

Please continue the application! We promise to consider your application even if you are missing a skill or two :-)

For any question, please contact the TA team: ta.israel@GM.com

BDes degree - Bachler of Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction, a related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Over 5 years of design experience with a strong portfolio of designs
Expert in user-centered design methodologies and a rapid ideation processes
Experience designing for responsive web and mobile apps
Experience with Figma or equivalent design tool
Experience implementing visual design systems across a range of platforms in an iterative software development environment
Experience with location-based services, including visual design of map-centric applications - Advantage
Excellent communications skills, including strong English


About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Education: BSc in Computer Science / SW engineering / equivalent military training.
Experience: 5+ years in C++ programming, multiple coding languages are an advantage – C, Python using OOP.
Previous experience with Embedded products.
Strong customer-oriented and usability-oriented approach.
Knowledge of Ethernet, 7 layers model, and Networking protocols - advantage
Proficient in English (oral & written).
Experience in embedded Linux (Userspace) – advantage.
Experience as team lead – advantage.
Experience in the automotive and/or cyber industry – advantage.




SheeldS in a Nutshell:

SheeldS (formerly Arilou) is the pioneer of cyber-security solutions for the automotive industry. Innovation is part of who we are, and every moment is invested in creating cutting-edge technology. We were awarded Frost and Sullivan’s Best practices Award for Technology Innovation.

As the first company to introduce in-vehicle network security systems, SheeldS continues to push the limits of automotive cyber security and is constantly evolving.

SheeldS has extended its offer, by providing a premier E2E solution for heavy commercial and bus fleets. With SheeldS, fleet operators can have complete cybersecurity and operational visibility, keeping their fleets safe and secure. Our solution comprises both in-vehicle and cloud-based modules, thus providing a holistic end-to-end solution for fleet operators.

We are looking for top talent to join our team, and work at the leading edge of automotive cyber-security research and design.

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Wix
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
We Are

Wix.com - the platform that makes it easy for over 250 million people (and counting) to create their own stunning online presence. You Are

You’re fluent in defining user workflows and sketching wireframes. You're comfortable analyzing user behavior and product funnels to make data-driven decisions.

You enjoy working closely with R&D and UX teams. You’re proactive, self-motivated, dedicated and passionate. You take ownership and can easily engage and collaborate with different teams. Your communication skills are excellent and you’re fun to work with.

title: Solutions Architect Manager, Israel
subTitle: MongoDB
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

We are looking for an experienced and driven leader, with great energy, passion and initiative to manage a highly talented Pre-Sales Solution Architecture team.

MongoDB Solution Architects partner with the rest of the go to market team to help our customers design and build solutions to address their business needs. Our team is made up of seasoned software architects, entrepreneurs, and developers who take direct responsibility for customer success. As an integral component of the sales team, they shoulder the responsibility in winning deals and driving the business forward. They are also trusted advisors to a wide range of users, from startups to the world's largest enterprise IT organizations.

As a Manager for Solutions Architecture, you will recruit and lead our Solutions Architects team across the region. You will partner closely with our sales leaders to define, improve and execute our sales strategies in the enterprise market; and you'll play a key role in driving the business forward by developing our pre-sales practices, bringing the voice of experience and best practices while ensuring talent retention.

We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Tel Aviv for our hybrid working model.

Candidate Profile

4+ years of pre-sales experience, with strong commercial skills
2+ years Management experience, ideally in pre-sales, distributed team management preferred
Goal oriented, with a track record of overachievement (Circle of Excellence, Leader of the Year, etc.)
Driven – you possess a strong desire to be successful
Disciplined – you are skilled in managing time and resources and have a sound approach to technically qualifying opportunities
Intelligent – you possess an aptitude to learn quickly and establish credibility
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Database industry background a plus
Software development background a plus
The ability to travel up to 50%
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience


Position Expectations

You will recruit, retain, and develop top pre-sales talent
You will partner with our sales teams to help ensure success in accounts ranging from mid-to-large enterprises
You will work closely with the Professional Services and Product Management teams to achieve customer satisfaction and with Marketing to conduct seminars, trade shows and other marketing related events
You will foster strong and effective relationships with customers, resulting in growth opportunities
You will coach the team to exceed monthly, quarterly and annual bookings objectives


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Technical Support Engineer
subTitle: Cymulate
description:
Make Your Mark

Cymulate's Continuous Security Validation enables companies to challenge, assess and optimize their cyber-security posture against the evolving cyberthreat landscape, simply and continuously.

Take ownership and accountability for customer problems ensuring a coordinated and unified response to clients

Ensure critical customer issues are addressed quickly and effectively by collaborating with Global Support, Product Development, Professional Services, and Security in a global environment
Be proactive in identifying preventative measures and early warning mechanisms to reduce customer issues and escalations
Aid with the development and improvement of the Cymulate solution by gathering feedback to identify recurring issues

Requirements

Minimum 2 years' experience in Tech Support

Strong analytical, written, and oral communication including strong presentation and negotiation skills in dealing with customers all levels including management.
Great interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Ability to read logs and troubleshoot complex IT/Security products issues.

Log Management and SIEM (e.g. Splunk, IBM QRadar, HP ArcSite, etc.)

title: Staff Software Engineer & Big Data
subTitle: Intuit
description:
Overview

LI-HybridCome join us in fighting Fraud!

Intuit’s products are used by tens of millions of customers around the world. The

customers trust us with their most sensitive financial data, and use our products and

tools to manage their finances. As such, it is essential that Intuit protects its customers’

data and assets at the highest degree of security, and specifically against malicious

attempts of fraud.

Our goal is to reduce Intuit’s overall fraud exposure in various use-cases by using and

creating state-of-the-art solutions.

By doing this, we enhance our customers’ trust and continue to increase Intuit’s brand

perception as one of the world’s leaders in keeping our customers’ data and financials

safe.

What you'll bring
BS, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Strong knowledge of
Computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning).
Software engineering fundamentals: version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code.
Knowledge of
Machine Learning/Data Science languages, tools, and frameworks (g., Python, R, Spark, SQL, SkLearn, NLTK, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Keras, Scala, Java).
Machine learning techniques (e.g., classification, regression, and clustering) and principles (e.g., training, validation, and testing).
Data query and data processing tools/systems (e.g., relational, NoSQL, stream processing).
Distributed computing systems and related technologies (e.g., Spark, Hive).
Mathematics fundamentals: linear algebra, calculus, probability

Preferred Additional Qualifications
Familiar with
Cloud technologies, in particular AWS.
DevOps concepts (e.g., CICD).
Software container technology (e.g., Docker)
Experience with
Designing and developing deep learning architectures.
Deploying highly scalable software for SaaS products.

Main differences with Data Scientists
Excellence in
software engineering practices
productionalizing code and system integration

Main differences with Data Engineers

Understanding of ML frameworks and techniques, math, and statistics.
More data exploration, less database data modeling.
Less emphasis on establishing ETL process and data transformation pipelining.

Use cases

Model Productionalization: Works with data scientists to productionalize prototype models to the point where customers can use it at scale. This might involve increasing the amount of data used to train the model, automation of training and prediction, and orchestration of data for continuous prediction. We would expect you to understand the details of the data you use, and provide metrics to compare models.

Model Enhancement: Work on existing codebases to either enhance model prediction performance or to reduce training time. In this use case you will need to understand the specifics of the algorithm implementation in order to enhance

How you will lead

Design and build systems which improve Intuit’s Risk & Fraud capabilities
Work cross-functionally with product managers, data scientists, and engineers to understand, implement, refine, and design machine learning and other algorithms.
Effectively communicate results to peers and leaders.
Explore the state-of-the-art technologies and apply them to deliver customer benefits.
Interact with a variety of data sources, working closely with peers and partners to refine features from the underlying data and build end-to-end pipelines.

title: Back End Tech-Lead
subTitle: Netafim
description:
Grow your career with us:

As a true purpose driven organization, Netafim is beyond irrigation; We are a family of over 5,000 driven individuals who work together to make sure there would be no hunger, no poverty, while touching climate and economic growth. we are very proud that we are doing well by doing good, and even more proud that we are helping as much as we can to have a better world - one drop at the time.

title: Mobile Automation Developer

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Neema - Better Than a Bank
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Our Mission




Neema is all about impact - How often do you get the chance to affect the life of others, across the globe?

Our vision is let everyone enjoy financial freedom, regardless of their banking status, credit score or other obsolete metrics.

Our platform does just that, without depending on the traditional banking system.

Using cutting edge technologies and our global financial network, we provide our customers, individuals or businesses, advanced services including multi-currency account, international Visa card, and real-time cross-border payments, with expertise in hard-to-reach destinations.

We've got multiple products (mobile, web, B2B, B2C) that address audiences that are very different from each other and we need you to help us to take 'em all to the next level.

title: Product Engineer

Moon Active is one of the world’s fastest-growing mobile game companies, providing entertainment to millions of active users across the universe. The company is headquartered in the heart of Tel Aviv.

title: Product CTO, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
subTitle: Crossover
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nRemote
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?




Every technical decision-maker has the same gripes. The architecture is outdated. Past product decisions don’t make any sense. Technical debt is mounting. Plus, the higher you rise in your organization, the less time you get to spend actually doing the technical work you love (and the more time you spend managing the people who are doing it).




Not at Trilogy.




In this Product CTO role, you’ll have carte blanche to make architectural decisions based on technical merit — not whatever decision the board decided was most cost-effective. No more working on the same product every day for years, wishing you could go back in time and backhand whoever thought it was a good idea to write custom code for something that could’ve been purchased from AWS for $20/month.




Instead, you’ll design for a diverse portfolio of products (hundreds, in fact) using the newest, most interesting cloud technologies. As a senior technical decision-maker, you’ll face a new architecture challenge each week and make important architectural decisions every day. Instead of tending to multiple stakeholders and a wishlist of features from customers, you decide the critical features for the product. Use and grow your expertise to design products for maximum performance, efficiency, and scale.




Ready to get back to doing the technical work you love, while guiding the development for products that reach millions of customers?




What You Will Be Doing




Tackling design problems and writing technical specs to create products for distinct tech stacks and business domains.
Uncovering “high-order bit” decisions by interviewing technical leads and analyzing data structures and code/design documents.
Making important design and technical decisions that specify how to rearchitect products in a cloud-first way on systems such as AWS and GCP.




What You Won’t Be Doing




Managing projects or employees — thanks to Trilogy’s highly automated processes and streamlined org structure, there’s very little time spend on this type of admin
Participating in daily scrum meetings, making low-level decisions, performing code reviews, or debugging
Talking to customers (while you’ll build products customers love, other roles in the organization will take care of these important interviews for you!)
Developing a backlog of wishlist features
Creating high-level strategies or roadmaps — instead, you’ll be making the rubber-meets-road tech decisions




Product CTO Key Responsibilities




Tear down current products, make key technical decisions for their rebuilding, and choose new product specs that simplify architecture. In essence, you’ll define a product and its features for the next 3 to 5 years.




Basic Requirements




7+ years of experience making important architecture and design decisions on software projects, such as the application of architecture design patterns or significant open source technologies.
Experience making technical design decisions involving the use of cloud computing services
Experience making technical design decisions for complex software products or systems
Ability to simplify complex ideas and communicate them in writing with clear and logical thinking




About Trilogy




Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.




There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!




Working with Crossover




This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.




What to expect next:




You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.




Important! If you do not receive an email from us:




First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-3370-IL-TelAviv-ChiefTechnolog.010

title: Growth Product Marketing - Team Lead
subTitle: monday.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:

monday.com is looking for a Product Marketing Team Lead with a vast experience in product positioning, messaging, growth strategies, and developing online marketing assets on a large scale.

About The Role

Analyze, package, and optimize the user funnel and journey based on data opportunities, market research, and the users needs.
Build an end-to-end funnel for a specific persona/use case from acquisition to the platform, to ensure holistic experience and maximize the potential of existing and new customers.
Identify and implement new tests and strategies to improve results and to uncover growth opportunities.
Convert product capabilities into engaging, simple, and business-outcome aligned messaging that captures ‘the Why’
Increase our brand presence and positioning in the relevant channels and find new vertical opportunities.




Requirements




3+ years of experience as a product marketing manager with a growth orientation position (previous experience in B2C SaaS company – advantage).
Strong project management skills.
Experience with building marketing assets - Ads, LPs, minisites, email marketing, In-app, tutorial, onboarding wizard.
Experience with growth strategies and A/B tests (advantage).

Passionate, self-starter with a can-do attitude.
