We’re looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to help market the monday.com work OS platform through our online acquisition channels, to specific personas in specific verticals, as well as within the monday.com platform.

title: DevOps Engineer
subTitle: ciVALUE
description:
About ciVALUE

ciValue is the leading provider of AI-powered customer analytics, personalization, and brand collaboration platform. Serving dozens of retailers and brands across the world using cutting edge big-data, real-time analytics, and data-science automation.

Disrupting existing data & media monetization model by enabling retailers to remain in control of their revenue.

Recently acquired by NielsenIQ, ciValue’s solution leverages automation and AI to accelerate revenue generating opportunities and delivers dedicated applications for customer & product performance intelligence, audiences & segmentation building, offer management, and insights sharing that enable users to promptly identify risks and opportunities, and act on those insights, in just a few clicks.

We believe that building a great product and teams starts with amazing, diverse minded and bright people who make an impact, generate creative & innovative ideas and take on new perspectives.




About the position

The ciValue DevOps team has a wide range of responsibilities within its scope: Cloud, infrastructure, CI / CD pipelines as well as delivery automation (scripting), open-source solution research, backup & restore, disaster recovery, general out of the box problem solution fit.

At ciValue we pride ourselves on the ability to find the best solution for a given problem, which inherently means the person doing the research needs to be able to learn quickly, get to know new technologies and dig deep to provide what’s needed for the team, but at the same time be able to work individually managing the time and priorities they were given.




What will you be doing?

Dive deep and identify failure patterns to resolve problems at their root
Provide high-performance cloud deployment solutions and maintain rapid deployment pipelines, server monitoring, and troubleshooting
Work independently as a part of a team to enable members achieve their goals
Build the infrastructure for developer’s environments to increase efficiency and productivity
Build and maintain CI/CD infrastructure for product development lifecycle
Centralize our logging and monitoring solutions
Research new technologies to leverage

Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience as a DevOps engineer
alternatively, 3 years’ experience as a backend developer or an operation’s engineer with equivalent production-oriented role
Proven experience with at least one cloud provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and tools
Experience with Terraform
Hands on experience with Linux and scripting (python/bash)
B.Sc/BA in Computer Science or equivalent
Ability to work hybrid mode in our office in Yokneam

Nice to have

Kubernetes major advantage
Grafana, Kibana and Prometheus major advantage
Elastic Stack advantage
Basic knowledge on Jenkins, maven, GitHub
Experience using configuration tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet




Location: Yokneam Hi-tech Park, Israel

Function: R&D

Position Type: Full-time

Required Experience: Recent Graduates

title: Product Manager
subTitle: Grubhub
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Hey! We’re Grubhub

We're all about connecting hungry diners with our network of over 300,000 restaurants nationwide. User-friendly platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities set us apart in the world of online food ordering. Grubhub is a place where authentically fun culture meets innovation and teamwork. We believe in empowering people and opening doors for new opportunities. If you're looking for a place that values relationships, embraces diverse ideas–all while having fun together–then Grubhub is the place for you!




More about this role

Grubhub TLV operates as Grubhub’s Israeli innovation hub, formed in 2018 after Grubhub acquired “Tapingo”, an Israeli startup, which provided food ordering services to university campuses. We serve over 200 campuses across the US with best-in-class products, service, and value. We build highly-scalable world-class products such as Kiosks, robot delivery, hotels’ food ordering and more.




If you are driven, humble & curios to build new products, that is a great starting point for this role. We are looking for people who understand that product work is always walking the path not taken and therefore are continuous learners. We urge you to apply if digging into a customer problem, finding the right data to justify building a solution and seeing a customer use your product for the first time, are the kind of things that ignite your imagination and keep you up late at night.







Responsibilities

You will lead the full product life cycle, from discovery and design, through MVP definition and field experimentation results assessment and launch.
You will be leading the process of designing and executing the product bein built.
You will lead a squad/Product team consisting of a designer and a group of engineers, together you will be responsible for driving and delivering on the product roadmap.
You will work with our campus customers, including dining directors and managers, restaurants operations managers, nutritionists, and others, as well as internal stakeholders at all levels as well as peers to help bring your products to life.
You will collaborate with other Product Managers and Product teams to achieve shared goals that extend beyond the B2B part of the product.
You will master the use of data and analytics to help you learn and figure out if what you’ve built is behaving as expected - while also interacting with your users in order to add an intuitive understanding of how they are using your products.




What you bring to the table

2+ years of experience in the high tech industry as a product manager for product-driven companies in the marketplaces, B2B2C, or B2B space.
Experience with web and/or mobile applications.
Entrepreneurial mindset and spirit of making things happen.
A leader of people, able to rally the forces behind a shared goal, with or without authority.
Understanding how a product or feature is used by a customer, and how changing it would affect their behavior, should come naturally to you.
You should be adept at using data to track goals and KPIs, create dashboards, test new products, and create and manage roadmaps and priorities.
Proven ability to work with large datasets, customer & performance analytics platforms, and testing solutions. Intermediate (or more) at writing SQL queries.
Understanding the business and strategy and being able to challenge the way the product vision and strategy are set up to meet the requirements.
Ability to understand the current tech stacks and architecture, as a lever for planning great products. Familiarity with the product lifecycle and methodologies.
Written and verbal fluency in English.
Willing to commit to US travel approximately once every quarter




And Of Course, Perks!




Hybrid Work Model. We provide our employees flexibility to split their time between working from home and at the office.
Time Off. Grubhub TLV employees are provided 20 days of paid vacation per year, as well as every other Sunday off.
Parental Leave Benefits. Grubhub provides new parents 8 weeks of paid vacation, and to ease our new parents back to work, we allow them to work 80% time for 4 weeks while receiving 100% pay.

title: IAM/IGA Technical Architect, Professional Services (EMEA/UK)
subTitle: Saviynt
description:
Saviynt’s Enterprise Identity Cloud helps modern enterprises scale cloud initiatives and solve the toughest security and compliance challenges in record time. The company brings together identity governance (IGA), granular application access, cloud security, and privileged access (PAM) to secure the entire business ecosystem and provide a frictionless user experience. The world’s largest brands trust Saviynt to accelerate digital transformation, empower distributed workforces, and meet continuous compliance.

Saviynt’s Enterprise Identity Cloud helps modern enterprises scale cloud initiatives and solve the toughest security and compliance challenges in record time. The company brings together identity governance (IGA), granular application access, cloud security, and privileged access (PAM) to secure the entire business ecosystem and provide a frictionless user experience. The world’s largest brands trust Saviynt to accelerate digital transformation, empower distributed workforces, and meet continuous compliance.

The Lead Consultant/Architect will adopt a leading role in large Identity Governance and Administration projects across EMEA. You will be responsible for the overall design and implementation work using Saviynt and will require skills in IT, Business process automation and Security Compliance standards. The Consultant is expected to lead and coordinate all delivery efforts including defining project scope,

assessment of current implementation, defining project structure, technical design, implementation, operations etc. As a leader in the team, you will need to provide support and knowledge transfer to other team members by using every person strengths and helping them to develop. Main responsibility is to deliver quality work, to high standards and on time. OPEN TO REMOTE LOCATION

Qualifications

Excellent knowledge and experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) and Security space
Extensive experience in consulting and implementation of identity management solutions.
Excellent knowledge and experience of leading project delivery, including scoping and planning projects
Strong knowledge of cloud architecture as well as on-premise IT landscape
Knowledge of security and compliance requirements
Willingness to be a hands-on contributor. Excellent communication/documentation skills.
Knowledge of Saviynt would be great, if not then experience of as similar product e.g. Oracle IDM, Sailpoint , etc.
Knowledge of authentication technologies e.g. SSO, MFA, etc.
Knowledge of integration to off the shelf Enterprise products e.g. Workday, SFDC, ServiceNow, SAP, Oracle ERP, etc.
Knowledge of integration technologies, including REST, DB, LDAP
SQL Knowledge

Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are a small but mighty company with phenomenal people. Your time at Saviynt will be worthwhile. You will experience tremendous growth and learning while being part of something you are helping to define and build from the ground up. Through challenging yet rewarding work, you will be able to directly impact our clients, all within a welcoming and positive work environment. If you are resilient and enjoy working in a dynamic high growth environment you belong with us!

Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are a high-growth, cloud software company with phenomenal people, that is building the most innovative identity platform in the world. Your time at Saviynt will be worthwhile. You will experience tremendous growth and learning while being part of something you are helping to define and build from the ground up. Through challenging yet rewarding work, you will be able to directly impact our clients, all within a welcoming and positive work environment. If you're resilient and enjoy working in a dynamic high-growth environment you belong with us!

title: Software Engineer
subTitle: ZipRecruiter
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
We offer a hybrid work environment. Most US-based positions can also be performed remotely (any exceptions will be noted in the Minimum Qualifications below.)

For Israel-based positions, we encourage working from our Saarona, Tel Aviv office a few days a week, meeting your colleagues, and having a flexible work environment.

Our Mission:

To a ctively connect people to their next great opportunity.

Who We Are:

ZipRecruiter is a leading online employment marketplace. Powered by AI-driven smart matching technology, the company actively connects job seekers with millions of businesses of all sizes through innovative mobile app, web, and email services, as well as partnerships with the best job sites on the web. ZipRecruiter has the #1 rated job search app on iOS & Android.

Summary Of Job

ZipRecruiter is changing the way job seekers get hired and how small businesses manage their HR. Our R&D center in Tel Aviv offers an empowering, fun and collaborative culture where talented individuals who think like business owners and entrepreneurs are invited to join our growing team.

We use models and algorithms of machine-learning and deep-learning to find candidates for a job, and get the job information to reach the candidate as quickly as possible to allow the employer to reach the best candidates in the least possible time.

As a backend engineer you will be helping us design and build a flexible and scalable system that will allow our business to move fast and innovate. You will be expected to show ownership and responsibility for the code you write, but it doesn’t stop there. at Zip, you are encouraged to think big and help out in other areas as well.

Key focuses:

Designing and writing code that is critical for business growth
Mastering scalability and enterprise-grade production services implementation
Sense of ownership - leading design for new products and initiatives as well as integrating with currently implemented best-practices
Review your peer's design and code
Work closely with product managers, peer engineers, and business stakeholders

Minimum Requirements:

6+ years of experience as a hands on software engineer (Python, Java, Golang, Scala)
Hands on experience in managing major clouds vendors’ infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Working with a number of off-the-shelf tools such as Kafka, DynamoDb, SQS, ElasticSearch, but often push them past their limits
Experience working with Docker and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes
Enjoy communicating and collaborating, sharing your ideas and being open to honest feedback
The ability to lead new features from design to implementation, taking into consideration topics such as performance, scalability, and impact on the greater system
Bachelor’s degree or higher - an advantage

As part of our team you’ll enjoy:

Competitive salary
A fun environment where work-life balance is valued

Are you passionate about Cybersecurity? Interested in working on one of the most exciting product groups at Microsoft? Excited about building products from the ground up? title: Sales Representative Pelvic Health
subTitle: Medtronic
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
Careers that Change Lives




We’re a mission-driven leader in medical technology and solutions with a legacy of integrity and innovation.




Work with us to incentivize better patient care, and partner across the industry to make healthcare more affordable and accessible. Be a part of a community of experts committed to ensuring quality, affordable healthcare worldwide.




Come strengthen your specialized skills and enhance your expertise. We’ll support you with the training, mentorship, guidance, and networks you need to advance, and empower you to work in the way that’s best for you. Together, we can confront the challenges that will change the face of healthcare. Join us for a career that changes lives.




A Day in the Life




Visit 2-3 hospitals / clinics a day.
Involve and support procedures in operating room and clinics
Conduct sales call to promote, sell and service Medtronic’s products and services to existing and competitive customers.
Coordinate customer activities at all meeting as assigned
Provide ongoing field intelligence reports on competitive activity, change in markets, distribution, as well as input on customer preferences and product features.
Maintain knowledge of diverse Medtronic products and support sales efforts in Pain Business.
Complete administrative and logistics tasks using reports.
Maintain adequate inventory (trunk stoke and hospital consignment) and assist in reallocation and delivery of product.
Report and meet Neuromodulation & Pelvic Health manager periodically
Cooperate with the Pelvic Health & Neuromodulation team members
Meet with customers of relevant therapy discipline on regularly basis to assess market’s needs, as well as maintain positive relationship with KOLs.
Insert New products to the market: Launch, teaching & accompany medical teams: physicians and nurses.
Open new Pelvic Health accounts
Implement quarterly sales plan and achieve sales goals and objectives.
Yearly working plans for customers and business
Lead the Pelvic Health therapy according Medtronic objectives.




Must Have:




Aptitude for rapidly learning technical information.
Ability to teach and educate health care professionals.
Multi Tasks and well organized.
Ability to work under pressure
Good Communication skills
Ability to speak and explain fluently to patients and physicians how to use Medtronic devices during procedures in the operation room and clinics.
Drive and enthusiasm
Initiative and independence
Result orientated
Team worker
Ability to travel all over Israel.
Fluent English and Hebrew.
Bachelor’s degree in biological science or business, Nursing or life Science.
At least 2 years of experience at medical sales experience in hospital environment.
At least 2 years of experience or familiar with working in operating room.




About Medtronic




Bold thinking. Bolder actions. We are Medtronic.




We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions. Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people. Powered by our diverse knowledge, insatiable curiosity, and desire to help all those who need it, we deliver innovative technologies that transform the lives of two people every second, every hour, every day. Expect more from us as we empower insight-driven care, experiences that put people first, and better outcomes for our world.




In everything we do, we are engineering the extraordinary.




Physical Requirements




The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers.




At Medtronic, you will find a diverse team of innovators who bring their unique backgrounds and their individual life experiences to work every day. We work hard to cultivate a workforce that reflects our patients and partners, we believe it’s the only way to drive healthcare forward. We want to attract a diverse workforce, regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or local law. Join us, and bring the power of your point of view to our culture of collaboration and innovation. It is through strong diversity, inclusion, and engagement that we can remain a leader in medical technology and solutions. And by embracing everything you have to offer —your unique perspectives, talents, and contributions —we can live up to the promise of our Mission

title: Principal Software Engineer
subTitle: Meltwater
description:
Meltwater is currently seeking a Principal Software Engineer to join our Influencer Marketing team: Klear. Our mission is to help influencers and brands work better together. In this crucial role you will lead the design, architecture, resaearch, development, testing and support of our web application. You will collaborate with senior engineers, product managers and designers and build upon the latest technologies.

This is a unique opportunity to join a company in a unique growth trajectory, with the benefits of both a startup and a global enterprise.

Our product serves both brands and influencers, and holds a unique challenge of developing a SaaS product for both B2B and B2C sides. We're growing fast and already serve thousands of customers and 750,000 influencers worldwide, but we’re just getting started. Klear’s Sr. Software Engineer will define, design and deliver extraordinary products that will reshape the future of how brands and influencers interact.

We are looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to support our team in building advanced tools and services that improve and extend our Influencer Platform. In this role you will have an immediate impact, radical ownership and personal development trajectory.

The solutions we build are fully web-based, offered as a service. The technology portfolio ranges from React, Redux, RxJS in the frontend to Node.js, Nest, Python in the backend, powered by MySQL, ElasticSearch, Redis and DynamoDB. Our platform is powered by proprietary algorithms that are being developed in house, and have been showcased at leading computer science journals.

Knowledge of technologies we use React, Redux, Node.js, Nest, TypeScript,
Experience with MySQL/PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Redis, DynamoDB
A degree in computer science or a comparable qualification
Experience with building and running applications in production
Enthusiasm for AI, Machine Learning, NLP and Information Retrieval
Enthusiasm for Microservices architecture and distributed systems
Experience with a PaaS/SaaS cloud, preferably AWS
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical problems

title: Technical Writer
subTitle: Axonius
description:
Axonius is the cybersecurity asset management platform that gives organizations a comprehensive asset inventory, uncovers gaps, and automatically validates and enforces policies. Deployed in minutes, the Axonius cyber asset attack surface management (CAASM) solution integrates with hundreds of data sources to give customers the confidence to control complexity by mitigating threats, navigating risk, decreasing incidents, automating response actions, and informing business-level strategy. Hundreds of customers worldwide like The New York Times, Schneider Electric, and AB InBev trust Axonius to control complexity.




Headquartered in New York, New York, Axonius employs over 600 people worldwide and achieved unicorn status in early 2021. Axonius has been recognized with the Great Place to Work Certification™, was named one of Fortune’s 2021 Best Small and Medium Workplaces™, and was named to Dun’s Best Start Up Companies to Work for Over 100 Employees. Most recently, Axonius was also named to the 2021 and 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 list of the top 100 private SaaS companies in the world, as well as named to Inc. magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces and has been cited as the fastest growing cybersecurity company in history by revenue.




As part of our rapid growth, we are looking for an experienced technical writer to join our documentation team to document products and write microcopy. This is a full time position

The technical writing team is part of the Product department. You will report to the Director of Knowledge and Technical Writing and work closely with the members of the Product and R&D teams.




Responsibilities:




End-to-end responsibility for documenting a wide range of features.
Write and edit microcopy for the features for which you are responsible.
Conform to a style guide
Manage multiple documentation/writing tasks from various sources with high quality and timely delivery
Work directly with Product Managers and R&D team members to understand the product functionality, and the information that needs to be provided to Axonius end-users




Requirements:




At least 5 years extensive proven experience as a technical writer creating and editing software documentation, technical manuals and release notes
Ability to understand complex technical concepts and explain them clearly
Experience in UI writing
Native English speaker with excellent written communication skills
Multi-tasker, well organized and proactive
A team player.
Ability to learn new tools and technologies




Advantages:




Experience in the cybersecurity industry
Experience documenting APIs
Experience in SaaS and large-scale products.
Fluent speaker of Hebrew
Experience with Markdown




A little more about Axonius:




We are a remote-first culture. We have offices in New York and in Tel Aviv, but the majority of our employees are working from home across the US and Internationally.
Our people aren’t just great professionals, they are great people. We are all here to support each other, ready to help and do what’s best for the entire company.
Focus on Career growth. We love seeing our people grow into new roles and work hard to ensure everyone sees and can realize a long term career path here at Axonius.




At Axonius we support a diverse and inclusive workplace and believe in equal employment opportunity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

title: Senior Application Security Engineer
subTitle: Sisense
description:
Maintain Security Solutions to Protect our Employees and Customers

Sisense is the unified, collaborative data platform for professional data teams. We help thousands of data teams tackle increasingly complex data challenges, from ETL to predictive analytics.

Our expectations for ourselves are ever-increasing and we're looking for someone to help us along that journey. If you love creating delightful user experiences for technical and non-technical users and delivering company-changing outcomes, this role is for you!

The experience you'll develop, design, and implement security touchpoints into the Sisense product and support the trajectory of our cloud product while maturing the existing on-premise product. While this role will primarily focus on application security, there will be plenty of opportunity to expand into other areas of Security Operations (Vulnerability Management, Bug Bounty, and Incident Response) and Security IT (Configurations, SaaS security tooling, and overall automation)

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR INFORMATION SECURITY TEAM:

Customers trust us with their most important data. They use Sisense to query everything from revenue metrics to the personally identifiable information of their users. In Sisense we use the edge of technology for our product, for our internal services and to enhance the security posture. We are a global company and we believe that diversity and providing equal opportunities are great for expanding our ways of thinking.

You will partner with Engineering, Product Management, Operations, IT and others to truly empower the employees at Sisense. You'll be expected to support solutions, applying risk-based security touchpoints that are both highly secure and highly functional while moving at the speed of the business. Enabling everyone at Sisense to keep moving fast while continuously increasing the strength of our security may be your greatest challenge. While some capabilities are already in place that will need to be learned and maintained, there will be a need to deploy new emerging security solutions to proactively and reactively protect our employees and customers.




REQUIREMENTS

5+ years of previous experience in Application/Product Security or Application Development with a strong focus on secure application development
2+ years experience working in software development
Experience with multiple languages such as Java, React, Node JS, PHP, Scala, C and/or Python
Understand how to detect and remediate security vulnerabilities in applications
Experience with security testing tools and DevOps integrations
Familiar with common build/automation tooling: ex. Jenkins, GIToExperience in application security testing and releasing SaaS software in public clouds



HOW YOU'LL RAMP

Within your first 30 days, you'll…

Meet with the global security team to understand the organizational mission, attack surface, and strategically align on risk-based security initiatives
Spend time with the engineering and product team to get up-to-speed on our technology stacks and current security controls
Spend time with the IT, R&D, and potentially customers to get up-to-speed on our technology stacks and current security controls

By Day 30, you'll...

Have a solid fundamental understanding of our products, people, processes, and technologies
Perform an initial assessment of the strengths and weaknesses of the current product through analysis, automated scanning, and/or custom attack patterns
Provide recommendations for identified opportunities from the current state processes
Review code and other production changes to ensure no security issues are introduced
Work with key stakeholders to ensure compliance of Sisense's internal procedures and compliance goals (SOC2, HIPAA, ISO, GDPR, CCPA)

By Day 60, you'll…

Drive security improvements to production cloud environments
Collaborate with third-party penetration testing vendors
Perform targeted offensive security testing
Evangelize better security throughout the company

By Day 90, you'll...

Implement continuous monitoring systems and tools to automatically identify potential security issues at the code, application, and infrastructure layers
Support External and Internal Penetration Testing efforts and assist with driving issues to closure
Assist with our bug bounty program and maturation of Hacker powered security
Promote a security-first culture and ensure that all employees at Sisense are able to protect the organization from threats
Provide thought leadership in the areas of innovative DevSecOps automation, tool optimization, application vulnerability management, and strategies for risk reduction
Own and propose data-driven enhancement strategies for dynamic (DAST), static (SAST), open-source application security testing (SCA), and container security scanning including troubleshooting, and continuous process improvement
Propose product feature enhancements to enhance the security of our applications
Help validate services and applications for best-in-class security standards implementation
Test for, replicate and validate security vulnerabilities in applications




WHAT YOU HAVE ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR:

Experience working as an application security engineer, consultant, or similar position
Security mindset as a business enabler as part of the core security foundation of driving change with an effective communication style
Hands-on experience in configuring and hardening cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.)
Experience with container technology (Kubernetes)
Strong experience in Python, Java, JavaScript, Go, and Ruby on Rails
Demonstrated capability in secure coding (input validation, session management, etc.) and performing automated or manual static analysis
Hands-on experience in conducting penetration testing and vulnerability assessment at the network and application layers
Ability to dissect new systems, product requirements, and features to identify and develop security requirements
Basic understanding of security processes (access management, incident management, data security, etc.)
Experience with scanning open-source libraries and third-party images
You understand secure engineering best practices, can articulate problem statements, and propose solutions to both technically savvy and non-technical audiences
You are either a passionate security-minded software engineer who has been part of building high-quality applications and services, or you are an application security engineer who cares about secure software development
You have a growth mindset, push yourself towards excellence, and focus on continuous functional improvements
You are a curious person who looks at problem statements and can clearly propose actionable solutions
You have a passion for cyber security demonstrated through participation/leadership in conferences, webinars, Capture the Flag (CTF), TryHackMe, Bug Bounty, Submission of CVEs and/or personal projects
Strong understanding of past, current, and emerging security exploits
Security certifications such as OSCP, CISSP, CEH, GWAPT, etc.

title: Back End Developer
subTitle: Tenable
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Description

Job Description

Who is Tenable?

Tenable® is the Exposure Management company. 40,000 organizations around the globe rely on Tenable to understand and reduce cyber risk. Our global employees support 60 percent of the Fortune 500, 40 percent of the Global 2000, and large government agencies. Come be part of our journey!

What makes Tenable such a great place to work?

Ask a member of our team and they’ll answer, “Our people!” We work together to build and innovate best-in-class cybersecurity solutions for our customers; all while creating a culture of belonging, respect, and excellence where we can be our best selves. When you’re part of our #OneTenable team, you can expect to partner with some of the most talented and passionate people in the industry, and have the support and resources you need to do work that truly matters. We deliver results that exceed expectations and we win together!

Your Role

If you’re looking for an opportunity to make an impact in one of the most critical areas of security affecting the world today, look no further than Tenable Operational Technology (OT) product dev team. We develop a unique security monitoring and management solution for industrial control systems and we’re looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our growing research and development teams in Tel Aviv.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will work on everything that's running on our OT appliance - from network data collection, through sophisticated logical algorithm, to data manipulations and API. If you’re excited about getting exposure to all aspects of product research and development, this is for you.

Your Opportunity

As part of working on a small team, you'll have a broad scope and an opportunity to grow as a software engineer. You will team up with engineers to drive initiatives, define the architecture, and build new features
Help with design decisions and the ability to understand and improve product performance and stability
Own your projects end-to-end including design, development, testing, and deployment
Collaborate with an amazing group of cross-functional team members including product management, design and other engineers in your Agile team
Perform code and design reviews

What You’ll Need
At least 5 years of system/backend programming experience (C/C++ or similar)
A desire to learn new programming languages to solve unique technical problems when they arise
We use Go for a lot of development. If you have experience with it, great! If you don’t, then you’ll need the desire to learn it quickly.
In-depth knowledge of TCP/IP protocols and Unix internals
Experience with multi-threaded and network programming
Strong understanding of network application architecture and data structures
Academic level understanding of algorithms and data-structures
Proficiency in business level English

And Ideally

Knowledge of Cyber Security trends and events.
Reverse engineering of applications and other software.
Experience with Databases/SQL
Experience with Containers
Experience developing packet sniffing applications or similar network applications.
Significant hands-on experience with Linux

If you’ve reached this point, and you’re still not sure if you should apply…..Just do it! We’re human and we don’t fit a perfect mold. Having diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives, that’s a good thing! If you’re coming from outside of the cyber industry - great! If you’re looking to try something new - awesome! All we ask is you bring passion to all that you do, crave creativity and innovation, and embrace the hard work of gaining new skills and accepting big challenges.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here.




Hybrid way of working (home/ office), The position is in Airport city.




We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.




We are an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate unlawfully on the grounds of age, disability, gender assignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or trade union membership.

Company: Siemens Industry Software Ltd.

title: Product Manager - Origin
subTitle: AppsFlyer
description:
The AppsFlyer Origin group's mission is to make sure all incoming data flows smoothly into the AppsFlyer systems. This means handling over 150 Billion events each day!

This group is responsible for ingesting, filtering, and enriching

this data and then producing it for downstream services' consumption (e.g. Attribution, Dashboard, Protect, DataExchange).

This group is looking for a technical and talented Product Manager with a creative mind and extraordinary problem-solving skills to help build the next phase in the evolution of marketing and analytics tools.

The group also supports dynamic response generation, which is needed for advanced user engagement flows (e.g. deep-linking). The group specializes in web handlers, autoscaling, and other relevant cloud technologies. Finally, it owns the external facing schema and validates the incoming data accordingly.

What You'll Do

Manage the product’s lifecycle end-to-end.
Solve various problems around real-time traffic at a large scale and implement complex data logic.
Define the priorities of the product by understanding customers’ needs and the company's vision.
Help to create the product's vision and to build the plan/roadmap to achieve it through concrete milestones and versions.
Analyze and improve the performance, scalability, and stability of AppsFlyer products, environments, and tools.
Continuously learn and evaluate new technologies in the everlasting journey to perfect our products.
Collaborate with talented and curious Product Managers and Software Engineers to deliver complex products, bringing your creativity to its maximum.

What You Have

7+ years of experience building SaaS products (as a Software Engineer, Team Lead or Product Manager).
2+ years of experience as a Product Manager.
Proficiency and ability to code/understand at least one language (Java / Clojure / GO / Kotlin / Python etc.).
Experience in web technologies, API design, and documentation (REST, Swagger).
Experience with large-scale production databases.
Self-starter mentality who takes full ownership of their responsibilities has no excuses, has a strong drive, and is hungry for success.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in fluent English.

Bonus Points

Experience with AWS/Cloud.
Being introduced by an AppsFlyer team member.

As a global company operating in 20 countries across 5 continents, we reflect the human mosaic of the diverse and multicultural world in which we live. We ensure equal opportunities for all of our employees and promote the recruitment of diverse talents to our global teams without consideration of race, gender, culture, or sexual orientation. We value and encourage curiosity, diversity, and innovation from all our employees, customers, and partners.

“As a Customer Obsessed company, we must first be Employee Obsessed. We need to make sure that we provide the team with the tools and resources they need to go All-In.” Oren Kaniel, CEO

title: Product Manager II
subTitle: Grubhub

description:
About The Opportunity

We're all about connecting hungry diners with our network of over 300,000 restaurants nationwide. User-friendly platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities set us apart in the world of online food ordering. Grubhub is a place where authentically fun culture meets innovation and teamwork. You will be leading the process of designing and executing the product bein built.
You will lead a squad/Product team consisting of a designer and a group of engineers, together you will be responsible for driving and delivering on the product roadmap.
You will work with our campus customers, including dining directors and managers, restaurants operations managers, nutritionists, and others, as well as internal stakeholders at all levels as well as peers to help bring your products to life.
You will collaborate with other Product Managers and Product teams to achieve shared goals that extend beyond the B2B part of the product.
You will master the use of data and analytics to help you learn and figure out if what you’ve built is behaving as expected - while also interacting with your users in order to add an intuitive understanding of how they are using your products.


What You Bring To The Table

2+ years of experience in the high tech industry as a product manager for product-driven companies in the marketplaces, B2B2C, or B2B space.
Experience with web and/or mobile applications.
Entrepreneurial mindset and spirit of making things happen.
A leader of people, able to rally the forces behind a shared goal, with or without authority.
Understanding how a product or feature is used by a customer, and how changing it would affect their behavior, should come naturally to you.
You should be adept at using data to track goals and KPIs, create dashboards, test new products, and create and manage roadmaps and priorities.
Proven ability to work with large datasets, customer & performance analytics platforms, and testing solutions. Intermediate (or more) at writing SQL queries.
Understanding the business and strategy and being able to challenge the way the product vision and strategy are set up to meet the requirements.
Ability to understand the current tech stacks and architecture, as a lever for planning great products. Familiarity with the product lifecycle and methodologies.
Written and verbal fluency in English.
Willing to commit to US travel approximately once every quarter


And Of Course, Perks!

Hybrid Work Model. We provide our employees flexibility to split their time between working from home and at the office.
Time Off. Grubhub TLV employees are provided 20 days of paid vacation per year, as well as every other Sunday off.
Parental Leave Benefits. Grubhub provides new parents 8 weeks of paid vacation, and to ease our new parents back to work, we allow them to work 80% time for 4 weeks while receiving 100% pay.

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Just Eat Takeaway.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Our story




At Just Eat Takeaway.com, we deliver delicious dishes to millions of food-lovers across 24 countries. Whether they call us Takeaway.com, or just “that food app”, we're making mealtimes quick, easy, and delicious around the world.




But the secret to our success isn't food, it's tech. Whether they're building software, optimizing applications or testing usability, the experts in our Tel Aviv tech hub give us the ingredients to grow.




All About The Role




As a Senior Product Manager (eCommerce - Growth) at JustEatTakeaway.com, you will be responsible for the growth of the platforms our customers are using to order food.




You can deliver




We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about building products that solve key business challenges, streamlining the work of restaurants.




Responsibilities




Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, identify and fill product gaps and generate new products that solve business problems
Identify problems and opportunities and deliver the solutions
Work closely with UX designers, developers to come up with the best software solutions and products for restaurants and their customers
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements
Own the product lifecycle from start to finish
Help create the product's vision and to build the plan to achieve it through concrete milestones and versions
Research and understand key customers, market trends, upcoming opportunities, and challenges




Minimum Qualifications/skills




5+ years work experience as a product manager or as an associate product manager in the eCommerce field
Proven track record managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organisation
Passionate about user experience and great design
Team player
Experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with fast release cycles
Define the priorities of the product through understanding customers' needs and company vision
Experienced with technology solutions for the restaurant industry
Multinational experience, scaling products across multiple markets




Here is our offer




Here at JET, we offer our colleagues the chance to develop and grow alongside top talent in one of the world's leading food delivery companies. By providing a creative, dynamic and innovative environment, we empower our people and give them the ingredients for success.




Ready to join us as a Senior Product Manager? Click Apply Now and send us your CV!




Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging.




No matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We're committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colourful selves to work every day.




More About Us




Want to know more about our company vision, culture or career growth opportunities? Have a look at our careers site.




Department: Tech & Product

title: Full Stack Engineer- Apps Team
subTitle: AppsFlyer
description:
AppsFlyer is the market leader in the mobile attribution business. We provide analytical tools to help thousands of app developers and agencies reach decisions about where, when, and how to market their apps.




We do this by consuming enormous amounts of data and presenting it in useful (and cool!) ways that are actionable and provide real and immediate value to our customers.

We are looking for a senior full-stack developer to join our Apps team. The Apps team manages a variety of services and tools, external and internal. Our missions include diverse business cases, a wide range of APIs, implementation of third-party services, and collaboration with multiple other teams in the company.




Besides developing product features for the end-user, the team is also at the epicenter of the Front-End and Node.js communities in the company, developing whole services for internal use and front-end infrastructure.

Hence, writing logs and monitoring our services are in our day-to-day routine, in order to be on top of things.




Our team uses cutting-edge technologies and frameworks such as (buzzword alert): Node.js, React, Go, Clojure, AWS, Kafka, Neo4j, GraphQL, Protobuf, Redis, PostgreSQL, among others.

The Apps team is part of the AppsFlyer SEGA group.

SEGA group’s mission is to take our customers’ SaaS experience to a whole new level in terms of Self-Serve, Product Led Growth, User Experience, easy onboarding, and product adoption while ensuring that our SaaS platform will best serve the different teams and products relying on it. In addition, we are responsible for supporting and improving our internal business systems, which will make our business tick like a swiss clock and provide critical visibility that drives intelligent business decision-making.




What You'll Do

End-to-end development of AppsFlyer products and features, from front-end to back-end
Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, Software Engineers, and QA’s to deliver amazing products
Analyze and improve performance, scalability, and stability of AppsFlyer products, environments, and tools
Continuously learn and evaluate new technologies in the everlasting effort to perfect our products




What You Have

At least 5+ years of development experience
Working experience in Node.js and React is a must
A problem-solving attitude, eager to learn and face new challenges
Passion for mentoring, training and sharing knowledge with others
Proficiency in written and spoken English
B.Sc. in computer science or equivalent experience




Bonus Points

Knowledge of dev-test methodologies
Experience in functional programming
Experience in developing SaaS products & platforms
Being introduced by an AppsFlyer employee




As a global company operating in 18 countries across 5 continents, we reflect the human mosaic of the diverse and multicultural world in which we live. We ensure equal opportunities for all of our employees and promote the recruitment of diverse talents to our global teams without consideration of race, gender, culture, or sexual orientation. We value and encourage curiosity, diversity, and innovation from all our employees, customers, and partners.

“As a Customer Obsessed company, we must first be Employee Obsessed. We need to make sure that we provide the team with the tools and resources they need to go All-In.” Oren Kaniel, CEO

title: R&D Product Owner
subTitle: CyberArk
description:
Who We Are




CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR ), the global leader in Identity Security , Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets.




What Will You Do




CyberArk is looking for an experienced Product Owner for our DevOps group in charge of R&D platform development/SAAS operation engine and DevSecOps.




As the PO of the service, you will work with a cross functional products and teams through the R&D, to ensure the success of the cloud products and development environments in terms of customer adoption, customer satisfaction, SAAS lead time etc.




As part of your daily job you will define the product vision and roadmap, as well as tactical elements. You will need to prioritize product investments in order to ensure current and future customer value is met. As the Product expert, you will represent it internally and externally in front of different stakeholders.




Leading DevOp's platform, Cloud Platform and DevSecOps product life cycle from strategic planning to tactical execution
Research and Analyze product and market requirements both within the R&D and on market trends.
Assure a sustainable product/market fit.
Analyze continuously customer usage and feedback and inform roadmap and priorities to all stakeholders
Own the product roadmap from concept and design to execution and release; define Product and Service requirements and specifications; making priority decisions
Work together with DevOps Engineering teams to ensure the product meets the requirements in terms of user experience, engineering viability and customer consumption expectation
Meet customers, partners, and developers across multiple geographical times to communicate company/product strategy, address requirements and R&D wide priorities.




What You Need To Succeed




+3 years’ experience in product ownership.
3-5 years hands-on experience in software development/DevOps/Automation
Professional background in the Platform Development/Cloud Services or DevOps
Good knowledge in SaaS solutions development best practices (Multi-Tenant, Data Privacy, Telemetry, Cost, etc.)
Proactive, highly motivated individual with a serious work ethic and goal-oriented approach
Experience in working collaboratively with cross functional team
Ability to learn quickly new concepts and to look at the big picture (System wide)
Very strong decision-making abilities
Highly organized and capable of working on several projects under time pressure
Excellent communication skills Hebrew & English, ability to present to large audiences and the ability to Listen!
Flexible and agile with the ability to share ownership but be 100% accountable
Strategic thinking with ability to execute and reach goals




How Will You Stand Out From The Crowd




BSc in computer science/engineering – an advantage
Knowledge and experience in Identity and/or Endpoint services - advantage




To learn more about CyberArk, visit https://www.cyberark.com , read the CyberArk blogs or follow on Twitter via @CyberArk , LinkedIn or Facebook .

title: Engineering Manager (API Team)
subTitle: Twist Bioscience
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Twist Bioscience is a DNA company based in South San Francisco, California. The company has developed a proprietary silicon-based manufacturing process for the production of synthetic DNA. Twist Bioscience serves Life Science researchers who are changing the world for the better. Coming from diverse fields of medicine, agriculture, industrial chemicals and data storage, scientists use our synthetic genes, oligo pools, and NGS target enrichment to better lives and improve the sustainability of the planet. Twist Bioscience is uniquely positioned to help accelerate these efforts by providing precision at a scale that is otherwise unavailable. Our technology overcomes inefficiencies and enables cost-effective, rapid, precise, high-throughput DNA synthesis and sequencing. We offer both the quality and quantity researchers need now to rapidly realize opportunities ahead.




We are expanding our Tel Aviv team and looking for a team manager who is a true leader, learn fast, a creative out-of-the-box thinker.




As a team manager for the API team, you will lead the development of Twist API. Our API (DNA as a service) enables both small startups & large enterprises design DNA sequences, optimize them and order DNA to support their R&D needs and accelerate science. The API is built with Python (using Django), and is a part of Micro-services event driven system. Our Tech Stack includes python (using Django), Redis, PostgreSQL, Airflow and Kafka, run on AWS, using serverless processes (with Lambda & Athena), and Docker, K8S and Helm for our CI/CD pipelines.




As a team manager, you will lead the People, Technology and Execution. You will build the technological vision, work with our worldwide customers, and build the best API for DNA in the world!




Responsibilities




Leading an architectural vision and development for a business-critical system
Providing technical leadership for developers within and outside of your team
Leading the growth plans of the team members, and managing the hiring process to bring top talent
Continuously improving the development methodologies and processes to Enhance the team execution. Use data to identify bottle necks and improve them.
Working with Product management to build the roadmap for the API
Work closely with Our customers to streamline their integrations and help them improve their workflows.
Work with the DevOps teams to streamline processes and improve the developers and customers experience




What You Need Is




B.Sc/M.Sc degree in Computer Science or equivalent, from a well-known university
4+ years of experience in leading a software team and mentoring engineers
8+ years of experience in developing Web Applications
Deep knowledge in Python / Node.JS / Ruby and Rest Frameworks (Django / Express / Rails.
deep understanding of cloud-based development, NoSQL and serverless
Ability to lead an agile based feature development, design new projects, and work with stakeholders, both in the Tel-Aviv and San Francisco
Thorough understanding of software development methodologies, principles and procedures and related software management tools
Full proficiency in English
The position applies both to men as to women

title: Senior Software Engineer
subTitle: Market Beyond
description:
Market Beyond 

Our engineering team is passionate about creating truly innovative products to the market,

to build something, which solves a big problem in a way never done before. As a software

engineer at Market Beyond, you will be responsible for driving innovation by developing

products to help optimize online retail operations. You will collaborate with a talented and

agile team of engineers building the next generation of retail optimization based on machine

learning. You will be exposed to scale of data, and use state-of-the-art technology stack that

will push the boundaries of innovation in the online retail space.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for the architecture for Market Beyond’s insight discovery platform.

You will also be responsible for technology stack design, evolution and, optimization. You

will bring industry best practices and discipline to turn data into a strategic asset and help

build advanced data products and services to help our clients make data driven decisions.

In this role, you will be responsible for:

• You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process millions of events

every day

• Build and own cloud applications on AWS using Big Data technologies such as Elastic

Search, Redis, Redshift, EMR and others

• Lead features \end to end" from product requirements through live tests in

production

• Contribute to the design, architecture, and development of scalable and robust

applications

• Produce highly scalable, high-quality software in the fast-paced environment of a

startup company

• Be responsible and drive the adoption of new and exciting technologies

Requirements

• Self-driven, must be able to promote a technical agenda

• 3+ years of experience in software development in production environments

• B.Sc. in computer sciences or a related discipline

• Experience with C# / Python / SQL

• Experience with development of distributed, large-scale, cloud applications on AWS

• Experience with Linux in a production environment

• Experience working in a microservices architecture, services deployment and

management using Kubernetes

• Must have a passion for technology and quality

• Great communication and collaboration skills and a team-focused approach towards

software development

About Market Beyond

Market Beyond provides Fortune 500 companies with actionable, real-time, product level

insights to increase market share. Market Beyond’s platform leverages machine learning, big

data and uses e-commerce intrinsic technologies to provide the deepest most accurate

insights from billions of shopping journeys across the e-commerce landscape. Our unique

technology uses advanced Machine Learning and AI to correct inefficiencies in pricing

models, website traffic and conversion factors, thereby ensuring growth by shoppers,

revenue and market share."

Micro Focus is one of the world’s largest enterprise software providers. We deliver mission-critical technology and supporting services that help thousands of customers worldwide manage core IT elements of their business so they can run and transform—at the same time.

title: Product Designer - Social Impact
subTitle: monday.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




The Social Impact team at monday.com is looking for a Product Designer to join us in helping nonprofits around the world scale their impact with a digital transformation.




As our first designer, you’ll be joining a unique startup aimed at bridging the gap between how nonprofits use technology to scale their impact. You will design end-to-end user experiences and optimizations – from early prototypes to final implementation – and contribute to the development of our brand, style guidelines, and design system. You’ll join our Social Impact Team based in our headquarters in Tel Aviv, Israel.




The mission




Let’s be honest: nonprofits are the real MVPs. They work to make the world a better place every day, and most do it with little to no resources or funding. Our mission is to help nonprofits around the world solve their biggest challenges through the use of technology. With the proper digital tools, nonprofits are able to increase productivity, automate their processes, and ultimately scale their impact.Some numbers




We currently work with 15K nonprofits globally
We develop solutions for these nonprofits in 70+ countries
After launching in February 2022 we’re up to 76K sign-ups to Digital Lift




The team




We’re a group of entrepreneurial thinkers, go-getters, and creatives who just won’t give it a rest. We believe the work we do is important and we’re always working towards one common goal, whether that means working individually or collaborating as a group.Digital Lift website: https://digital-lift.org/monday.com , Eswatini (Swaziland), and the race to vaccinate a nation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ivMN6a9emxs&t=6sOperations Management for Displacement Centers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XQtkF87Y-J0




About The Role




Mission driven: wake up every morning with the mission of helping thousands of nonprofits around the world scale their impact with technology
Startup mindset: you’ll be playing a key role in founding Digital Lift – our startup within monday.com – that builds products and services on a global scale, from scratch
Part of the larger monday.com ecosystem: work in one of the fastest growing public companies with a revolutionary product surrounded by the passionate and talented people
Own the Digital Lift product’s UX/UI
Own the Digital Lift brand design
Work closely with Product, Engineering, Data science, and Marketing teams to develop a smooth user experience with high-end look and feel
Brainstorm and design new products, from conception to production
Multitask on several projects at a time and maintain a positive attitude




Requirements




3+ years of experience designing a complex system/platform
High level of written and spoken English
Passionate about social impact
Ability to adapt, switch gears, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
A positive attitude and great social skills, with a willingness to put aside ego for the sake of what’s best for the team
Advantage: experience in owning the design of products from early stage startups
Advantage: experience as a marketing designer




Social Description




We are looking for a brand designer that can own design projects from end-to-end. These projects include brand identity, digital products, conference branding, print assets, interface & interaction design work.

title: Group Product Manager
subTitle: SolarEdge Technologies
description:
SolarEdge is a global-leading supplier of smart energy solutions, with a diversified product offering comprising intelligent solar inverters, battery storage and backup systems, EV charging and home energy management. NASDAQ-listed since 2015 (SEDG), SolarEdge combines cutting-edge technology with world-class engineering and manufacturing capabilities designed to maximize solar power generation while lowering the cost of energy.

SolarEdge's product group plays a major role in setting the company’s strategic vision as well as creating new innovative solutions. The team is in charge of devising, tuning and implementing strategy, roadmap, and system feature definitions; The product team’s role is to manage the entire lifecycle of all products, from inception through requirements, development, testing, manufacturing and end-of-sale/support. Our rapid growth across geographies and sectors create significant opportunities to expand our offering while maintaining our leadership position. To achieve that, we are expanding our product leadership team and looking for top notch team players to join our core team.

We are looking for an experienced and passionate hands on Product Management Team Leader, to lead a team of 3-5 product managers and drive end-to-end product research, requirements, development and strategy. In addition to direct team management and engagement with customers, you will also oversee products readiness and working directly with different stakeholders in key departments such as R&D, integration, operations, support and engineering.




What will you be doing:

Managing a team of 3-5 Product managers, doing inbound and outbound work
Define market and product requirements
Engage with customers
Manage, liaise and direct multi-teams to ensure projects goals and requirements are met
Assess potential risks and technical challenges, as well as develop appropriate mitigation plans
Act as primary contact for product-related queries
Set and manage relevant products’ roadmap




Requirements:

Accountability and a ‘can do’ attitude - must
B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, computer science or another relevant academic track – must
3+ years of experience working with product management in companies developing embedded products – must
2+ years of experience working in a management position – must
Experience with data driven product management – significant advantage
MBA – advantage
Proven experience building organized, detail-oriented requirements and project plans, and managing changing project requirements in a dynamic environment
Ability to multitask and handle various priorities in a high paced environment
Excellent communication skills (English) including verbal, written, white-boarding and presentation
Self-organized, process-driven, analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-learning individual who reads constantly and loves to pass on their knowledge to others

title: Product Designer – Design Systems (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
subTitle: Agoda
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




We believe in making it easier for everyone to experience the world.




The interactive experience across travel is spectacularly shifting and our Product Design team is passionate about evolving our innovative experience to ensure Agoda is the best place for guests to book accommodations and our hotels have the best platform to showcase their properties. Our customers deserve experiences that cultivate their loyalty and make it easier to engage with all that is magnificent about Agoda!




As a Product Designer, you will be joining a team that’s passionate about systematic design, organization, and building the most scalable solutions for our partners and stakeholders. We’re a large diverse team and look forward to a new strong team-player.




What’s product design like at Agoda?




Typically, product designers at Agoda work alongside a product manager, web and app engineers, and cross-functional partners. Together they drive their own part of Agoda, deliver solutions to problems and get feedback directly from customers and internal partners.




Day to day, it looks like:




Maintain and evolve the look and feel of agoda’s Design Systems, its design language, UI components and design patterns, from ideas to execution.
Work with Designers and IT as our primary stakeholder
Work closely with design engineers to ensure a high level of quality delivery across all platforms (web, iOS, Android)
Document design guidelines and actively evangelize Design Systems to the wider product team.
Help shape the design culture at agoda that will ultimately impact the experience our customers have with our products and services
Contribute to large-scale projects like platform refreshes that touch all of our front end products




Product Designer at Agoda means you have a track record of:




Knowledge of Figma’s design tool
3 – 5 years of experience working with or on design systems
A portfolio of work relating to design systems or a strong comprehension of how they work.
Solid understanding and knowledge of design fundamentals. (ie Gestalt, Color, Typography, Grids, etc)
An understanding of interaction, visual, and user experience design
Able to articulate and explain your ideas to other designers, engineers, product managers and other stakeholders
Immersing yourself in design system best practices, design patterns across multiple industries and products to help shape agoda’s products and design language
A strong growth mindset and team-player attitude
Care deeply about organization, file structure, and the details
Qualities we value in designers:




Effective articulation of ideas and design solutions
Expressing feedback with kindness and candor
Tolerance for ambiguity and healthy curiosity
Translation of quantitative & qualitative insights into design decisions
Contribution to our culture: motivation, optimism, quality, integrity

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Check Point Software Technologies Ltd
description:
Check Point is looking for an outstanding Senior Product Manager for the Threat Cloud and Network Cyber security area.

You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.

The area is responsible for developing and delivering Check Point’s threat prevention capabilities, detecting and blocking any attack – known or unknown - on any platform: Network, Endpoint, Mobile, Email, Collaboration, and Cloud.

The area develops the industry’s leading threat prevention engines including Anti-Phishing, Threat Emulation, Content Disarm and reconstruction, Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), Anti-Bot, Anti-Virus, URL and website security and much more.

These capabilities are delivered as part of Threat Cloud – a global platform that inspects data from hundreds of millions of sources from hundreds of thousands of customers in real time, preventing threats and sharing threat intelligence.

Our development groups are also directly responsible for developing our Network Threat Prevention offerings as well as emerging products such as Supply Chain Security and XDR, driving our very successful business lines to accelerated growth.

We use the most advanced technology to solve some of the world’s biggest technical challenges, including the latest cloud technology, Machine learning and AI.




In this position, you will be leading product efforts for around 80 people directly as well as working with other R&D departments, outbound product management, product marketing, support, sales, and QA. Requiring interaction with developers and up to senior company leadership.




Come join a team of driven, fun, creative minds united in delivering innovative new technology and cyber security against the ever-changing threat landscape.

Major Responsibilities

Work with customers, sales and other internal and external stakeholders to understand what will make our products great
Take a significant part in defining the product roadmap and be responsible for successful execution
Be a part of the R&D teams, deliver vision and requirements and follow up on them until delivery
Use Check Point vast intelligence and usage telemetries to drive product decisions
Master the competitors’ solutions and find ways to differentiate yours
Work closely with the UX designers to create the perfect user experience for your administrators and end users
Communicate status and result to various internal parties including senior management

Desired Background

3+ years of Product Management experience
3+ years of R&D background
Experience as an R&D manager – an advantage
Experience with UX-intensive products for different types of users
Experience with taking decisions based on data analysis
Ability to see the big picture and coordinate efforts of multiple development teams
Ability to dive into and understand technical material (machine learning, cloud, networking, cyber techniques and tactics)
Independent, self-driven, results oriented – a must.
Strong interpersonal skills leading and contributing to cross-functional teams
Open mind to innovative thinking and bold projects
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical areas, English and Hebrew

It would be great if you also have:

Background in the security area - major advantage
Experience working with customers – major advantage

title: Software Verification Student
subTitle: NVIDIA
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
We are looking for an excellent Software Student developer to join the Linux Verification team. The person will have to work closely with our driver design, architecture, and firmware teams and gain a deep understanding of NVIDIA's products and technologies to be able to design and implement user and kernel-level applications, which will be used to verify NVIDIA's high-end Ethernet and InfiniBand drivers.




What You'll Be Doing




Develop a constrained-random verification environment with learning ability using Python.
Identify and write all types of coverage measures for stimulus and corner cases.
Debug tests with design engineers to deliver high quality functionally.
Analyze coverage measures to identify verification holes and to show progress towards product development and releases.




What We Need To See




Student of B.Sc. in Computer Science or SW/Computer Engineering.
Experience in software development, preferably with Python and C/ C++.
Strong background in designing, implementing, and debugging software.
Enjoys working as part of an engaging, collaborative team.
Creative, motivated, and results-driven worker.




Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd




Background in Operation Systems, preferably in Linux.
Knowledge in one or more of the following Networking areas: Ethernet, VLANs, TCP/UDP/IP, QoS, L2-L3 protocols.
Experience in SW Verification or Validation in the semiconductor industry.




We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!




NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

subTitle: Flex Storage Inc.
description:
Flex Storage Inc., a start-up company with an established product, is seeking a talented Product Manager with proven experience to spearhead the next steps of our product's evolution.
