title: Software Engineer, Regulatory Solutions
subTitle: Calypso Technology
description:
Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

Location: Jerusalem

Description

Calypso Technology and Axiom SL have merged to form a new company, Adenza.

﻿

﻿

Division Overview

Product & engineering works towards delivering a powerful yet flexible technology platform keeping the needs of the end customer in mind. Our development teams ensure that all the codes are delivered with the highest quality. Product managers are home to technical experts who work together to design and build our software and product roadmap, whereas our QA team is constantly aimed at enhancing the quality of our platform delivery through test methodologies for implementations, upgrades, and migrations.

Team And Role Overview

You will be part of a talented software team that works on software applications in the FinTech domain serving global banks including Tier-1 financial institutions. The position involves development of Java/Scala applications (front and back end) while building expertise in full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing and delivery.

Responsibilities

Designing and developing functionality for applications in Java and Scala
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle through well-designed, testable, and efficient code
In-depth troubleshooting and bug fixes
Work with Product Management to analyze and understand business requirements
Bring innovative ideas to improve our products, the quality of deliveries, and development processes


Skills And Requirements

BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject
Proven hands-on Software Development experience
Solid learning skills and willingness to tackle new technologies
Object Oriented analysis and design using common design patterns
Java knowledge and experience – an advantage
Knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL, and ORM technologies – an advantage
Scala knowledge and experience – an advantage


More About Us

Our Office:

Adenza’s Jerusalem office is located at the Malcha Technology Park, a large complex with several office buildings and a 17 floors tower surrounded by green lawns and environmental sculpture. The Technology Park is in a central location with accessibility to all parts of Jerusalem and is very close to Malcha Mall, Teddy Stadium, and the train station. There are several restaurants and coffee shops in the complex and a large variety of restaurants at the nearby mall. We have ten working rooms and a kitchen with a selection of food, fruits, and vegetables. The work environment is clean and comfortable, with a charming atmosphere.

Why Apply:

Adenza’s mission to pioneer innovative technology offering efficient, accessible, and transparent, fully integrated solutions is only achievable due to our outstanding workforce. The fusion of deep technical knowledge with the element of human passion, understanding, and energy is what makes Adenza’s employees exceptional. At Adenza, we offer great opportunities to collaborate on challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. As we continue our exciting growth trajectory, we recognize how important investing in the best talent across the globe is. Are you self-driven, innovative, execution-focused, and customer-centric? If yes, we want to invest in you.

Adenza is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We are dedicated to building and supporting a culture of diverse perspectives and talents as well as inclusivity to support individual growth and superior business results.

title: Product Manager, Claims
subTitle: Fairmatic
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Location: Hybrid/Flexible




At Fairmatic we're on a mission to make roads safer, one fleet at a time. We think about insurance, risk and underwriting in an unconventional way. Auto insurance has always been unfair: safe and unsafe drivers that look alike pay the same. Because of this, safe drivers end up subsidizing risky ones. It doesn't make sense. We're using data and AI to introduce a personalized option that incentivizes safe driving with savings. Our predictive risk models have been trained with nearly 200 billion miles of driving data and tested with hundreds of thousands of paying drivers with industry-leading underwriting results. And we're just getting started.



Our leadership team includes serial entrepreneurs, insurance industry savants and start-up veterans. We've raised $42M from leading VCs as well as insurtech, fintech and technology industry angel investors.



At Fairmatic we do our best work while living our best lives, regardless of where we are. We have thriving teams across the globe and we are constantly looking for talented folks to welcome into the family. We are a curious, adaptable and diverse bunch of technologists and problem solvers who are obsessed with creating a positive impact in the world. In our work together, we strive for close collaboration, humbleness and constant learning.



We are looking for a talented and motivated Product Manager to join our Claims Product team. This team will be responsible for delivering a delightful claims experience and optimized claims outcomes for our customers (drivers, fleets, and brokers) and internal stakeholders (for example, claims adjusters). Claims is the most impactful insurance-related experience for our customers, and our ability to deliver a seamless and fair end-to-end experience is a critical component of our value proposition and our success in fulfilling our mission.















Requirements



A day in the life:



Develop a claims product strategy and roadmap to deliver optimized claims outcomes and a delightful experience for our customers and internal stakeholders using technology and data
Develop clear and concise written materials to align cross-functional teams around a shared vision or problem statement
Partner closely with the Customer Success, Claims and other cross-functional teams as well as other Product & Engineering individuals and teams to develop products and experiences that maximize value creation to our customers and our business
Develop product hypotheses, design and conduct lean and focused experiments to prove or disprove them
Regularly and proactively share progress towards solving focus problem statements and advancing on shared vision
Uncover high-impact improvement opportunities for the Claims Product team by monitoring and analyzing key quantitative and qualitative metrics
Propose and champion ways in which the rest of the organization can help maximize value creation from your work
Exemplify and foster Fairmatic's humble, collaborative and impact-obsessed culture





What you will need:



5+ years of Product Management experience
Strong analytical skills, with experience setting up and executing tests or experiments
Exceptional prioritization and project management skills
Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills
Demonstrated capabilities owning end to end quantitative and qualitative customer research and effectively identifying and interpreting key findings
Demonstrated ability to work closely and effectively with engineering, design, and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver impact
Experience in building customer facing claims experiences is a plus.
Self-starter and ability to define and initiate work from scratch
A knack for balancing multiple projects at the same time
Self-driven, motivated, and willingness to work in a rapidly changing, early stage startup environment



Benefits








Paid time off
Meal allowance
Mobile and Broad Band allowance
Entertainment allowance
Wellbeing allowance
Pension contribution

title: Senior Product Manager, Fiverr Business
subTitle: Fiverr
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




We are looking for a talented, experienced, and creative Senior Product Manager to join the team and help us shape the future of work!




About Fiverr Business




Today, 1 out of 3 Americans work on a freelance basis. By 2025, 60% of the workforce will be freelancers, and companies will need to adjust their work habits to keep up with the emerging trend.




Fiverr Business offers a trusted and flexible platform for businesses, allowing them to work easily and seamlessly with professional freelancers.




We help SMBs and SMEs increase their productivity by enabling them to expand in-house capabilities and execute every project by connecting with vetted freelancers for every skill set they need.




Our work model is hybrid, combining remote and on-site work. This allows us to get things done when and where we are most productive.




WHAT AM I GOING TO DO?




Play a key role in growing the business by defining and building the products our customers use every day.
Be responsible for the full lifecycle of your products - plan, innovate and prioritize products and features and lead the full cycle of design and R&D work.
Solve complex problems and provide true value to our customers.




Requirements




4-6 years of product management experience in B2C/B2B/Marketplace products.
Experience working with cross-functional groups - R&D, Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, etc.
Passion for delighting users; a strong eye for design and customer experience (UX & UI).
Business-oriented with a great customer-facing approach.
Experience in analyzing and using data to inform decisions.
A proactive self-starter who is able to juggle multiple projects effectively.
A strong executor that thrives in fast-paced environments.
Collaborator, and team player, with a can-do attitude.
Excellent communication skills.
Entrepreneurial mentality.
Experience with Product-led growth strategy - an advantage.




At Fiverr, we’re not about checklists. If you don’t meet 100% of the requirements for this role but still feel passionate about the position and think it’ll make your life more fulfilling, we want to hear from you.




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES




At Fiverr, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace and product, as well as our community. Fiverr is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Fiverr will provide accommodation to individuals with disabilities or a special need.

title: Senior Solutions Architect (Tel Aviv)
subTitle: MongoDB
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.
We are looking for hardworking technologists to join our Pre-Sales organization to ensure that our growth is grounded and guided by strong technical alignment with our platform and the needs of our customers.
MongoDB Pre-Sales Solution Architects are responsible for guiding our customers and users to craft and build reliable, scalable systems using our data platform. Our team is made up of hardworking software architects, entrepreneurs, and developers who take direct responsibility for customer success, including the design of their software, deployment, and operations. You'll work closely with our sales reps and play a key role in winning deals and driving the business forward. You'll be a trusted advisor to a wide range of users from startups to the world's largest enterprise IT organizations.
As an ideal candidate, you will have

5+ years of software development experience
3+ years of pre-sales experience with enterprise software
Solid understanding and ability to code with two or more modern scripting languages (e.g. Python, Node.js, SQL) and/or popular programming languages (e.g. C/C++, Java, C#)
Experience with scalable and highly available distributed systems
Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills
The ability to travel up to 50%
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Fluent in Hebrew

You may also have

Experience selling databases and/or deploying applications with any of the major cloud providers
Experience with database programming and data models
A MongoDB Certification

What You Do At MongoDB

Design systems, applications, and infrastructure to help drive software development projects using MongoDB
Advise customers on architectures, patterns, and strategies for making the best use of MongoDB
Expertly articulate the business value of MongoDB solutions
Align to support sales with activities such as technical discovery, demos, proof of value, presentation, sizing, and documentation of technical decision criteria; working across a number of opportunities in parallel
Translate technical concepts and patterns into business benefits for management and executives
Act as a liaison, collecting feedback from the field to relay back to the Product Management team
Help drive demand through participation in both industry-known trade-shows as well account-based marketing events
Demonstrate resilience and sound judgment in dealing with business challenges
Proactively seek opportunities to support and mentor other pre-sales team members and share standard methodologies

What You Will Learn

The rapidly growing MongoDB product suite, including
Core database server
Atlas (fully managed cloud database service)
Atlas Data Lake, Atlas Full-Text Search, Realm and Charts
Other Tools and connectors - Ops/Cloud Manager, Compass, Connector for BI, Connector for Spark
Market-relevant, complementary technologies e.g. Apache Kafka, Kubernetes
Modern and popular architecture design patterns, methodologies and concerns e.g. microservices, DevOps, cloud, security

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Senior Automation Engineer
subTitle: Cross River
description:
Description




﻿You are:




A passionate tester and developer who wants to make a strong impact in your team. You aspire to continuously improve the way automation is done, enable scalability, and enhance the quality of our products because you know how important the automation process is for the end result.




You’re a problem solver; you notice bugs and issues when others don’t and are focused on getting the results needed for the code to be optimal, stable, and functioning properly. You appreciate coding best practices and standards, using up-to-date automation-testing tools.




Object-oriented programming is more than a catchphrase to you, it’s your bread and butter for writing code. You dive into the smallest of details, but know when to step back and zoom out, as you understand the bigger picture and have a vision of the entire process.




You’re able to thrive in fast-paced, high-performance environments and enjoy the challenge. You’re curious and proactively learn new technologies and are able to succeed on your own. You’re always seeking creative problem-solving solutions, even for complex situations. You value flexibility in order to prioritize your personal life without giving up on the technical challenge that drives you to love your career. You’re self-disciplined enough to work remotely and deliver results on time. You value teamwork, know how to collaborate with others and how to effectively communicate with them.




We are:




A rapidly growing fintech company that provides technology infrastructure powering the future of financial services. Leveraging our proprietary real-time banking core, we deliver innovative and scalable embedded payments, cards, lending and crypto solutions to millions of consumers and businesses. Cross River is backed by leading investors and serves the world’s most essential fintech and technology companies. Together with its partners, CR is reshaping global finance and financial inclusion.




While Cross River is based in the United States, a majority of development activity is based in Israel. Our main office is in Har Hotzvim, Jerusalem, but our development teams work almost exclusively from home.




You will:




Work as part an Agile scrum team in the software development organization




Design and develop clean, high-quality code that tests API and backend functionality automatically and is robust enough not to generate false positives




Be heavily involved with the delivery process, including taking ownership and responsibility before code gets deployed




Enhance the automation framework in collaboration with the automation framework team to add all necessary functionality to test your product




Define test plans and test cases




Log and document bugs in tracking system




You have:




At least 4 years of experience in automation tests using Java or C#
Deep understanding of OO programming
Experience with multi-threading
Experience writing automation framework code
Strong hands-on design, coding, and debugging skills
Proficiency in English
It's a bonus if you have experience: as Manual QA Engineer, Jenkins and Selenium, load and performance testing, writing infrastructure




Why join us:




Cross River provides technology infrastructure powering the future of financial services. Leveraging a proprietary real-time banking core. We are backed by leading investors and serves the world’s most essential fintech and technology companies. Together with our partners, we are reshaping global finance and financial inclusion.




We place a strong emphasis on our employees’ satisfaction and growth. We promote a work from home culture with people located all over the country, which allows our employees unparalleled flexibility to work where and when they want, with hours that are convenient for them. We strongly believe giving this freedom allows them to produce the best work possible.




We offer competitive compensation and benefits. Ongoing monthly knowledge sharing, training and career growth opportunities.




We are seeking people with a passion for cutting-edge technology, who enjoy a fast-paced and dynamic environment and want to work alongside other bright, talented people.




Cross River is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cross River does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.




By submitting your application, you give Cross River permission to email, call, or text you using the contact details provided. We will only contact you with job related information.

title: DevOps Infra Engineer
subTitle: 888holdings
description:
Are you an experienced infrastructure engineer, eager to take ownership of new technologies and improve on the existing ones?

888 is looking for a DevOps Infra Engineer to join our DevOps and take a vital role in changing our future infrastructure. Focused on DevOps and cloud platforms and operating within a highly regulated environment, you will explore new technologies and work with the company’s technical leaders; architects, developers, and security engineers, to design and implement new platforms and architectures.

You will be an integral member of a strong DevOps team handling large-scale infrastructure systems and lead the transformation of 888’s systems to automated, cloud-based, containerized and microservices-based platforms.




About the Role

• Lead transformation employing relevant and challenging new technologies

• Design and implement complex solutions for new platforms and architectures

• Head projects and operations of large production DevOps infrastructure

• Conceive creative solutions for infrastructure improvement

• Define and deliver technological POCs

• Collaborate with architects and developers and with our SRE and R&D Teams




About You

• You have 5+ years’ experience and extensive experience with AWS cloud platform

• You have a deep understanding of IT operations and infrastructure (OS / Networking)

• You are proficient with DevOps tools (Kubernetes and AWS) and script coding

• You are an expert in writing complex scripts (Bash / Python / PowerShell) for both Linux and Windows

• You possess a deep understanding of CI / CD concepts, experience with build/release systems (Jenkins / GIT) and monitoring tools (Nagios / Prometheus)

• You are familiar with systems’ networking (HTTP, TCP IP, Load Balancers, sniffers)

• You are a self-driven leader with a strong sense of ownership and accountability

• You thrive defining and designing innovative technical solutions




You have a major advantage if…

• You have experience with Elasticsearch / Kafka / Terraform / GCP

• You are familiar with security requirements of applications in highly regulated markets







More about 888 Group

As one of the world’s leading betting and gaming companies, 888 provides customers with a safe and enjoyable experience underpinned by its unique technology and industry expertise. Being a responsible company means being a responsible employer first.

The Group invests in a unique working environment that enables our people to flourish along with our business. We believe in talent development and investing in our people. Our unique culture and spirit are built on the values of fairness, collaboration, and continuous progress. The Group’s mission is to remain employee-centric and to attract and retain the best people by providing a rewarding environment with ample opportunities for personal development.




More about the Product Team

Our Product Team is made up from a group of passionate and extraordinary 8sters collaborating to achieve the shared goal of creating pioneering products. It is one of our core teams as product vision and strategy determine the success of our products. Join us in ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience for our customers world-wide.

title: R&D Team Manager - Data Collection
subTitle: Similarweb
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Similarweb is a place for the dreamers. A place to grow personally and professionally, by constantly challenging yourself and the status quo, bringing in new ideas, and simply daring to explore… In Similarweb you’ll be surrounded by talented individuals that are passionate about data, technology, and people.




For five years running, Similarweb has been chosen as one of Dun & Bradstreet’s TOP BEST HI-TECH COMPANIES TO WORK FOR IN ISRAEL . We raised over $240M and have 1000 employees across 10 global offices. In May 2021, we began trading on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), and we couldn’t have done it without each and every one of our Similarwebbers.




We are looking for a R&D Team Manager, for our Ingest Team in the Data Collection group. To design, code, and lead Similarweb’s data ingestion services, handling millions of requests per minute over hundreds of servers that are consuming billions of events per day.




This role will report to the VP R&D of Data Collection & B2C.




Why is this role so important at Similarweb?




As the most trusted platform for measuring online behavior, millions of people rely on Similarweb’s insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. Producing these insights requires large scale raw data to be ingested reliably in high scale to provide stable signals for analysis.




As an Ingest Team Manager you will have the opportunity to lead a group of talented engineers, perform hands-on work and own Similarweb’s raw data ingestion pipeline end-to-end. Your work will have a direct impact on the quality and reliability of our data and the insights that our products are delivering to our customers.




You will impact the work of these engineers by guiding on best practices, challenging their designs, developing their professional skills and managing them. You will facilitate the tools and understand the needs of your people to bring the best of them.




So, what will you be doing all day?




Your role as leader of the Ingest Data Collection team means your daily responsibilities may include:




Lead (hands on), mentor & inspire a team of talented engineers.
Design, code and manage end-to-end Similarweb’s data ingestion pipelines, both online and offline.
Run the production environment by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health and data quality.
Own data infrastructure features from design to production using industry best practices with focus on quality and delivery.
Lead designs & decision-making processes of the team.
Solve diverse complex problems of scale, performance and business logic.
Collaborate with product managers and other team leaders to plan, nurture, and implement an efficient and effective development process.
Continuously learn and evaluate new technologies in the everlasting effort to perfect our products
Perform code reviews, evaluate implementations, and provide feedback about potential improvements.
Improve your skills, learn from and mentor top-notch engineers and enrich other team members.
Have lots of fun!




This Is The Perfect Job For Someone Who




4+ years of experience in server-side development with at least one of the languages NodeJs/Python/Scala/Kotlin.
2+ years of experience in developing code for big data infrastructure. Actual hands-on programming experience using Python/Java/Scala - advantage.
At least 2 years experience as a team leader - advantage.
Proven experience working with high scale on AWS or any other cloud provider. Experience in architecture and design of large-scale and high performance web production systems.
Bsc. in computer science or equivalent experience.
Comfortable taking challenges and learning new technologies.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to provide constant dialog between teams.
Ability to mentor and build the team.
Ability to take business requirements and translate them to technical alternatives by performing risk management and evaluating tradeoffs.
Love to be a hands-on leader.
All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model, so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face to face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.




Why choose Similarweb?




We believe that building a great product and a great company starts with finding amazing people and helping them grow and develop professionally and personally. At Similarweb, you’ll be surrounded by curious, witty and passionate people that are hungry to drive real impact. We are proud to have over 800 creative and talented professionals, and we strongly believe in winning together as a way of driving a successful business!




Our Values




Data Driven: We believe data driven decisions are the key to success and we are evangelists for the power of digital insights
Passionate: We care deeply about what we do, are accountable for our actions and are committed to helping each other
Excellence: We believe in excellence as a mindset. It’s in our nature; and we work hard to make a difference
Winning Together: We know what it takes to build a great company and a great product and it begins with valuing each and every member of our team and working together to reach new heights.




Similarweb is a global company that strives to create a workplace reflective of the communities we serve, where individuals are empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.




About Similarweb




Similarweb is the most trusted platform for understanding online behavior. Millions of people rely on Similarweb insights daily as the ground truth for their knowledge of the digital world. We empower anyone — from the curious individual to the enterprise business leader — to make smarter decisions by understanding why things happen across the digital ecosystem. Learn more at WWW.SIMILARWEB.COM .

title: Senior Product Growth Manager
subTitle: Lumen
description:
As a Senior Product Growth Manager, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of strategies to increase the adoption and usage of our product.




This will involve conducting market research to understand customer needs and preferences, developing and implementing campaigns to promote the product with the marketing team, and working closely with the product development team to identify and prioritize growth opportunities.

In this role, you will be responsible for achieving the product's growth objectives and driving revenue, retention, and user growth.




You will also be responsible for analyzing and tracking key metrics to measure the effectiveness of your strategies and for making data-driven decisions to optimize the product's performance in the market.




Responsibilities

Driving adoption and usage of the Lumen product

description:
About Us

TripActions is the all-in-one travel, corporate card, and expense management solution, providing more than 8,000 customers around the globe with unprecedented visibility and control over spend. Trusted by finance teams and travelers alike, TripActions leverages real-time data to help companies keep traveling employees safe, reduce spend, and drive productivity.

TripActions’ investors include such visionaries as Andreessen Horowitz, Lightspeed Ventures, Greenoaks, Zeev Ventures, and entrepreneurs Lee Fixel, Adam Bain, and Elad Gil. In Oct 2022, TripActions announced its Series G upround at a post-money valuation of $9.2B to help accelerate future growth plans. In February 2022, the TripActions Group announced its acquisition of Berlin-based travel management company, Comtravo, which was closely followed by the addition of leading Scandinavian travel agency Resia AB, the group’s third acquisition in nine months following the acquisition of Reed & Mackay in May of 2021.

At TripActions, we’re never satisfied with the status quo, and we know breakthrough ideas come from diverse perspectives. We are committed to cultivating a workplace that reflects the diversity of the customers we serve while fostering leadership and innovation. All voices are valued here and you’ll have the resources, tools, and training you’ll need to do the best work of your life.

TripActions is looking for a Vice President of Software Engineering to help lead a product-focused engineering team. This team develops and supports the features that our end users will rely on every day and delivers delightful, consumer-like experiences in the workplace. This team will be building a technology stack that helps scale and enable TripActions future growth.

This position will be responsible for growing a Product Engineering team (e.g. recruiting, career development, mentoring), as well as project execution (e.g. high quality feature releases and improvements). The role will have both ICs and Managers as direct reports.

Strong analytical skills and a sense of ownership/accountability

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience

About Placer.ai




Placer.ai is a fast-growing big data startup led by seasoned executives and repeat entrepreneurs who are building the world's first \Google Analytics for the physical world." Placer.ai’s platform provides instant visibility into any property in the U.S., presenting accurate details about visitation patterns and demographic breakdowns of visitors. Placer.ai’s customers can see where visitors have been before, where they go afterwards, where they typically go for sports, entertainment, groceries, etc., and what their interests are. Placer.ai's A.I.-based SaaS platform replaces archaic solutions such as manual surveys, installed cameras and other people-counting systems, creating a blue ocean market of more than $100B.




Placer.ai has grown 3x year-over-year for the past 3 years, counting more than 1000 paying customers across a range of industries, including 2 of the world’s top-10 retailers, 2 of the top-10 CPG firms worldwide, a world’s top hospitality firm, 2 of the world’s top-10 commercial real estate (CRE) firms and 2 of the world’s top multinational asset managers and hedge funds. Placer.ai has just raised $100M for Unicorn ($1B+) valuation in Series C funding.




Summary




We are looking for a Senior Group Manager to lead a multidisciplinary group that is responsible for one of Placer’s core developments. This person will lead all aspects of our backend, big data and full stack technologies in some of our key domains from data exploration and selecting the best solutions, leading POCs, defining the architecture and leading a team of developers in R&D in our pursuit of materializing our vision.




If you are someone who thrives outside your comfort zone, loves leading technology and people, obsessed with running fast and delivering high quality solutions, your place is at Placer.ai.

BSc degree in Computer Science or an equivalent

Experience in leading architecture of customer facing products.
Proven experience in building complex SaaS under BigData solutions env.

Advantages




Experience working with GCP




WHY JOIN PLACER.AI?




Join a rocketship! We are pioneers of a new market that we are creating
Take a central and critical role at Placer.ai
Work with, and learn from, top-notch talent
Competitive salary
Excellent benefits

Ermetic is a dynamic, fast-growing startup with $100M in funding in just under two years, and our 2021 business results will knock your socks off! We grew revenues by 800%, increased our customer base by 6X and quadrupled our headcount. We are unstoppable.

At Sight Diagnostics, we are revolutionizing how blood diagnostics is done using computer vision and AI. Sight OLO, our machine-vision based CBC analyzer only needs two drops of blood to give you a full diagnostic answer where and when you need it. With hundreds of devices in the field, we are taking the next step on our journey to execute our vision of a complete Digitized Blood Diagnostics ecosystem.

As a Senior Software Developer at Sight, you will:


Be a part of the core team that shapes and develops our code base in a real full stack environment (spanning firmware interaction, on-device applications and all the way up to our cloud platform)
Lead designs of complex new features, applications and project, working with the rest of the software team and driving technology selection and architecture choices
Collaborate closely with various teams in a multi-disciplinary environment (bringing together product, algorithm, system engineering and more)

B.Sc. or higher degree in Computer Science or other relevant engineering degree
At least 5 years of experience in software development- a must
Solid programming Experience using Python - a must

Track record of designing complex software systems with high-performance requirements

Fluent and communicates well in both English and Hebrew


﻿About Sight:

Our Work : Founded in 2011, Sight Diagnostics aims to transform health systems and patient outcomes through accurate and convenient blood diagnostic testing. Sight’s technology, developed over almost a decade of research, represents breakthrough innovations in diagnostic methodology. Sight’s latest blood analyzer, Sight OLO, performs a Complete Blood Count, the most commonly ordered blood test, with only 2 drops of blood from a fingerprick or venous sample in minutes.

Our Culture: We are a team of passionate problem solvers who are committed to the social impact our technology represents. We enjoy tackling big, complicated and important technological, clinical and behavioral-change challenges as a team, and we succeed through cross-disciplinary collaboration across a non-hierarchical structure. Sight is where everyone’s ideas are valued, considered and debated. We insist on a healthy work-life balance and support working parents with flexible working hours.

Our People: Sight is a rapidly growing team of approximately 200 employees, working together on a common mission. We value diversity and are proud of the different professions, backgrounds, expertise and beliefs that make up Sight’s unique ways of thinking. Our people are united by two shared qualities: being exceptional at what they do and caring deeply about making positive changes in the world.

Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. Get to know our team:




In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Technical Project Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.




Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda’s product team has direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy and puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.




The opportunity:




This role is BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED. The Technical Project Manager – Strategic Partnerships role is responsible for the management of projects & areas of responsibilities for one of Agoda’s key Strategic Partners. You will play a key role in driving partner satisfaction as well as significant revenue growth through excellent external stakeholder management, timely and concise internal and external communication, contribution to product roadmap, and through continuous optimization of partner-facing processes.




In this role, you’ll get to:




Own projects from end-to-end, or a collection of projects / areas of business, for a Strategic Partner that is critically important to Agoda, both from a strategic point of view and revenue point of view
Define KPIs for all projects and evaluate the success of a project
Investigate reported live site problems in great detail and work closely with development team to understand solutions, estimates, and ongoing status
Identify problems and opportunities, based on data and by working with others, to improve the user experience
Work closely with Partner / Technology teams to design appropriate solutions, configure systems, support testing, rollout, analyze results, and ensure usage and impact of new customer-facing features
Ensure constant communication and calibration between project teams and other stakeholders at regular intervals
Ensure timely progress and achievement of project milestones and goals by coordinating different workstreams, identifying risks, troubleshooting, and proposing mitigation plans. Act at all times as the ultimate owner of the project
Analyze project outcome & impact, collect feedback, and drive continuous improvement
Positively contribute to our team’s culture: continuous improvement, deliver better together, and enable others’ success




What you’ll need to succeed:




5+ years of experience in project or product management, strategy, operations
Experience with the latest internet trends and technologies
Strong communication and presentation skills (English and Japanese)
Problem solving and structuring skills
A growth mindset and positive attitude: pro-active, hands-on, detail-oriented, strong sense of ownership, data driven, experimentation oriented
Analytical and comfortable with numbers. Can define the analysis structure, interpret data, and think on your feet
Solid experience in project/stakeholder management, process improvement, planning
Ability to work well with and influence stakeholders at all levels
Ability to adapt your working style to different situations
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, multicultural environment
Eagerness to pitch new ideas, take initiatives, and look for opportunities for improvements
Intellectual curiosity and ability to learn new skills quickly
Attention to detail and ability to ask the right questions to ensure speed and accuracy
Professional experience in Microsoft Office tools (e.g. Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Strong proficiency in SQL
Experience with agile software development processes

title: Business Development Representative
subTitle: Fiverr
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




The Business Development Representative is tasked with identifying and generating sales opportunities through both inbound and outbound activities. The right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed but informative two-way conversations with prospects, and is highly self-motivated, hungry and coachable. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company’s needs, bring his expertise in prospecting and managing top of funnel activities and cater the outreach to each prospect specifically, with the ultimate goal of closing deals and growing Fiverr’s pipeline of high value opportunities.




Our work model is hybrid, combining remote and on-site work. This allows us to get things done when and where we are most productive.




WHAT AM I GOING TO DO?




Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound manual and automated (via prospecting tools) outreach to engage prospects and qualify leads through calls, emails, and other channels
Conduct high level question-based consultative discovery calls and uncover prospects’ business challenges
Perform effective online demos to relevant prospects and see the process all the way to closure
Routing qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales team for further development
Work closely and collaboratively with internal business solutions, marketing and customer success teams
Improve sales processes and skills to increase sales success rates
Consistently achieve your activity goals
Additional responsibilities as needed




Requirements




1-3 years of experience in inside sales, sales development, or prospecting, preferably selling technology services and/or software
G-Suite and CRM experience
Naturally curious and enjoys seeking out knowledge online in industry publications and by following industry leaders
Strong analytical and quantitative capabilities
Competitive, self-motivated, and self-directed. Able to learn fast on your fit.
Strong emotional intelligence skills to master Customer empathy
Strong interpersonal skills and superior verbal and communication skills via the written word, on the phone, and in meetings
Comfortable in supporting and working with global customers across many time zones
Highly organized and strong time management skills
Resourcefulness, creativity, and strategic thinking for troubleshooting problems
Ability to work autonomously and with minimal direction in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment
Team player




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES




At Fiverr, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace, from our community to our product. Fiverr is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Fiverr will provide accommodation to individuals with disabilities or a special need.

INKOD is looking for like minded, technology driven creatives to join our team of product designers. Our studio in Tel Aviv has developed a reputation for working with and providing product value to B2B early stage startups.

BA degree in Visual Communication.

Presentation skills, able to explain conceptual ideas and designs.

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Mobileye
description:
At Mobileye, we foster a hybrid-friendly environment, combining work from office and home.

Mobileye is looking for a highly driven and dynamic Product Manager, to join our team and help shape the future of ADAS and Autonomous Driving systems.

What will your Job look like:

Defining the product roadmap - manage the product development timeline, integration steps, and functional progress
Facilitate development processes across several internal interfaces
Work closely with R&D teams
Generate and maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for both internal and external stakeholders
Analyzing customer requests, feedback, and insights
Work with lead car manufacturers
The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background and thrive in a fast-paced environment while demonstrating excellent communication and problem-solving skills
All you need is:

At least 5 years in a Product Management role
BSc in Electrical Engineering or Computer science
MBA - an advantage
A proven ability to build a roadmap and execute complex projects
Development experience for embedded systems (e.g. Linux based systems, Real-Time software, Camera-based systems)
Experience in multi-disciplinary R&D roles
Proven analytical skills and decision-making based on quantities and qualitative data
Experience in system design and architecture - Advantage
Experience in driving the product vision and the execution discussions
Experience in working with Customers and sales team
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to interact at all levels
Leadership skills along with being a team player
Experience in the Automotive business- Advantage
Fluent in English and Hebrew
Our offices are located in Jerusalem, but we foster a remote-friendly environment, combining work from home 2 days a week

Mobileye changes the way we drive, from preventing accidents to semi and fully autonomous vehicles. If you are an excellent, bright, hands-on person with a passion to make a difference come to lead the revolution!

title: Product Manager
subTitle: Huuuge Games
description:
Introduction:

Still haven’t found your dream job? Join team Huuuge!!

Huuuge Games is a gaming company on a mission to build the world’s largest real-time casual gaming platform connecting millions of players so that they can have fun, socialize & play awesome games.

Join Team Huuuge and become a part of an exciting adventure bringing pure fun & truly social experience to millions of players across the universe.

Access to knowledge and skills development
International career opportunities
Work in the industry of the future
Seasonal and occasional gifts

title: Product Manager - Subscriptions
subTitle: Yotpo
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
If you shop online (and who doesn’t these days?), then chances are you’ve already interacted with Yotpo. We’re a leading eCommerce marketing platform, on a mission to help brands of all sizes accelerate their growth through exceptional customer experiences. Loyalty programs, SMS marketing, reviews, and visual user-generated content are our bread and butter, but we have more solutions up our sleeve, too.

We have teams across the world, including the US, UK, Israel, Bulgaria, and Australia — and we’re still growing. Our primary goal is to deliver the best technology in the industry.

You can hear all about it in our latest brand video.

Sounds exciting? Then read on, because we’re in pursuit of the best and the brightest minds to help us achieve our vision.

We’re creating a new product for consumers and ecommerce brands and we’re looking for the right product manager to join us.

As a product manager working on a new Yotpo product, you’ll tackle the toughest, fundamental customer problems and lead a team to craft great experiences through rapid iteration.

You’ll partner with a dedicated R&D team who lives and breathes the product and is eager to collaborate with you to make our vision come true.

You’ll be joining an A-team with a focus on creating a significant impact on ecommerce brands and consumers throughout the world.

Sounds exciting? Then read on, because we’re in pursuit of the best and the brightest minds to help us achieve our vision.

Responsibilities

Own a product domain roadmap and contribute to the product-line strategy
Lead new product concepts through launch and iteration
Partner with customers, designers, engineers and customer facing teams to create intuitive, delightful experiences.
Perform extensive customer research to define product requirements
Nurture internal relationships and drive complex, cross-functional projects


Minimum Requirements

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both Hebrew and English
3+ years experience as a product manager in a software company, working directly with an R&D team
Previous experience driving initiatives that are centered around UX and customer experience (web or mobile)
Previous experience driving initiatives centered around technical integrations
Proven ability to leverage data and customer input to inform product decisions

title: Product Data Analyst
subTitle: Fiverr
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




Fiverr is hiring an experienced Product Analyst to join our Data team. As part of this position, you will work closely with our product groups and you will take a significant part in decision-making and proactively guide our business growth, based on data analysis and statistical research. You will work independently and as a team member on the most interesting and innovative analysis that are available in the online industry. WHAT AM I GOING TO DO?

Plan, monitor and analyze AB tests for new features
Make data accessible by well-defined tracking and processes
Create optimal monitoring and visibility by building reports, alerts and dashboards

Data and analysis focal point of product & engineering teams




Requirements




BA/B.Sc. in industrial/information systems engineering, computer science, statistics or equivalent

Strong analytical skills

English proficiency (both written and verbal)

title: Product Manager
subTitle: PandoLogic
description:
WE ARE PANDOLOGIC

PandoLogic delivers Hire Intelligence to Talent Acquisition organizations by sourcing quality applicants faster and more efficiently through the use of big data, artificial intelligence, and proprietary campaign algorithms that fully automate and optimize the job advertising and decision-making process.

Disclaimer:

PandoLogic has been acquired by Veritone Inc. (NASDAQ: VERI), a provider of an operating system for artificial intelligence.

We were sought out by Veritone for our AI – our belief in it and our commitment to it – by a company that is focused on using AI for good. To build a safer, more vibrant, transparent, and empowered society.

Veritone is supporting our destiny, keeping our team intact, and honoring our roadmap – this is an incredible growth opportunity.

As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Veritone, there are no material changes expected for employees and customers.

Integration with their platform will reinforce our tech backbone and allow us to bring trillions of data points – from all sorts of agnostic sources – together to create insights that will power the workforce of the future.

Position Summary

PandoLogic is looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our Product team. In this role, you'll lead our product which is disrupting the online recruitment market. If you are passionate about building products that solve real-life problems, join our fast-paced company that encourages creativity, personal growth, teamwork, work/life balance, and fun.

This is a hybrid position based in Herzliya.

WHAT YOU'LL DO?

Establish a shared vision for your domain while working collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Collect and analyze customer feedback to identify opportunities for improvement or new product development.
Understand the market, competition, and champion our customers to craft product strategies that will lead to long-term success.
Define KPIs and oversee our products' health metrics to ensure overall product success.
Collaborate with engineers, design, data, and other teams to design and deliver innovative features and products.
Collaborate with marketing and other teams to craft and execute a go-to-market strategy for new releases.
Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding inside and outside the company.


WHAT SHOULD YOU BRING?

3+ years of experience as a Product Manager with a proven track record of launching multiple products and leading all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle.
Experience leading complex technical projects, competing priorities, and designing strategic cross-company initiatives.
Experience analyzing problems and applying quantitative and qualitative analytical approaches to drive product decisions.
Strong communication skills to drive collaboration across multiple disciplines - data, operations, support, design, marketing, customer success, and sales. You know well how to thoroughly explain the rationale of your decisions.
Fluency in English with excellent speaking and writing skills.
Domain knowledge of digital advertising or talent acquisition technology - Advantage.
Previous experience collaborating with partners and vendors and leading integration-based features and products – Advantage.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent - Advantage.


OUR CULTURE

Loves learning & continuous growth; stays current on marketing trends
Can juggle multiple projects, priorities, and deadlines with a positive attitude
Comfortable in a fast-paced, small company environment
Collaborative and always contributing value
Driven to win as a team
Remote first workplace
To learn more visit http://www.pandologic.com


When you join us, you'll become an important member of a well-established, global company. Professionally, you'll help us disrupt the recruitment advertising market and work on the most advanced technologies with experienced team members and from day one you'll be challenged to take risks while getting mentorship and support from the team. From day one, you'll be challenged to take risks while getting mentorship and support from the team.

We bet you'll love our awesome company culture, great benefits, and crew of collaborative, bold, resilient, innovative, resourceful, and caring people. We love it here, and we think you will too.

If you've made it this far and align with our goals, we look forward to reviewing your qualifications!

DISCLOSURE

Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. We are flexible. We are kind. We are PandoLogic.

title: Senior Data analyst
subTitle: Loops
description:
Loops is on a mission to change the way companies leverage data to make decisions. We believe that out-of-context dashboards are not the solution but the problem, and we’re obsessively passionate about helping people take data-driven actions!

Backed by top US venture capital firms, a network of strategic angel investors (CPO and VP data of some of the fastest-growing companies in the world), we’re defining the way companies grow their products.

We’re building a world-class team of highly motivated leaders, analysis addicts, and data fanatics who want to make a mark on the world by helping organizations leverage data to build better and sustainable products.




This is not a classic product analyst role:




Data is the underlying asset of our vision. You will directly impact the core value of the product, which is already used by major brands with unprecedented amounts of data.
You will also work closely with our customers to understand how data is leveraged to make decisions, learn which insights are valued, etc. This wide perspective will put you in a key position to shape the strategy of the growing product, and define its KPIs. You will help prioritize and design product features (not dashboards).




This is a unique opportunity for people that love product, data and conquering the world.

What will you be doing?




Run analyses via the platform, generate and present valuable insights across different verticals and products.
Model the data of customers based on their needs.
Work closely with the product team to improve the platform, the analyses and models it runs, and the type of insights it can surface.
Collaborate with the customer success team to address the customers’ needs.
Educate customers on how world-class companies leverage data to maximize their KPIs.
If you’re interested, you will also have the opportunity to dive into the world of ML led by our excellent Data Science team, taking an active part in structuring the models which run behind our product’s engine.




Who are you?




+2 years of experience as a product/data analyst.
SQL – High proficiency.
Python (Pandas, Numpy) – Basic understanding.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Product experience and/or product mindset – an advantage.
Ability to work as part of an agile and quickly growing team.
Proficiency in English.
Experience working with data science teams or analyzing AI-driven products’ data – an advantage.

title: Engineering Leader
subTitle: Ethosia
description:
We are looking for an Engineering Leader to manage NPI and engineering functions within the company.

· Leading and monitoring of NPI and engineering processes from purchasing through production to pilots readiness and market penetration, driving product quality and customer satisfaction.

· Understanding customer requirements and company standards, verifying they are met in the finished product.

· Monitoring production and product quality, identifying errors or faults, leading corrective actions and customer support activities.

· Developing and implementing production test and labeling tools, software loading stations as appropriate, working with R&D and external vendors.

· Monitoring production cost and expenses, working with management to improve.

Education and Experience:

· Relevant Engineering degree

· 3-7 years of experience as a NPI Engineer or engineering team member.

· Proven experience with transfer to production of multidisciplinary products, medical devices a strong advantage.Should have thorough knowledge of manufacturing methods and techniques. Turnkey subcontractor experience is an advantage.

Qualifications:

· Leadership skills. Leadership experience is an advantage.

· Problem solving skills.

· Excellent communication skills.

· Coordination skills - working with various departments and external partners.

· Well organized with an eye for details.Fluent in Hebrew and English.

Technical Skills/tools:

· SolidWorks.

· MS Office.ERP and PLM tools, Priority an advantage

title: QA Engineer
subTitle: Just Eat Takeaway.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Are you passionate about building shiny products? Are you up to date with the latest technologies and strive to get things done?




We are looking for you!




Our Story




With over 98 million active users across 20 countries, here at Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're a global food tech company, connecting our customers from Amsterdam to Auckland with the food they love.




All About The Role




JETPay is the market lead B2B solution for the food delivery market, allowing businesses to provide employees with a budget for ordering, and giving them an easy way to treat staff while avoiding the expense of a canteen.




We are looking for the one who can leverage our great system to be even better. One who can swim fast and for long-distance, react and adapt in a dynamic workplace with some of the top talents in the industry.




As a QA Engineer, you'll take part in our front-end and server-side (microservices) testing and will have the opportunity to make a huge impact on our set of products. You will be an integral part of defining our testing strategy in collaboration with your QA Tech Lead and Developers.




As part of this varied role, we're also counting on you to:




Define, develop, and execute manual web testing strategy focusing on both front-end and back-end equally
Monitor and analyze test results, collect test metrics, and conduct test reporting.
Collaborate with developers and product management to identify test requirements.
Develop and improve automation testing methods and processes, improving the overall quality of testing deliverables.




Can you deliver…




Here's What We're Looking For From Our QA Expert…




3+ years of QA experience (server-side and front-end)
Ability to design, plan and execute new feature testing
Experience with Relational and NoSQL DB
Background in REST API and REST testing tools (Postman, Insomnia, SoapUI, etc).
Passionate about learning new technologies
Excellent communication skills, positive and flexible approach
Experience in agile software development
Experience with Testim.IO - advantage
Experience with Logging tools (e.g. NewRelic, Graylog, Sentry, ...) - advantage




Here is our offer




Here at JET, we offer our colleagues the chance to develop and grow alongside top talent in one of the world's leading food delivery companies. By providing a creative, dynamic and innovative environment, we empower our people and give them the ingredients for success.




Ready to join us as a ? Click Apply Now and send us your CV and motivational letter!




Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging.




No matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We're committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.




More About Us




Want to know more about our company vision, culture or career growth opportunities? Have a look on our careers site.

title: Java Tech Lead for Cloud Practice
subTitle: Deloitte
description:
We are looking for talented individuals who want to join our talented team at Deloitte’s cloud practice and make a direct impact on the world's largest brands.




About us:

Our team is one of Deloitte’s leading technology groups that specializes in offering Software Modernization and Product Innovation solutions.




We are software engineering experts who solve complex business problems with a product development mindset. Born in the cloud, we swiftly scaled up to develop cutting-edge solutions for Fortune 500 enterprises within a vibrant, fun ecosystem.

title: Enterprise Search - Application - Senior Software Engineer (React/Typescript/Ruby)
subTitle: Elastic
description:
At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.




Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.




As a senior engineer at Elastic on the Enterprise Search team, you'll be working collaboratively in a distributed working environment delivering valuable features for the Elastic Enterprise Search solution, including the Elastic App Search and Workplace Search products. Enterprise Search lets users easily implement powerful, modern search experiences for their websites, apps, or workplaces. Search it all, simply. We’re seeking a talented software engineer and communicator to help push the product and team to new heights.




What You Will Be Doing:




You will be building product enhancements for Enterprise Search, including the Workplace Search and App Search products, with contributions to Elasticsearch and Kibana.
You will collaborate with and mentor international teammates in a mostly text-based, asynchronous, remote-first team environment with occasional video calls and yearly conferences. You’ll be hands-on with the team and codebase, reviewing work and providing constructive feedback.
You will help define the team’s overall strategy, collaborating on a product roadmap and then breaking it down into technical deliverables. You’ll act as an important and communicative part of an engaged and spirited team.




Our Team Style:




We appreciate articulate and “low ego” people who want to grow as part of a team.
We welcome diversity in all forms. We embrace strange and risky ideas and appreciate characters of all sorts.
We hold each other accountable and work to a high standard. We take pride in the frequent, safe and graceful delivery of innovative and valuable features.
We embrace open communication and challenge. We appreciate positivity and vigilance and strive for autonomy, trust, and personal and professional growth.
Our backend stack is in Ruby, running on JRuby, with a tight coupling to Elasticsearch. Our frontend is in React, deployed in Kibana.




What You Will Bring:




Previous experience in a technical leadership role wherein you defined product goals and iterated them into scaled software. You understand that what you build needs to empower and engage the customer, the person.
Excellent practical judgment. You know how to prioritize, when to collaborate and ask for help, and when to be independent.
Measured and articulate written and spoken communication skills. You work well with others and can craft concise and expressive thoughts into correspondence: issues, investigations, documentation and onboarding material.
An interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows and philosophies that can help you grow. You can function well in an environment that drives towards change.
Experience building software using Ruby, React and Typescript




We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate_accessibility@elastic.co We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.




Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People




As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.




We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.




Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
Generous number of vacation days each year
Double your charitable giving - We match donations 1:1 up to $1500 USD (or local currency equivalent)
Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love.
Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave




Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.




We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate_accessibility@elastic.co We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.




Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below:




Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Poster; and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster.




Please see here for our Privacy Statement.

title: Cloud Architect, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
subTitle: Crossover
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?




Every technical decision-maker has the same gripes. The architecture is outdated. Past product decisions don’t make any sense. Technical debt is mounting. Plus, the higher you rise in your organization, the less time you get to spend actually doing the technical work you love (and the more time you spend managing the people who are doing it).




Not at Trilogy.




In this Product CTO role, you’ll have carte blanche to make architectural decisions based on technical merit — not whatever decision the board decided was most cost-effective. No more working on the same product every day for years, wishing you could go back in time and backhand whoever thought it was a good idea to write custom code for something that could’ve been purchased from AWS for $20/month.




Instead, you’ll design for a diverse portfolio of products (hundreds, in fact) using the newest, most interesting cloud technologies. As a senior technical decision-maker, you’ll face a new architecture challenge each week and make important architectural decisions every day. Instead of tending to multiple stakeholders and a wishlist of features from customers, you decide the critical features for the product. Use and grow your expertise to design products for maximum performance, efficiency, and scale.




Ready to get back to doing the technical work you love, while guiding the development for products that reach millions of customers?




What You Will Be Doing




Tackling design problems and writing technical specs to create products for distinct tech stacks and business domains.
Uncovering “high-order bit” decisions by interviewing technical leads and analyzing data structures and code/design documents.
Making important design and technical decisions that specify how to rearchitect products in a cloud-first way on systems such as AWS and GCP.




What You Won’t Be Doing




Managing projects or employees — thanks to Trilogy’s highly automated processes and streamlined org structure, there’s very little time spend on this type of admin
Participating in daily scrum meetings, making low-level decisions, performing code reviews, or debugging
Talking to customers (while you’ll build products customers love, other roles in the organization will take care of these important interviews for you!)
Developing a backlog of wishlist features
Creating high-level strategies or roadmaps — instead, you’ll be making the rubber-meets-road tech decisions




Cloud Architect Key Responsibilities




Tear down current products, make key technical decisions for their rebuilding, and choose new product specs that simplify architecture. In essence, you’ll define a product and its features for the next 3 to 5 years.




Basic Requirements




7+ years of experience making important architecture and design decisions on software projects, such as the application of architecture design patterns or significant open source technologies.
Experience making technical design decisions involving the use of cloud computing services
Experience making technical design decisions for complex software products or systems
Ability to simplify complex ideas and communicate them in writing with clear and logical thinking




About Trilogy




Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.




There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!




Working with Crossover




This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.




What to expect next:




You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.




Important! If you do not receive an email from us:




First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-3370-IL-Herzliya-CloudArchitect.002

title: Senior Full Stack/Backend Python Engineer

description:
We are looking for an Senior Full Stack/Backend Python Engineer to join and to take a key role in our site in TLV. The position is to be part of a full stack development team responsible for Via’s Map editing web tools by building cutting-edge E2E solutions and scalable infrastructure to deliver Via’s map layers editing to all business customers.
