You'll work across the stack, using different technologies for different projects. You’ll also build and maintain our processes and tools, to keep our productivity and code quality high.

Our stack includes Python, React. However, it's more important to us that you have experience with full-stack, user-centric development in general than with our specific technologies.

What You’ll Do

Design and implement solutions by developing server and client technologies.
Lead the backend development methodology while mentoring other developers
Leverage your past experience with backend architecture and design patterns into the development of a new web application that is taking its first steps into large scale application.
Introduce modern web development technologies, set high standards and drive best practices for backend development for web applications.

Who You Are

6+ years of backend programming experience, from which 2+ years Python - Must
Strong knowledge of Javascript and Typescript
Familiar with cloud-based deployment (AWS or other platforms)
Fast learner: you can quickly master concepts, disciplines and methods.
Team player, great communication skills
Detailed problem-solving approach and knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and complexity analysis.
Provide tech leadership in the team for backend development and help improve and establish good engineering practices in the team.
Experience working with geo spatial data - an advantage
BS or MS in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent experience.
Experience building large-scale infrastructure applications or similar experience.

We’re Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility — the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We’re committed to building and nurturing a team as diverse as the communities we serve. Bringing transportation equity to the world begins with championing equal opportunity in our own offices. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated here.

Ready to join the ride?

title: Threat Prevention Cloud Group Manager
subTitle: Check Point Software Technologies Ltd
description:
Description:

Check Point is looking for an outstanding R&D Group Manager to lead the Threat Prevention Cloud group.

The group is responsible for building the world’s largest and most advanced Threat Prevention cloud platform called Threat Cloud - a global platform that inspects data from hundreds of millions of sources from hundreds of thousands of customers in real time, preventing threats and sharing threat intelligence.




In this position you will be in charge of researching and building the next generation of detection engines such as anti-phishing and web emulation using AI and Machine Learning, you will build an infrastructure to deliver these capabilities to all Check Point Products based on cutting edge cloud services and serve Billions of requests per day.

You will develop new products and capabilities in an agile manner, directly contributing to Check Point’s business plans and to the worlds cyber security.

The group is tasked with tackling some of the world’s biggest technical and cyber security challenges, protecting the world from Phishing, Supply Chain attacks and other advanced threats in an ever changing landscape where threat actors and adversaries do their best to avoid detection.

You will lead a top notch group of software engineers, data scientists, cyber security experts and team leaders, providing the vision, professional and personal guidance as well as be responsible for their wellbeing and career path.

You will join a modern, dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.




Come join a team of driven, fun, creative minds united in delivering innovative new technology and cyber security against the ever-changing threat landscape!!!




Major Responsibilities:

Lead several development teams (20-30 people) be responsible of recruitment, retention, growth, culture and provide professional guidance and vision
Define product strategy and feature roadmap in cooperation with Product management, Sales, other R&D departments and other stakeholders
Create effective research and development processes to accelerate product velocity
Lead and monitor development projects to successful execution
Be technically able to guide and enable your team on design, architecture, cyber security, research and implementation
Develop and deploy security engines that are able to prevent the most novel attacks
Own an internet scale critical production environment spanning cloud and on premise and be responsible of its successful operation




Desired Background:

3+ years of R&D management experience including experience in managing team leaders
8+ years of R&D hands-on experience in Java/ Python Go/other modern programming language
Proven record of developing large scale, modern cloud/SaaS systems
Strong hands-on knowledge of AWS services and Kubernetes
Experience with Data science and machine learning – big advantage
Expereince with developing cyber security products or cyber security research – big advantage
Experience with Front-end development - advantage
Ability to see the big picture and coordinate efforts of multiple development teams
Ability and interest to dive into and understand technical material (machine learning, cloud, networking, cyber techniques and tactics)
Independent, self-driven, responsible, results oriented
Strong interpersonal skills leading and contributing to cross-functional teams
Open mind to innovative thinking and bold projects
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical areas, English and Hebrew

title: Organic Team Leader
subTitle: ADAMA Ltd.
description:
We enjoy food so much that we sometimes forget how complicated it is to produce. It sometimes takes months of hard work and effort to grow our salad's vegetables, even the milk that we consume comes from a cow that eats 7 tons of grain in a single year.

More than 90% of our food comes from what farmers grow. Imagine if almost half of the world’s growing population's food disappear. That exactly what would happen if farmers would not be able to protect their crops from weeds, insects, and disease.

For decades ADAMA has been helping framers to do just that.




ADAMA is one of the world’s largest crop protection companies. Being part of the Syngenta group, a leading agricultural innovation group is helping our efforts to meet the world's future food challenges. Our global distribution expands to more than 100 countries and delivers what farmers need to create the highest quality products.




ADAMA is an expert company in crop protection. We consonantly invest in research and development, daring to innovate and create new solutions to protect the world’s best foods.

Today, ADAMA operates five global R&D research centers in four countries: two in Israel (MCW and Agan), China, India and Brazil. The R&D centers include organic chemistry, analytical chemistry, formulations, and pilot units.




We offer a highly rewarding career opportunity for a strongly motivated and professional candidate to join our Organic Chemistry R&D Department as an Organic Team Leader at ADAMA Agan in Ashdod.

The Organic Team Leader will lead the research and development activity at AGAN organic chemistry labs. We are looking for a candidate with in-depth knowledge of lab-scale chemical process development, the ability to make decisions, work independently, and be detail-oriented.




Responsibilities

Lead and manage organic R&D researchers.
Lead a number of processes in organic R&D including (a) Process development, (b) Improving the efficiency of existing processes, and (c) validation of processes and methods.
Collaborate with ADAMA registration personnel, ADAMA Product Directors, and Product Strategy.
Assist in troubleshooting production batches; delivery process improvements to improve reliability or cycle time.
Develop and enforce all laboratory safety, security, and housekeeping policies and procedures.




Qualifications & skills

Ph.D. in Organic chemistry.
Experience in multi-step organic synthesis.
Familiarity with and experience in scale-up processes.
Work experience in the chemical/pharmaceutical industry.
Experience with HPLC, GC, NMR, and other analytical techniques.
Strong ability to organize priorities, make decisions, and delegate responsibility effectively.
Take ownership of results, overcome obstacles and drive change.
Strong leadership and people-facing skills, including proficiency in verbal and written communication.
Comfortable in global activities.

We’re Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. description:
Job Description




The INTEL NEX Cloud Networking Group (NCNG) seeks outstanding engineers to contribute to the development of cutting-edge semiconductor platforms. You will be exposed to High-Speed I/O protocols such as PCIe Gen6, DDR5, and PAM4 112Gbps Ethernet, which are a part of our Ethernet Infrastructure Processing Unit (Intel IPU) and Foundation NIC (FNIC) 200G Ethernet product lines. We propose a position in a dynamic and flexible workplace, working directly with highly capable design, system, and pre/post-silicon teams within the organization. As the PCB and Package Design lead, you will be responsible for the project management, planning, and execution of the team's PCB and Package deliveries across several programs. Your team will define the scope of all package and PCB design requirements, document them, and ensure compliance to ensure that the product specifications and performance requirements are met. You will be responsible for driving the product design from the planning phase through design tape-outs, as well as providing post-tape-out support to our stakeholders as necessary. Your team will be responsible for negotiating and implementing Signal and Power Integrity guidelines aspects, compliance, and interoperability for the NCNG product portfolio across PCIe, Ethernet, DDR, Clocks, and Miscellaneous I/O interfaces. In addition, your team would be responsible for identifying/qualifying new hardware solutions, providing technical leadership to working groups/task forces to resolve hardware, schematics, layout, and DFx issues via debugging and reviews, and managing the selection of parts/components.




Qualifications




Required Skills and Experience-- - Electrical Engineer M.Sc. with over 6+ years / B.Sc. with over 8+ years of relevant experience - Strong understanding of EM concepts and transmission line theory - Knowledge of CAD tools: Cadence Allegro / Mentor Expedition, or equivalent - Familiar with PCB and Package layout technics - Hands-on lab work experience, good debugging skills, ability to analyze problems, diagnose the root cause and apply corrective action - Involving in the Package Design Working Group to work with key internal/external partners to comprehend the detailed design requirements. - Managing the package design schedule partnering with stakeholders to ensure package tape-out per schedule. - Good understanding of the Package/Assembly cost and leveraging design methods to lower the package cost. - Leading the package design reviews to ensure stakeholder approval and design compliance with requirements. - Strong verbal and written communication skills in English for interacting with design, evaluation and production engineers, customers, technical marketing engineers, and program managers - Excellent documentation and leadership skills - Comprehensive understanding of system architecture - Test measurement instrument hands-on operation -- Additional Skills and Experience -- - FPGA, and Verilog coding skills




Inside this Business Group




The Network & Edge Group brings together our network connectivity and edge into a business unit chartered to drive technology end to end product leadership. It's leadership Ethernet, Switch, IPU, Photonics, Network and Edge portfolio is comprised of leadership products critically important to our customers.




Other Locations




IL,Jerusalem




Posting Statement




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.




Benefits




We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/jobs/benefits.html




Working Model




This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site.

In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

title: Senior Product Designer, Attack Path Analysis, Tenable One
subTitle: Tenable
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Description

Job Description

Who is Tenable?

Tenable® is the Exposure Management company. 40,000 organizations around the globe rely on Tenable to understand and reduce cyber risk. Our global employees support 60 percent of the Fortune 500, 40 percent of the Global 2000, and large government agencies. Come be part of our journey!

What makes Tenable such a great place to work?

Ask a member of our team and they’ll answer, “Our people!” We work together to build and innovate best-in-class cybersecurity solutions for our customers; all while creating a culture of belonging, respect, and excellence where we can be our best selves. When you’re part of our #OneTenable team, you can expect to partner with some of the most talented and passionate people in the industry, and have the support and resources you need to do work that truly matters. We deliver results that exceed expectations and we win together!

Your Role

If you’re looking for an opportunity to work as a startup in a cyber giant, your place is with us. We're building Tenable's new Cyber Exposure Platform that will reach tens of thousands of customers and leverage the latest technologies. You will be part of an engineering team responsible for the UI/UX of the Attack Path product.

Your Opportunity

As a member of our team, you will be in charge of researching, designing, and implementing design features in our exciting application. It’s super challenging work, combining work with PM, leadership, and engineers, to build the best Attack Path application out there.

This team is in charge of a newly established product of Tenable that plays a key part in Tenable strategy.

It's a unique opportunity to join a small new team that works like a startup with the backing of a large and successful company. This is a great place for passionate individuals who are looking for a chance to make an impact, learn, and grow!

What You’ll Need

5+ years of UX/UI design, working for B2C SaaS companies, with an emphasis on integrating visual design components into industrial products.
Experience working across the full product lifecycle, from early generative research – to ship – to in-market UX research.
Working knowledge of Agile methodologies
Fluent in Figma
Creative and technical background
A link to your portfolio

And Ideally

General Knowledge of the Cyber Security domain
A good understanding of HTML and CSS is an advantage
Self-motivated and passionate attitude
Team player mindset

If you’ve reached this point, and you’re still not sure if you should apply…..Just do it! We’re human and we don’t fit a perfect mold. Having diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives, that’s a good thing! If you’re coming from outside of the cyber industry - great! If you’re looking to try something new - awesome! All we ask is you bring passion to all that you do, crave creativity and innovation, and embrace the hard work of gaining new skills and accepting big challenges.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

Sunbit builds financial technology for real life. Our technology eases the stress of paying for life’s expenses by giving people more options on how and when they pay. We use cutting-edge innovations in financial technology to bring leading data and features that allow individuals to be qualified instantly, making purchases at the point-of-sale fast, fair and easy for consumers from all walks of life. We create value focused on our core values; we work tirelessly to ensure that Sunbit becomes available to everyone, everywhere.

Self-motivated, full of motivation to learn and collaborate, out-of-the-box thinker, Great interpersonal communication skills problem-solver.

title: Solution Delivery Manager
subTitle: Applause
description:
Job Description

Solution Delivery Manager - Remote

In support of our Account Management efforts, we are looking for a unique individual to build trusted relationships with our customers, help those customers understand the value of our services, and show them how they can be successful leveraging Applause across their digital experience initiatives. This person will partner closely with our sales, marketing, community, and product teams, to manage successful customer engagements.

The person in this role will own and lead specific customer engagements implementing our SaaS testing solution and services. This position is an integral part of Applause’s long term relationship with its customers and the efforts put forth by this individual will directly impact the value realized by the customer and the ultimate success of the relationship.

In order to succeed in this team, this individual must have the passion and energy to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment. They must have the maturity, confidence and experience to manage and partner with customers as well as the willingness, energy and technical ability to become a trusted advisor for customers.

Responsibilities:

Own and lead multiple, simultaneous customer engagements implementing Applause’s SaaS digital quality testing solution
Develop strong customer relationships that enable Applause to become a trusted adviser for our customers’ executives and stakeholders
Provide both engagement and testing strategy leadership to the customer
Analyze test data and provide research of coverage from multiple sources including our community of testers, environments and devices to show maximum value to customers
Gather testing requirements from client and translate into actionable testing projects
Leverage our community of testers around with world to form teams focused on exceeding customer expectations


Ensure customer and project success by managing completion of deliverables, schedules, customer expectations, and meeting milestones

Work with Applause Product Management and Engineering organizations to channel client feedback and solutions into future releases of the Applause product suite
Work with leadership to channel commonalities across customers into Applause best practices across our products and services
Pursue areas of solution expansion within active customer base


Essential Skills & Qualifications:

B.A./M.A or MBA (leading MBA programs globally- advantage) with at least 3 years of relevant industry experience.
Strategic thinking capability balanced with tactical and implementation/execution skills.
Proven working experience in project management
Excellent client-facing, presentation and internal communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Excellent stakeholder management skills and best practices
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skill


Who We Are

Applause leverages its worldwide community of on-demand digital testing professionals to create curated and vetted testing teams who provide our clients with a full suite of testing and feedback solutions. Our white glove approach seamlessly integrates with any SDLC process, enabling leading brandsacross all industriesto increase development velocity and deliver high-quality digital experiences to their customers.

Applause is a place where everyone belongs and where we believe everyone deserves the exceptional. Since our founding, we have continued to celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We have a global workforce that, like our crowd, embraces diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. Our employees bring their true self to Applause. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you are qualified to perform the essential functions of this role, but believe you require a reasonable accommodation to do so, please email adaaccommodations@applause.com. Please be sure to include the role you are applying for and the nature of the reasonable accommodation you are seeking in your email.

8.5.2

Skills & Requirements

8.5.2

title: IT Specialist

title: Experienced Frontend Developer
subTitle: Similarweb
description:
Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions powers the digital strategies of companies like Google, eBay, and Adidas. We help our customers succeed in today’s digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights, competitive benchmarks, strategic analysis, and more. In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven’t stopped growing since!




What makes the Similarweb R&D team awesome?




We love data! At Similarweb, you have the opportunity to work on a petabyte scale!
As part of the team, you will support everything from our multi-million client side panel across all platforms through our massive ingest pipeline
We are solving some tough problems in machine learning, estimation, classification, etc.
Work with cutting-edge technology - we often beta test the tech that other people will only discover next year!
We want you to get better and help you set goals and conquer them




We Are Looking For An Experienced Frontend Developer.




So, what will you be doing all day?




Design, code, and manage large-scale, highly available services using modern technologies (React, Typescript, Docker, etc., over AWS)
Tackle challenging problems and find creative ways to solve them
Lead decision-making & design of APIs, mechanisms, and abstractions
Build new features and directly impact the future of our product growth
Improve your skills and enrich other team members
Perform code reviews, evaluate implementations, and provide feedback
Have lots of fun!




This Is The Perfect Job For Someone Who




At least 6 year of development experience
Out of which - at least 3 years of UI oriented development experience
Experience in frontend development (Well-known frameworks- React, Vue)
Experience in NodeJS/.Net development - advantage
Experience with databases - advantage
Excellent communication skills
Comfortable taking challenges and learning new technologies
Team player, leader, mentor, confident, “getting things done”, independent, passionate and enthusiastic!




Why You’ll Love Being a Similarwebber




You’ll actually love the product you work with: Our customers aren’t our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said “the product.” Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.




You’ll find a home for your big ideas: We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You’ll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.




We offer competitive perks & benefits: We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.




You can grow your career in any direction you choose: Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it’s Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you’ll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.




Diversity isn’t just a buzzword: People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.

title: RA Team Leader
subTitle: Sight Diagnostics
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
At Sight Diagnostics, we aim to improve health through fast and accurate diagnostic testing. We have successfully built Sight OLO, our machine-vision based direct-from-finger CBC analyzer for near-patient testing. After deploying hundreds of devices across all continents and accumulating digital blood samples from tens of thousands of patients, we are now leveraging our assets and combining them with new top-notch software applications to execute our vision of a complete Digitized Blood Diagnostics ecosystem.

We are looking for a RA Team-Leader is in charge of developing and executing the company’s regulatory policy and strategy, establishing and maintaining registrations for the company’s devices internationally (with a strong emphasis on USA and EU markets).This role works closely with the R&D, Product, Operation and Quality teams, to maintain and ensure that the company meets FDA, CE, IVDR, ISO 13485, and additional quality and regulatory requirements.

In your role as a RA Team-Leader, you will:


Be part of the QA-RA group, reporting to the VP QA-RA.
Manage the day-to-day activities of the RA team members and provide professional guidance to the team.
People management responsibility of the RA team members, including hiring, on/offboarding, performance management, etc.
Support product development activities and provide clear guidance on regulatory implications.
Support commercial goals and market expansion by planning and obtaining necessary registrations, etc.
Be well-versed and maintain an updated global understanding of regulatory requirements, policies, and trends.
Lead the development and implementation of regulatory strategy for existing and new products.
Serve as the subject-matter expert for all regulations (MDSAP, FDA, CE(IVDR), ISO, etc.), ensuring the proper processes, policies and procedures are in place to obtain necessary regulatory approvals and maintain regulatory compliance.
Monitor external regulatory developments and changes and translate them to implications for the company leadership.
Review and approve all regulatory documents submitted to regulatory authorities
Ensure all internal and external changes are conducted according to regulatory requirements and provide regulatory guidance to the different teams across the company.
Manage relationships within the relevant regulatory agencies to improve the quality of submissions and understand the impact of any pending or proposed regulatory changes.
Act as the point of contact on all regulatory information related to Sight’s work for external parties
Review and approve all regulatory aspects related to Sight’s distributors including Sight Inc (US subsidiary)
Work with regulatory consultants to support RA activities
Be responsible for maintaining the cyber security requirements (HIPPA, GDPR, ISO 27001)
Serve as the Person Responsible for Regulatory Compliance in front of authorities


Requirements:

About You (skills, Experience, Potential)

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.


BSc Degree in Regulatory affairs, exact sciences, life science, engineering, or a law degree with a science background.
Scientific MSc – a plus.
Minimum 3 years’ at least one year of professional experience in regulatory affairs or in quality management systems relating to in vitro diagnostic medical devices
Experience with FDA / ISO 13485 – a plus.
Minimum of 2 Managerial experience as an RA manager, ability to train, mentor and overlook a team
Fluent in English, Excellent expression skills - written and verbal.
Excellent communication skills in both Hebrew and English
Ability to collaborate with and align with many stakeholders
Adaptability And resourcefulness to roll-up-sleeves and multi-task in order to thrive in a small company environment.


﻿About Sight:

Our Work: Founded in 2011, Sight Diagnostics Ⓡ aims to transform health systems and patient outcomes through accurate and convenient blood diagnostic testing. Sight’s technology, developed over almost a decade of research, represents breakthrough innovations in diagnostic methodology. Sight’s latest blood analyzer, Sight OLO Ⓡ, performs a Complete Blood Count, the most commonly ordered blood tests, with only 2 drops of blood from a finger prick or venous sample in minutes.

Our Culture: We are a team of passionate problem solvers who are committed to the social impact our technology represents. We enjoy tackling big, complicated and important technological, clinical and behavioral-change challenges, as a team, and we succeed through cross-disciplinary collaboration across a non-hierarchical structure. Sight is where everyone’s ideas are valued, considered and debated. We insist on a healthy work-life balance and support working parents with flexible working hours.

Our People: Sight is a rapidly growing team of over 150 individuals, working together on a common mission. We value diversity and are proud of the different professions, backgrounds, expertise and beliefs that make up Sight’s unique ways of thinking. Our people are united by two shared qualities: being exceptional at what they do and caring deeply about making positive changes in the world.

title: Technical Writer

location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
At Wiz, we move quickly. We’ve set the record for the fastest first year revenue growth of any tech startup, the fastest company to acquire more than 25% of the Fortune 500 as customers, the fastest company to reach $1B (and then $6B) in valuation, and now the fastest-growing software company ever by going from $1M to $100M in ARR in just 18 months. Most importantly, we provide the fastest ROI of any security product – Wiz connects to the entire multi-cloud environment within 15 minutes and identifies the specific infiltration vectors that make clouds susceptible to a breach in under 24 hours so organizations of all sizes and industries can rapidly identify and remove the most critical risks in AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes. We are looking for a Technical Writer to join our fast-moving product team.

As a young and rapidly growing startup, Wiz empowers everyone on the team to tackle a wide variety of content generation, delivery, and maintenance challenges from the get-go. Help produce weekly Release Notes and in-app notifications that inform colleagues and customers of newly added features

You’ll be a good fit if you have:

At least one year of experience in a technical writing role
Some sort of technical background, be it educational (a STEM degree) or professional (development, QA, analytics, etc.)
Mother-tongue level English and fantastic written communication skills
A hands-on, DIY attitude toward validating the guides you produce and update


Bonus:

Experience in security and/or delivering SaaS
Experience in cloud security


If your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. title: Solutions Engineer, PreSales - Enterprise Software
subTitle: Couchbase
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nRemote
description:
Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.




Location: Tel Aviv, Israel




We are looking for a Solutions Engineer to support the rapidly growing Couchbase user community and help drive customer success. Our Solutions (Pre-Sales) Engineers are the primary technical field experts, responsible for actively driving and managing the technical part of a sales engagement. This includes explaining NoSQL advantages, how Couchbase Server works and how it can be used to solve the customer’s problem, all with a good dose of getting customers excited about using this new approach for fast & scalable databases.




Whenever customers do a POC or hands-on evaluation, our solutions engineers help drive these by answering their questions and troubleshoot, so you will be hands on with technology.




Responsibilities




Show customers how to solve their problems and meet their requirements with Couchbase Server and get them excited about NoSQL database technology
Work closely with the sales team on account strategy and identifying additional opportunities in existing accounts
Ensuring the success of customer PoC/Pilots through effective management of acceptance criteria and issue escalation/resolution.
Developing and delivering exceptional company/product presentations and demonstrations
Work with all technical levels from managers, to architects and developers and explain Couchbase Server and its uses
Be the technical product expert for customers and stay up-to-date on the NoSQL competitive landscape
Work with Product Management and Engineering to provide feedback from the field and represent the customer perspective
Identify and write internal and external technical collateral, like typical deployment architectures or best practices




Preferred Qualifications




Fluent in English & Hebrew
4+ years pre-sales engineering for enterprise back-end software
2+ years RDBMS including schema modeling, performance tuning and configuration
Excellent presentation skills with an ability to present technical solutions concisely to customers or potential customers
Experience engaging with developers
Passion for diving into technical issues and solving customer problems
Proactive in engaging with customer
Familiarity with NoSQL databases or other distributed high-performance systems a big plus, but not required
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience




Why Couchbase?




Couchbase is named one of DTBA’s top 100 companies that matter in data. At Couchbase, we believe data is at the heart of the enterprise. We empower developers and architects to build, deploy, and run their most mission-critical applications. Couchbase delivers end-to-end technical solutions for all our customers with high-performance, flexible and scalable modern databases that run across the data centers and any cloud. Many of the world’s largest enterprises rely on Couchbase to power the core applications their businesses depend on. See our recent awards to learn what makes Couchbase such a great company to work at.




We Offer




This year Couchbase was recognized as one of the UK's Best Places to Work . Couchbase offers a total rewards approach to benefits for the value you create here. Couchbase recognizes the need for financial wellbeing.




Flexible time off
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
Paid parental leave
Flexible Spending Account for the things you care about most
An ergonomic and comfortable in-office setup, with food and supporting technology, or assist in the setup of an efficient home office environment.




Learn More About Couchbase




News and Press Releases




Couchbase Capella




Couchbase Blog




Investors




Disclaimer




Couchbase is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Join an impact initiative group and experience the amazing feeling of Couchbase can-do culture.

title: Senior Product Manager
subTitle: Flare
description:
About us

We believe everyone should have access to the legal services they need. Funded by leading VC firms, Flare (formerly Themis Tech) is an industry leader in legal technology. We’re reimagining how clients and attorneys work together, with one goal: to make legal services accessible to those who otherwise wouldn’t be able to afford it. We’re a team of creative problem-solvers who want to make the world a better place. Join us.

Check out helloflare.com for more!




Overview

We are looking for a brilliant Product Manager to join our rapidly growing startup, who shares our passion for re-imaging the consumer legal space, and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.

You will take full responsibility and ownership of the product, from inception to production. You're a creative thinker, excellent communicator, driven by users and numbers, and skilled in researching and analyzing users’ needs.




What you'll do:

You will ensure the success and growth of the product by developing a product vision, strategy, roadmap, and lifecycle management framework.
In charge of deeply understanding our users and identifying their needs; this through creating relationships with our clients and customer success teams & analyzing user data.
Own the product life cycle: market, BI, and user research, defining wireframes, scope, KPIs, and development process.
You will collect and analyze requirements, write clear and detailed product requirements, create wireframes, define AB test and user stories, prioritize backlog and drive execution.
Work closely with R&D, product, design, marketing & ops teams.




Who you are:

5+ years of hands-on Product Management experience, with proven success in delivering products.
Prior experience in B2C product management - an advantage.
Goal-oriented, highly motivated, takes full ownership of projects.
Excellent communicator, feel comfortable working with multiple stakeholders in Israel and in the United States.
Exceptional analytical decision-making skills, business thinking, Independent and organized.
Strong interpersonal skills, able to informally lead and drive discovery and execution with cross-functional teams.




Flare provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Group Architect
subTitle: Zerto
description:
Why choose Zerto?

Zerto, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, empowers customers to run an always-on business by simplifying the protection, recovery, and mobility of on-premises and cloud applications.

Zerto‘s revolutionary industry leading product is trusted by over 9,500 customers globally and is powering offerings for Microsoft Azure, IBM Cloud, AWS, Google Cloud, Oracle Cloud, and more than 350 managed service providers. We are continuously innovating, extending our core technology to support evolving customer needs, in areas such as ransomware recovery and Kubernetes protection, as well as being a leading part of Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s strategic GreenLake initiative, building the world’s best edge to cloud as-a-service platform.




We are happy to provide the freedom and flexibility of a hybrid remote and in-office work environment to all our team members




What will YOU do:

Become a domain expert in the worlds of Disaster Recovery, Business Continuity of both Virtual Machines and Kubernetes.
Become deeply familiar with our existing technology, architecture and codebase and leverage that knowledge to lay out an architectural and technological roadmap.
Study and research of new technologies.
Define high level and system level cross-component architectures over Linux and Containers infrastructure.
POC implementation of projects.
Work alongside the development teams and professionally guide them in product development.
In addition to research and independent study, the role includes hands on code development.
Collaborate with other architects and lead how our technology evolve.




What YOU need is:

Science or Engineering education (e.g Computer Science, Software engineering, Physics, Math, etc.)
7+ years of industry experience, of which 2+ years as an architect or similar positions.
Broad knowledge of system architecture patterns and best practices - e.g. distributed architectures, messaging, n-Tier, iDesign, microservices.
Deep understanding on how to build fault tolerant and highly available systems.
Work in independent research of new areas and technologies.
Programming Languages: C# or Java.
Good coding skills, e.g clean code, testing methodologies.
Basic experience with Containers.




Advantage:

Background in C++, Go, Python, Containers, Kubernetes.
Familiarity with storage, networking, virtualization, cloud APIs, performance optimizations, distributed systems, DBA.

title: Senior Product Manager - Mobile Core
subTitle: monday.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Description




Why monday.com?




monday.com’s mission is to empower teams, and organizations, to outdo their best.




The product helps teams ranging from garage startups, indie theaters cooperatives, hospitals, and churches to some of the world's best companies such as Apple, Adobe, Visa and Coca Cola. We’re growing super fast, and that means you’ll too.




Being a Product manager on monday.com




Your work will influence the day-to-day work of more than 1,000,000 people (and counting).




It’s a lot, but in many aspects, we feel that we’re just getting started.




You’ll be a full owner of your domain and in a great position to make a real impact on the entire company.




We’re looking for a stellar product manager who is passionate about building innovative and lovable products and wants to lead a world-class team of engineers & designers.




Someone who always starts with the ideal end state first and works backward from it, challenging all current assumptions.




You must be comfortable with being both strategic and hands-on, operating in a hyper-growth environment and have no fear of failing, and getting back on your feet again.




Why the mobile domain?




Impact at scale: Our goal is to reach any group of people that works together towards a common goal. That means more than 1.2B information workers.




Our mobile apps (Android, iOS and even a dedicated iPad app) empower individuals to proactively plan, update and collaborate with their team anywhere and anytime




Lead our core work experience, at a product-obsessed company: Product craft & delightful user experience is what makes us tick. It’s the heart of everything we do. And it pays off- our users swear by monday.com. Our users proposing to the platform, asking to hug the people who created it and are making halloween & Purim costumes of our product. If products are your passion- you are in the right place.




Solve problems that had never been solved before - Empowering people to collaborate on large scale boards with a small scale screen is a product problem that will require you to combine your discovery, data, execution and testing skill to build something that no company has managed to solve before (Did you ever open a spreadsheet on your phone? If yes, you know what we mean :))




Being a Product manager on monday.com




Your work will influence the day-to-day work of more than 1,000,000 people (and counting).




It’s a lot, but in many aspects, we feel that we’re just getting started.




You’ll be a full owner of your domain and in a great position to make a real impact on the entire company.




We’re looking for a stellar product manager who is passionate about building innovative and lovable products and wants to lead a world-class team of engineers & designers.




Someone who always starts with the ideal end state first and works backward from it, challenging all current assumptions.




You must be comfortable with being both strategic and hands-on, operating in a hyper-growth environment and have no fear of failing, and getting back on your feet again.




Why the mobile domain?




Impact at scale: Our goal is to reach any group of people that works together towards a common goal. That means more than 1.2B information workers.




Our mobile apps (Android, iOS and even a dedicated iPad app) empower individuals to proactively plan, update and collaborate with their team anywhere and anytime

And it pays off- our users swear by monday.com. Our users proposing to the platform, asking to hug the people who created it and are making halloween & Purim costumes of our product. Solve problems that had never been solved before - Empowering people to collaborate on large scale boards with a small scale screen is a product problem that will require you to combine your discovery, data, execution and testing skill to build something that no company has managed to solve before (Did you ever open a spreadsheet on your phone? If yes, you know what we mean :))




About The Role




You are an owner with entrepreneurial qualities - You’re self-driven, you take extreme ownership, and you feel comfortable making decisions without consensus.
You are a great human being.You’re all into teamwork- we’re not a great fit for genius jerks.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a product manager with a proven track record of impactful shipping products.
You are passionate about building great user experiences, and you have a keen eye for details, UX, and design.
You communicate well. You can explain the rationale of product decisions, and you can motivate, lead, and champion a product without “formal” authority.
You are analytical and experienced in working both with qualitative insights and quantitative data to drive product decisions. You know your way around A/B tests, analytics tools and user interviews, surveys, and usability tests.
You are a fast learner, adaptive, and feel at home in a fast paced, ever-changing environment.
You're passionate about the power of data in shaping great team work.
Previous experience leading SaaS products/ consumer products – Advantage.
Previous entrepreneurial or consulting experience – Advantage.
Previous experience with mobile products - Advantage




Requirements




You have at least 5 years of experience as a product manager with a proven track record of delivering impactful products - must
You possess natural ownership abilities and entrepreneurial qualities - you’re self-driven and you feel comfortable motivating, leading, and making decisions without consensus
You are passionate about building great user experiences, and you have a keen eye for details, UX, and design
You have strong communication skills and have the ability to thoroughly explain the rationale of product decisions
You are analytical and experienced in working both with qualitative insights and quantitative data to drive product decisions. You know your way around A/B tests, analytics tools and user interviews, surveys, and usability tests
You are a fast learner, adaptive, and thrive in a fast paced, ever-changing environment
Previous experience leading SaaS products/ consumer products – Advantage
Previous entrepreneurial or consulting experience – Advantage




Podcasts




How to maintain focus and fast execution during complicated projects

The Day After Closing a Company

title: Principal Product Management Manager -Microsoft Defender for IoT
subTitle: Microsoft
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Are you an experienced product leader looking for an opportunity to have an impact on securing every organization? Do you want to take ownership on a product portfolio and leading a product GTM strategy?

The IoT/OT Security is a new group at Microsoft (Based on the recent CyberX acquisition) which is responsible for building advanced security solutions to monitor and protect IoT and OT devices and networks. The product combines the cutting edge in network analysis technology, machine learning and cloud technology with the challenge of a fast-growing market of IoT devices with its large diversity and complexity.

In your role you will be responsible for Defender for IoT Go-To-Market and customer growth, driving sales and adoption of our product by working closely with sales, partners, marketing and flagship customers, crafting GTM strategies and product narrative, and play a pivotal role in driving learnings and new capabilities to maximize customer acquisition, growth and value.

Responsibilities

In your role, you will be responsible to drive market & customer growth in all product aspects, including:

Leading a product team that is responsible for product narrative & GTM strategy to expand product adoption in the market
Qualify flagship customers and work with sales teams up to a win (from lead to win)
Define and drive feature specification, work closely with engineering teams to deliver for gaining new customers and expansions
Identify customer growth opportunities and implement strategies to expand product reach (including expansion into new product areas)
Perform competitive analysis and win-loss analysis to identify product and messaging gaps and work to address them.
Drive cross org relationships to create new product strategies, business models and GTM.
Regularly present new product plans, status updates, product health and more to the leadership teams and customers.
Support ideation, vision, strategy, and roadmap for Defender for IoT capabilities, for all IoT security related components.

Qualifications

10+ years of Product Management experience, preferable in the B2B domain.
4+ years in managing product teams.
2+ years of experience in cybersecurity, networking or IoT/OT products.
Experience around growing, scaling a product in an emerging field, executing on the go-to-market strategy.
Passionate about helping customers and identifying the solution that delivers the most impact to their business.
Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming customer needs into an actionable product requirements definition.
Experience building strong working relationships with, collaborating with, and influencing diverse cross-functional teams (engineering, product, sales, marketing, etc.).
The ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment, make quick decisions and understand the consequences.
Thrives in team-based work, performs well in high-intensity environments, and is willing to roll up their sleeves to get things done for customers.
Self-starter, who proactively identifies problems, proposes solutions, and drives a team to address them.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

#ILDC-IOT

title: Marketing Insights Lead
subTitle: Konnecto
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
We are looking for a marketing insights leader to manage our marketing insights team focused on tactical and strategic insights delivered to our prospective clients.

Konnecto SaaS platform enables brands to know why consumers ended up buying products and/or services from their competitors and what they should do about it. By reverse engineering the entire path to purchase of customers that converted with a brand’s competitors and by providing daily recommendations around GTM strategy, audiences, and marketing activities.

Konnecto helps companies improve their marketing effectiveness and scale.

Company Highlights: Series A company with over $30M raised to date. Backed

by Tier-1 investors, 30+ employees, and growing quickly. HQ in Tel Aviv serving

customers across FMCG, Healthcare, Fintech, Insurance, Automotive and

Consumer Services.

Marquee customers include LEGO, Samsung, Mercedes,

etc].

As the marketing insights lead, you will own the end-to-end management of the marketing insights team. You will work closely with our sales and marketing team and the product and development teams to create marketing insights that will impact our sales cycle. You will act as the subject matter expert during the sales cycle and ensure a top-quality delivery of tactical marketing insights and strategic analysis for prospective clients.

Responsibilities:


Lead a team of 3-4 data analysts to produce marketing insights and strategic reports. This includes managing the existing team and building out the team for success in the future.
Own the presale pipeline from understanding the prospective client's needs and business questions to scoping and delivering, creating top-notch reports and recommendations.
Work closely with the sales and product team to enhance and expand the presale offering and reduce production time for analysis.
Improving our markets and industries' understanding to assist our pipeline generation effort


Requirements:

Requirements:


Fluent in English -Must
Proactive, Ambitious, Self Motivated
Experience in marketing
Analytical background / critical thinking skill set
Strong technical experience & skills (hands on SQL/noSQL; Python - bonus)
Client-oriented background
Experience in B2C companies

title: Product Marketing Manager
subTitle: Start-Up Nation Central
description:
Overview:

As a product marketing manager, you are an experienced marketing professional with the ability to take on ownership of the go-to-market strategy and thought leadership pertaining to Start-Up Nation Central’s offerings. In your role as Product Marketing Manager, you will become a recognized subject matter expert both internally and externally.




Who are we?

Start-Up Nation Central strengthens the Israeli innovation ecosystem and connects it to global opportunities, through identifying and bolstering locally developed technological solutions to shared global challenges. It acts as a gateway to tap into Israeli innovation, helping governments, companies, and investors navigate the ecosystem and identify solutions to their pain points. Fully funded by philanthropy, Start-Up Nation Central is in a unique position to create mutually beneficial connections for the Israeli innovation ecosystem and its international counterparts in an impartial and objective manner.




Our flagship product is the Finder Innovation Business platform, a free online platform for identifying and engaging Israeli tech organizations based on customers' specific interests. Finder is a comprehensive knowledge hub on Israeli start-ups, investors, acceleration hubs, multinational corporations, and technology-based innovation associated with academic research. The open-source platform provides up-to-date information and insights on thousands of active Israeli tech companies.




Roles and Responsibilities:

Product positioning and messaging – develop positioning strategies that create engaged customers and followers
Go to Market – strategize and plan the launch of new solutions, services, features, and content releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan – in online and offline channels
Develop compelling content and campaigns that will engage our audiences and reinforce Start-Up Nation Central’s position in the market, including case studies, videos, website copy, and blog posts
Develop “marketing tools” that facilitate the promotion of the offering and solutions.
Build a marketing plan with clear KPIs for the purpose of increasing user engagement, and the number of active users.
Lead audience and data-driven campaigns.
Brief the press and PR team on key new developments.
Market Intelligence – be the expert on your customer’s persona, where to find them, how to engage them and lead them to action.
Work hand-in-hand with the wider marketing team and other Start-Up Nation Central teams to open new avenues of opportunities and extend the organization’s reach

Qualifications:

Minimum of 6 Years of product marketing/marketing experience to global markets
Education - Bachelors in related discipline required, MBA preferred.
Experience in developing comprehensive and differentiating internal and external marketing strategies in a global market – Required.
Well versed in digital marketing, including social media tools, marketing automation, and nurturing techniques.
Experience in developing and communicating compelling thought leadership – Required.
Product Marketing and Marketing in a B2B setting – Required.
Well-seasoned presenter, at ease with presenting to all levels of management and external audiences.
Job seniority – experienced.
English language skills – Fluent.

title: Data Platform Architect - Data Applications, Field CTO Office
subTitle: Snowflake
description:
We’re at the forefront of the data revolution, committed to building the world’s greatest data and applications platform. Our ‘get it done’ culture allows everyone at Snowflake to have an equal opportunity to innovate on new ideas, create work with a lasting impact, and excel in a culture of collaboration.

Our Sales Engineering organization is seeking a Principal Data Platform Architect focused in Data Apps to join our EMEA Field CTO Office who can provide leadership in working with both technical and business executives in the design and architecture of the Snowflake Cloud Data Platform as a critical component of their enterprise data architecture and overall ecosystem.

In this role, you will work with sales teams, product management, and technology partners to leverage best practices and reference architectures highlighting Snowflake’s Cloud Data Platform as a core technology enabling platform for the emerging Data Application workload throughout an organization.

As a Principal Data Platform Architect focused on Data Apps, you must share our passion and vision in helping our customers and partners drive faster time to insight through Snowflake’s Cloud Data Platform, thrive in a dynamic environment, and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and talking shop with technical audiences.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:

Apply your data application architecture expertise while presenting Snowflake technology and vision to executives and technical contributors at strategic prospects, customers, and partners
Work with our product management, partners, and sales teams in order to drive innovation in our Cloud Data Platform
Partner with the sales team and channel partners to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate and accelerate winning sales cycles, provide compelling value-based enterprise architecture deliverables and working sessions to ensure customers are set up for success operationally, and support strategic enterprise pilots / proof-of-concepts
Collaborate closely with our Product team to effectively influence the Cloud Data Platform product roadmaps based on field team and customer feedback
Partner with Product Marketing teams to spread awareness and support pipeline building via customer roundtables, conferences, events, blogs, webinars, and whitepapers
Contribute to the creation of reference architectures, blueprints, best practices, etc. based on field experience to continue to up-level and enable our internal stakeholders and Snowflake Powered by Program


ON DAY ONE, WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:

10+ years of full-stack application architecture experience with a deep understanding of how to scale applications with large data sets
3+ years of Cloud Provider (AWS, Azure, GCP) customer-facing application development experience
Experience with Snowflake a plus
Outstanding presentation skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
A broad range of experience with on-prem and/or cloud databases
Knowledge of SQL, Javascript, Python, Java, Scala, Go, Ruby, or other languages
Industry Focus a plus (Education, Federal, Financial Services, Healthcare & Lifesciences, Insurance, Adv. Media, Retail CPG, Technology, and Telecom)
Bachelor’s Degree required Masters's Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred.

title: Product Manager
subTitle: Freightos
description:
Freightos.com is the online marketplace for the trillion dollar freight industry. With a stellar investor portfolio that includes GE Ventures and Aleph, $94 million in funding, and a team with a track record of successful exits, the seven year old company is transitioning from startup to rapid revenue growth.

No disrespect to Da Vinci, but anyone can paint a picture of a smiling woman. We’re looking for a Product Manager who can bring a solution to life that makes it easier to move pictures (or bananas, Twix bars, or cellphones) around the world. Sorry, Leonardo. Instead of chilling with a paint brush, our product manager will work together with customers to identify their needs (or as Ginger Spice would say it, what they want, what they really really want), articulate what success looks like for a product, and rally a team of engineers, QA specialists, designers and business stakeholders to turn that vision into a reality.

Not exactly a picture of Mona Lisa...but definitely a picture of freight perfection.

Since this is about changing an industry, we are on the hunt for an entrepreneurial product manager who not only knows how to develop great products (which is important too) but also understands how to introduce technology and products to successfully change how an industry works.




Role Expectations:




Meet with Enterprise customers to understand their pain and needs with regards to freight procurements.
Work with the business articulate a vision and strategy for building the best Enterprise Shipper freight procurement platform ever and craft a product roadmap to make it happen..
Track and analyze competition and market trends. Not to copy them; to out-innovate them so much, they cry a little and then send you an email saying that you are the bomb-diggity.
Transfer product strategies into detailed Product Requirement Documentation for prototype construction, feedback that makes it soooo much better, and final product development by engineering teams.
Understand how contracts and SOPs support product (and visa versa) and help craft the legal bits and pieces needed (with our business and legal teams of course).
Work with an international Product team to produce perfect and practical products punctually, across the product life cycle (research, competitive analysis, planning, coffee break, roadmap development, requirements development, coffee, product launch, and confetti).
Work with the Ops & Support teams to role out features to customers. Communicate the business targets to the dev teams ensuring tight alignment between business and tech teams.
Become the company expert on everything our system can do and set customer expectations accordingly. Act as a solution architect for customers. You’ll learn a lot and be confident committing to customers on 7 digit deals.
Hit the targets and customer commitments
This is an outboard role - you’ll work with other PMs and their teams to get the product doing what it needs to do.







Basic Qualifications:




At least 4 years of previous product management experience, working directly with developers and getting products built and to market.
You have too much experience working with large enterprises, designing and rolling out products that delight them, and product experience in B2B or SaaS.
You’re a team player, and a great communicator, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority (ie, you can make things happen).
You love change and working in a fast-paced growth environment keeps you excited.
Freight or supply chain experience, preferably in the operational/booking space.
You have excellent English.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with remote teams.




General:

Location: Jerusalem, hybrid

subTitle: Check Point Software Technologies Ltd

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to be responsible for our Network Threat Prevention product line.

If you are passionate about stopping advanced cyber attacks and want to work in a leading cyber security company (which is also ranked by Forbes as the best Israeli company to work for in 2022), then come and join us!

Work closely with R&D to deliver high-quality products on schedule
Drive strategic and alliance discussions with third-party leading technology vendors
Build positive relationships and trust through strong cross-team interactions, on-time delivery of high-quality products, and continuous innovation

Experience in presenting and driving strategic discussions with top senior executives

IN THIS POSITION YOU WILL:

Responsible for developing our proxy printer solution

driver Device development

Nayax develops both hardware and software products, telemetry, remote management, BI solutions, and mobile apps. Nayax devices can be found all over the world, with branches in 9 countries, and 40 distributing partners. Our devices serve consumers in 55 countries and accept 26 currencies.

title: Senior C/C++ Engineer, DDoS Team
subTitle: Imperva
description:
Imperva is a multi-billion dollar cybersecurity company, protecting the world’s largest organizations from cyber-attacks. We work in a Hybrid Model from home and from the office (Rehovot) and We have been recognized as one of the Best 50 high-tech companies to work for in Israel 2022 by Dun & Bradstreet! https://www.duns100.co.il/Imperva_%D7%90%D7%99%D7%9E%D7%A4%D7%A8%D7%91%D7%94




The DDoS team is looking for a strong Senior C/C++ Engineer .




The Network Security team is the frontline defense for all DDoS threats world-wide, against all Imperva’s customers and services. Our architecture must be highly scalable, performant, and continually evolve against threats as they emerge.




Candidates who enjoy computer networking, deep packet analysis, low-level, performance sensitive, systems programming and have deep analytical skills and excellent communication skills will find the DDoS team to be inline with their interests and desire for challenge. You must be able to highly collaborate, be creative, analytical and thrive in fast-paced environments, all while interacting with highly technical software and networking development teams.

Must Have




4+ years of programming experience with C/C++ including object-oriented design.
2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability, and scaling) of new and current systems
2+ years of experience with SaaS solutions
Experience building, maintaining, and supporting high performance production systems at scale




Advantage




Experience in developing in packet processing
Experience with Java (AWS Micro services)

DDoS expertise / Security domain




Skills / Abilities

Professional and positive approach

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
subTitle: Orca Security
description:
Dive right in. Swim with our pod.

At Orca, we believe that in the right environment and with the right team, talent has no boundaries. This team spirit, together with our drive to always aim high (because the cloud is the limit), have quickly earned us unicorn status and turned us into a global cloud security innovation leader. So if you’re ready to join an amazing team of people who inspire each other every day, now is the time to find your place in our pod.




We’re looking for driven and talented people like you to join our R&D team and our mission to change the future of cloud security. At Orca, we’re proud of what we do and we always aim high. This, together with our belief in the power of teamwork, has quickly turned us into a global cloud security innovation leader (and a unicorn). Ready to dive in and swim with our pod?




Highlights:

● Fast growth: This company has momentum. It’s THE opportune time to join Orca Security.

● Disruptive technology: Orca Security completely changed the way cloud is secured and is leading a new approach of how security solutions should be built. It’s completely agentless and detects every important risk in the cloud environment down to the data layer. It’s fast, simple, and complete.

● Well-capitalized: Total funding is almost $630MM in less than 24 months. CapitalG, Redpoint, GGV, YL Ventures, and SVCI. SVCI is a syndicate of CISOs who invested their own money after careful due diligence.

● Founded and led by 8 architects and executives from Check Point and quickly joined by many senior engineers from Palo Alto and Check Point.ABOUT THE ROLE

We are growing and looking for a talented highly-motivated and demonstrated team-player to join us. If you are looking for a challenging, interesting, and a high pace evolving product this might be the position for you. We have an inspiring team of top talents building a new SaaS product that revolutionizes the way security is being done in the cloud, using the latest technologies. We believe in infrastructure as a code and with a security mind set and encourage out of the box thinking and creativity.




Our Platform team is a core team in our R&D, and key function in product development and delivery. In your role as a DevOps engineer, you will plan, develop, monitor, and optimize the architecture of our company’s systems. You should excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding communication and leadership skills.




On a typical day you'll:

You will work with technologies such as Kubernetes, Dockers, Helm etc.
Design and implement solutions to improve new and existing infrastructure
Build monitoring systems, monitor the system’s health, implementing self-healing systems
Build and support R&D development, and production environments
Design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines
Assess existing implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.
Offer support by responding to system problems in a timely manner




ABOUT YOU

A minimum of 3+ years experience in a similar role and experience working with public clouds
Knowledge and experience with docker and containers orchestration (Kubernetes – Preferred ,Nomad)
Experience with Infrastructure as code, deployments done using descriptive languages such as Ansible & Terraform (Preferred)
Advanced knowledge of programming languages including Python, Go, JS etc.
Advance knowledge in GitOps such as ArgoCD, Atlantis, Github runners/actions, SonarQube, Mergify, Poetry
Knowledge and experience in SDLC and BuildSystem such as Bazel, Pants, Makefiles
Self-driven and eager to learn
Excellent organizational, analytical abilities and problem solving
Monitoring tools – Prometheus/Graphite
Knowledge in various system-level topics – OS, networking, file system management
Good English written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience

title: Data Scientist
subTitle: Fiverr
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Description




We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist who can leverage and develop innovative machine learning, NLP, and AI technologies, for solving problems within a wide scope.




As a part of our Data Science group, you will work on highly complicated challenges, from research to production, and help shape our algorithms and ML platform. You will work with Developers, Analysts, Product Managers, and business owners on growth opportunities and new ideas.




You should have a strong background and experience in the machine learning pipeline through business understanding, research, data exploration, feature engineering, model building, performance evaluation, testing, production-level code and deployment, model monitoring, and maintenance.




﻿Our work model is hybrid, combining remote and on-site work. This allows us to get things done when and where we are most productive.




WHAT AM I GOING TO DO?




Take leading roles in projects such as search engine ranking, promoted ads in Fiverr’s search results, recommendations, users segmentation and personalization, online bidding optimization, text analysis, real-time predictions, live streaming data handling, exploration-exploitation problems, etc.
Work closely with various departments in the company to provide advanced Data Science solutions end to end.
Write and own production models and code.
Independent research and innovation in new content and technological domains.
Lead and advise other team members.
Continuously produce new initiatives and improvement ideas.
Act as a leader of Fiverr’s Data Science ML platform. Develop models framework solutions for the group.




Requirements




MSc in Computer Science/Statistics/Engineering or related field with a focus on applied statistics, AI, machine learning, or related fields.
2+ years of production environment experience, working with predictive and probabilistic models, clustering algorithms, classification models, search and recommendation techniques.

Team player, Ability to handle several tasks simultaneously.
Strong knowledge in Python, SQL, and NoSQL.
Spark and Big data technologies experience – an advantage.
Research experience - an advantage.
Experience with e-commerce - an advantage.




At Fiverr, we’re not about checklists. If you don’t meet 100% of the requirements for this role but still feel passionate about the position and think you have the right skills and qualifications to excel at it, we want to hear from you.




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES




At Fiverr, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace, from our community to our product. Fiverr is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
