title: SW QA Engineer
subTitle: Stratasys
description:
Stratasys is a world leader in 3D printing!

Stratasys is leading the global shift to additive manufacturing with innovative 3D printing solutions for industries such as aerospace, automotive, consumer products and healthcare. Through smart and connected 3D printers, polymer materials, a software ecosystem, and parts on demand, Stratasys solutions deliver competitive advantages at every stage in the product value chain. The world’s leading organizations turn to Stratasys to transform product design, bring agility to manufacturing and supply chains, and improve patient care.

We are looking for a Software QA Engineer, to join our R&D team.

The Software QA Engineer will work in an integrated software and hardware development environment.

In-depth involvement and understanding are required from the engineer from the definition phase to the software release phase.

The work includes analyzing SRS documents, preparing an STP document, writing test documents and running them in practice using dedicated tools (Jira, PractiTest).

What you will be doing:

Defect and issue identification, logging, tracking and analyzing.
Testing a distributed software implemented in various software technologies as well as working with the leading 3D printers in the industry.
Taking active part in functional requirements review process.
Prepare and review the functional test plan (test scenarios, conditions and data).
Working in a high paced agile environment.

Must have for this role:

At least 5 years of testing experience, preferably in multi-disciplinary systems.
Highly motivated, eager to learn, self-learner, team player, can lead complicated assignment by his/her own.
Experience in testing distributed software systems.
Ability to develop SQL queries.
Strong technical skills, ability to deep dive into complex problems & find their root cause.
Proven experience with writing technical QA documents (STD, STP).
Previous experience in hardware testing
High level of written and verbal communication skills. (Hebrew & English).

Nice to have:

Academic degree in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent.
ISTQB certified or relevant QA course.
Background in developing automated testing.

What you will be part of:
Company Overview - https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/history/
Our Culture and Values - https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/culture/
Our Sustainability “3D Printing a Better Tomorrow” - https://www.stratasys.com/en/about-us/sustainability/
Our Locations - https://www.stratasys.com/en/contact-us/office-locations/
Check out our Video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wmDfmt2bNI

title: Marketing Automation Manager
subTitle: monday.com
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Description




monday.com is looking for a Marketing Automation Specialist to join our Marketing Automation Team.




We're looking for someone who can plan, develop and implement automated marketing campaigns in order to increase user retention, engagement, and conversion rates.




You will need to know our users and their needs, set up and deploy new emails and in-product flows, analyze and optimize for specific segmentations. You’ll identify new opportunities for the user lifecycle and drive engagement and retention efforts that have a direct impact on the business growth and revenue goals.




We are looking for a motivated, innovative and results-driven person, with a passion for marketing, user experience, and optimization.




About The Role




Manage end-to-end automated marketing campaigns: from ideation, through set up & segment and ends with analysis & optimization.
Continuously experiment: execute A/B tests on email concepts, subject lines, content, CTAs, sending times, layouts, and more.
Collaborate with designers and copywriters, identify target audience segments and capture feedback from multiple stakeholders.
Build a cross-channel experience with several touchpoints, like emails, in-product, pushes to create automated, triggered, and transactional programs.
Monitoring and analyze campaign ongoing and end results, to deliver recommendations based on insights and troubleshooting when necessary.
Operating an admin system, analyzing & reporting, testing, project management and HTML coding.




Requirements




2+ years of experience in marketing automation-preferable in a SaaS company
Understanding of email best practices for email creatives, templates, metrics and associated KPIs, segmentation, dynamic content, and testing methodologies.
Experience with marketing automation /email marketing platforms such as
Braze/ Hubspot / Silverpop or similar
Basic + knowledge of HTML and content management systems
Experience working with marketing analysis, working with large sets of data and numbers.
Familiarity with SQL - Advantage
Self-motivated, creative thinker with a “can-do” attitude
Project management skills with exceptional attention to detail
Analytical mind, with the ability to make data-driven recommendations.




Social Description




Our marketing team at monday.com is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a talented Marketing Automation Manager join us!

As a technical engineer analyst, you be in charge of investigating and solving technical issues in the production environment, acting as the front line of the R&D team. You’ll be required to diagnose and triage production issues and delegate them to the relevant team member or to the product team.

Experience with monitoring systems such as Prometheus and Grafana.

title: Senior Software Engineer
subTitle: Viz.ai

description:
Viz.ai is the pioneer in the use of AI algorithms and machine learning to increase the speed of diagnosis and care, covering more than 200 million lives across 1,200+ hospitals and health systems in the U.S. and Europe. The AI-powered Viz Platform is an intelligent care coordination solution that identifies more patients with a particular disease, informs critical decisions at the point of care, and optimizes care pathways and helps improve outcomes. Backed by clinical data, the Viz Platform delivers significant value to patients, providers, and pharmaceutical and medical device companies. The company was named to the Forbes 2021 Next Billion-Dollar Startups list of the 25 fastest-growing venture-backed startups and has been on the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years. For more information visit viz.ai.




We are growing and are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our mission in developing life saving software!




Job Description




Viz.ai is growing fast, and as we grow we scale both in the number of patients we treat and in the number of products we have in our portfolio. Your mission will be to build a robust yet flexible enough system that can withstand such growth.




Your responsibilities will span from design to implementation of a complex, time critical, micro services system with high volumes of data. You will collaborate with various teams, including the algo, data and product teams, in order to deliver the best code using high end technologies.

We are running on AWS and using various technologies to run our services. We are always open to new technologies and tools that will help us to do our job even better.

You love Interacting with great people who are open and fun to hang out with

Our office in Tel-Aviv is located in Menachem Begin 150, within walking distance of Arlozorov and Ha'Shalom train stations.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
subTitle: Hello Heart
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
About Hello Heart




Hello Heart is the only digital therapeutics company to focus exclusively on heart disease, the leading cause of death for U.S. adults. Through a connected device and mobile app that uses AI, behavioral science, and personalized digital coaching to drive lifestyle changes, Hello Heart empowers people to embrace healthier behavior, which can reduce the risks of high blood pressure and heart disease. It also helps users catch blood pressure readings that are extremely high and encourages them to talk to their doctor to identify potential risk in time. Validated in peer-reviewed studies and trusted by leading Fortune 500 companies, Hello Heart is easy to use and works alongside an employer’s benefits ecosystem. Founded in 2013, Hello Heart is a member of the American Heart Association’s Innovators’ Network and is part of the CVS Health Point Solutions Management program. Hello Heart is backed by leading VCs including Stripes, Khosla Ventures, IVP, Blue Run and Resolute. Visit www.helloheart.com for more information.




About The Role




We are growing! This past year we tripled our customers and revenue. Due to hyper-growth, we seek a Full Stack Engineer who will join our engineering team and take a lead role in the development and maintenance of Hello Heart's mobile app - the core of our business.




As part of our small team of experienced and highly talented developers, you will be working on a product that actually saves lives by taking lead work with a variety of technologies and projects.




The position includes working closely with the Product, Design and Data Science teams, taking full ownership of your work from conception to post-deployment, while continuously learning and evaluating cutting edge technologies in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Our Technologies stack: React Native, Redux, React JS, Scala, Play, Microservices, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, MongoDB, Redis, Postgres, Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka, and more.




Areas Of Responsibility




Develop code that is used daily around the world and actually saves lives!
Work with our data science team on implementing their algorithms into our new and upcoming data driven solutions.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Experience Designers and Data Engineers on all aspects of product development: strategy, brainstorming, user research, design, execution, AB testing, and iteration.
Take part in making a major difference in our team and influence our technology stack.
Join a great team of people passionate about technology and doing good to the world.




Qualifications




4+ years of professional experience in mobile software development preferable React Native.
BS degree in Computer Science or similar, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one of the following: Scala, Java, Ruby, Python, Go.
Experience with databases Postgres, MongoDB, etc - Advantage.
Familiar with cloud-based deployment: AWS, Docker, Serverless, etc - Advantage




Hello Heart has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture - we look for people who are collaborative, creative, and courageous. Oh, and if you want to see some recent evidence of the fun things we do at Hello Heart, check out our Instagram page.

title: Principal Fullstack Engineer
subTitle: Axonius
description:
Axonius is the cybersecurity asset management platform that gives organizations a comprehensive asset inventory, uncovers gaps, and automatically validates and enforces policies. Deployed in minutes, the Axonius cyber asset attack surface management (CAASM) solution integrates with hundreds of data sources to give customers the confidence to control complexity by mitigating threats, navigating risk, decreasing incidents, automating response actions, and informing business-level strategy. Hundreds of customers worldwide like The New York Times, Schneider Electric, and AB InBev trust Axonius to control complexity.




Headquartered in New York, New York, Axonius employs over 600 people worldwide and achieved unicorn status in early 2021. Axonius has been recognized with the Great Place to Work Certification™, was named one of Fortune’s 2021 Best Small and Medium Workplaces™, and was named to Dun’s Best Start Up Companies to Work for Over 100 Employees. Most recently, Axonius was also named to the 2021 and 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 list of the top 100 private SaaS companies in the world, as well as named to Inc. magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces and has been cited as the fastest growing cybersecurity company in history by revenue.




We are growing rapidly and are looking for superstars to join our rocket ship.

As part of our rapid growth we are looking for a Principal Fullstack Engineer to join us!




Responsibilities:




You will be a part of the Axonius R&D team, implementing new and exciting features, end-to-end.
Lead and drive technical cross teams projects end to end.
Build solutions for complex, large-scale problems.
Technical guidance of team members' tasks.
You will work with the best techies and professionals
Our stack includes Python, Vue.js, MongoDB, Redis, RabbitMQ, AWS, and Docker

At least 8 years of experience as a full-stack developer
Extensive professional experience with advanced JavaScript, CSS, and at least one modern UI framework (React, Vue, Angular)
Extensive professional experience with at least one high-level backend language (Python, Node.js, Java, C#, Go)
A team player with strong communication skills, but also capable of working independently
Can do approach




Advantages:




Highly experienced with Python
Highly experienced with Vue or React
Experience in building complex, high scale
Hands-on experience with relational databases
Experience with writing automated tests
Computer science or an equivalent degree
Background in the cybersecurity industry/enterprise IT




A little more about Axonius:




We are a remote-first culture. We have offices in New York and in Tel Aviv, but the majority of our employees are working from home across the US and Internationally.
Our people aren’t just great professionals, they are great people. We are all here to support each other, ready to help and do what’s best for the entire company.
Focus on Career growth. We love seeing our people grow into new roles and work hard to ensure everyone sees and can realize a long term career path here at Axonius.




At Axonius we support a diverse and inclusive workplace and believe in equal employment opportunity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

title: Senior Mobile developer
subTitle: Agmatix
description:

agmatix’s vision is to create best of class sustainable agriculture for the future by making high quality and standardized agronomic data freely available for ag professionals to translate into impact. To do that, agmatix is building a leading digital field trials technology that is revolutionizing data driven agriculture. Our technology disrupts a domain where lack of common language, connectivity and data curation methodologies are significant barriers for improvements. Implementing agmatix solutions will allow agricultural professionals around the world to increase crops yields while reducing environmental damage and improving crop quality over time.

agmatix is built on a set of 6 core values, we are proud to say we stick to the following:

Cutting Edge- Constant state of mind to improve, grow and learn

Daring- We strive to change the world with the best solutions, Reshaping the future of agriculture.

Determination- We strive to change the world with the best solutions

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
subTitle: Forter
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
About us:




Digital commerce is built on trust. At every point along the eCommerce journey, businesses must make a critical decision: Can I trust this customer? Answering this simple question accurately and instantly is powerful—it can accelerate revenue growth and strengthen a company’s connection with its customers. How do we do it? Forter was founded on the insight that it's not about what is being purchased, nor where— but who is behind the interaction.




The Forter Decision Engine finds patterns across more than one billion identities in our dataset. We isolate fraudsters and protect customers—ensuring everyone gets the experience they deserve. Given that trust is central to how we operate, Forter is very much driven by a defined set of values. We attract remarkable talent and have retention and engagement levels that are well above benchmarks. We’re meticulous about strengthening our culture as we grow and ensuring this is an environment where people can have outsized impact.




About the role:




Forter is looking for a Senior Full stack Engineer to develop and cultivate new products for fraud detection. More than in other teams, the engineering decisions made by Forter’s product team need to balance not only engineering factors, but also user experience, aesthetics, legal and financial considerations, and a general sense for what's most important.




Engineers on the Product team have a knack for making tools powerful without compromising their ease of use. This applies to both visual tools (like our customers’ dashboard and our internal analysts’ system) and programming tools (like our API).




What you'll be doing:




Influence how our product offering looks and behaves.
Design and implement unique solutions for data interfaces for clients’ platforms.
Take full ownership of a feature set from the first discussion to bringing it to live on the site.
Self-managing project planning, milestones, designs, and estimations
Holding yourself and others to a high standard when working with production systems. We take pride in our tests, monitoring & alerting abilities just as we do with our systems




What you'll need:




5+ years of experience throughout the web development stack such as Node.js, Storybook, Karma, React, VueJS, Lit, AngularJS, ES6 etc.
Expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypical inheritance, scope & closures.
Advanced HTML & CSS (including SASS/LESS) skills.
Strong pixel-perfect attention to detail.
Great communication skills.
Self-driven and can deliver solutions partnering with both internal and external development teams without the need of a project manager.
Professional proficiency in English




We'd love it if you have:




Experience with building low latency web applications.
Experience with UI/UX (Photoshop, Micro-Interactions, animations, etc.).
Experience with building automation and package management tools such as Webpack/Rollup.
Experience building browsers’ extensions/plug-ins
Experience working with or building internet payment interfaces




Life as a Forterian:




We are a team of over 500 Forterians spread across 3 different continents. Our success so far in the marketplace has allowed us to achieve a total series F valuation of over $3 Billion, making us the most valuable privately-held fraud prevention company globally. Our investors include Tiger Global, Bessemer, Sequoia Capital, March Capital, and Salesforce Ventures.




At Forter, we believe unique people create unique ideas, and valuable experience comes in many forms. So, even if your background doesn't match everything we have listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply and tell us why your skills and values could be an asset to us. By welcoming different perspectives, we grow together as humans and as a company.




Forter is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Software Engineer
subTitle: Cellebrite
description:
Our mission:

Cellebrite’s (Nasdaq: CLBT) mission is to enable its customers to protect and save lives, accelerate justice, and preserve privacy in communities around the world. Cellebrite is a global leader in Digital Intelligence solutions for the public and private sectors, empowering organizations to master the complexities of legally sanctioned digital investigations by streamlining intelligence processes. Trusted by thousands of leading agencies and companies in more than 140 countries, Cellebrite’s Digital Intelligence platform and solutions transform how customers collect, review, analyze and manage data in legally sanctioned investigations.




What is your mission?




You will learn the domain of digital intelligence while acquiring a good perception of our business objectives. We provide the necessary tools and solutions for Forensic Examiners, Police Officers, and Detectives to connect the dots through our technology of crime investigations, protect and save lives, accelerate justice, and ensure data privacy. You will take full ownership of features from design through implementation to delivery, you will be working together with stakeholders and other team members in order to bring great value to our customers. As we modernize our tech stack you will need to bring your experience to the whiteboard while we set our target architecture and future tech roadmap.







What you’ll love about your mission:




You will be working together on a market-led product while facing complex software challenges.
You will bring real impact to our customers, helping them make our world a safer place.
You will be designing and implementing features for a live production system
You will take part in modernization and refactoring
Improve performance and scalability of the application
Take part in the way we shape our target architecture of applications and services
Track customer feedback and needs




The superpowers we are looking for:




You are a cross-stack engineer who is seeking the bigger picture. You have vast experience in building high-performing & scalable enterprise applications. You are curious about new technologies and frameworks and always push for changes and the evolution of your team.




Requirements:




5+ years of development experience, at least 2 years in C# - Must
Experience with CI/CD and Shift-left techniques - Must
React/Angular/Vue experience – Advantage
Experience with Databases – Advantage

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
subTitle: BioCatch
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
As fast as cybercriminals change, we are changing too.

BioCatch is a dynamic startup that takes an innovative approach to combating fraud by unlocking the power of behavior. The market leader in behavioral biometrics, BioCatch’s proprietary technology analyzes physical and cognitive digital behavior to distinguish between genuine users and criminals to detect fraud and identity theft and to improve customer experience. With over a decade of analyzing data, over 60 patents and unparalleled experience, BioCatch continues to innovate to solve tomorrow’s problems. Leading financial institutions around the globe use BioCatch to more effectively fight fraud, drive digital transformation and accelerate business growth. With employees in 19 countries and over 50 customers on 5 continents, BioCatch’s reach expands around the world.

Come work with intensely curious people who are dedicated to innovation, growth, and protecting customers against cybercrime and fraud!

We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our applications platform development as part of BioCatch's Applications Group.




Responsibilities:

Design, implement and maintain applications and web services within the Applications Group’s ecosystem.




Design and implement testable and maintainable software solutions using both front-end and back-end technologies.




Come up with innovative ideas and recommend software improvements to existing applications.




Work closely with product managers and transform product and user requirements into technical tasks.




Build the team's domain expertise and assume product ownership.




Our Current Tech Stack Includes:

NodeJS/ExpressJS (Javascript/Typescript)
Python/Django
ReactJS
Java
Kotlin
MongoDB
Postgres
MS-SQL Server
RabbitMQ







Requirements :

B.Sc. in Computer Science or equivalent experience
At least 5 years of experience in designing and developing applications using NodeJS/Java/Go/C# - a must
Experience in developing Angular2/React/Vue frameworks, HTML, CSS, and JS (ES2015, TypeScript) - a must
Hands-on experience in at least one RDBMS (POSTGRES, MYSQL, Oracle, etc.) – a must
Experience working on native Android/IOS applications - an advantage
Experience working and using Linux and Docker – an advantage
Experience implementing CI/CD processes – an advantage
Experience with NoSQL databases – an advantage
Excellent coding skills with a good understanding of large-scale architecture and design patterns
Be innovative and open-minded with a strong passion for technology and eagerness to learn new things

title: Full Stack Engineer
subTitle: R2Net Inc - JamesAllen.com
description:
R2Net Inc. is an international software company, owned by the world's largest retailer of diamond jewelry, Signet Jewelers (NYSE SIG). What began as a modest trading network to sell diamonds has steadily transformed into a robust e-commerce and supply chain platform that connects the entire span of the diamond industry’s ecosystem, including manufacturers, retailers, and consumers. R2Net owns and operates three distinct brands, James Allen, Segoma, and Brio Animation Studio.

JamesAllen.com is the fastest-growing online retailer of engagement rings and loose diamonds, allowing customers to personalize and order engagement rings and other fine jewelry online.




What’s It Like To Work For Us?

At R2Net, we’re proud of our unique and diverse work environment, striving to employ people from many different backgrounds and cultures. Every team member has a voice within the company and contributes to our overall development. We provide ample opportunities for growth and cultivate a collaborative and entrepreneurial approach to our day-to-day work. Additionally, it is very important to us to promote a strong work-life balance for each of our employees.







Responsibilities:

Full Stack Tech Lead - 80% Development 20% Lead.

Participate in the architecture, design, development, and delivery of complex features in a distributed and dynamic development environment.

Develop with the latest technologies, such as recoil, socket.io, micro frontend, module federation.

Write JavaScript/Typescript for Node.js web services and React Web apps.

Write well-designed, testable, efficient code that complies with specifications.




Requirements:

At least 5 years of experience in developing web applications using React.

Experience in NodeJS and JavaScript/Typescript Development.

Experience with DevOps tools; Docker/ Kubernetes/ CI\CD.

Extensive experience with full-stack development, distributed systems, and relational databases (MySQL or other).

Experience in AWS or another cloud environment.

Team player, strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and empathy.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
subTitle: Loox
description:
Loox is the #1 paid app on Shopify, helping over 100,000 online brands scale their business with the power of their happy customers, serving over 500 million shoppers a month.




Behind the scenes is a work culture that values every employee's voice. Thanks to a collaborative, innovative atmosphere, each team member has the ability to make a significant impact and move the needle. That's why we are excited to share that we are looking to add some new, key team members to our driven team.




We are looking for a highly talented and enthusiastic senior Fullstack developer, with an excellent understanding of server-side technologies and the web environment, critical thinking, and a healthy disrespect for the impossible.




What you'll do:

Work with a small team of talented, highly motivated, and product-driven engineers.
Evolve our engineering and architecture to support the ever-growing scale of users, features, and data.
Take part in building scalable and maintainable systems.
You’ll have lots of room to grow. The only limit to your potential here is your own dedication to succeed.
Work closely with Product & Design, while having full ownership of features from hypothesis, planning, and technical design to post-deployment and impact measurement.
Our Stack - Node.js, Vue.js, MongoDB, Elastic Search.




What you'll need:

3+ years of hands-on experience, including in building a web application from scratch.
Fluent in the dark arts of the web - Vast knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript with emphasis on performance (working vanilla or using a framework).
1+ years of experience in Node.js.
1+ years of experience in large scale NoSQL Databases production deployments.
Experience with large scale traffic, data, and complex architecture.
Experience as a software architect - Plus.
ElasticSearch / Kibana- Plus.
Be an open-source lover and technology enthusiast.
Be a team player.







We would love to chat and tell you more - Contact us at jobs@loox.io

title: Full Stack Developer
subTitle: CentralNic PLC
description:
Department: Technology

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Israel

Reporting To: Amir Gat

Description

CentralNic is looking for an exceptional full-stack developer to take our tech products to the next level. You'll have the opportunity to design, develop and scale a variety of projects with different backend and frontend stacks. Our platform integrates super-large datasets consisting of millions of sub-second records with self developed internal products to managed, lead and optimize our logic. Therefore, you'll work closely to the business side of things so even small creative tech solutions can lead to amazing results.

Drive, design, develop and scale a variety of projects with different backend and frontend stacks
Lead and optimize our logic
Provide creative thinking
Create small tech solutions that can lead to amazing results

Have a passion for data pipelines, high-scale automations and building products from zero
Bring demonstrable experience in JS/TypeScript/Python (alongside React)
Enjoy a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize, define and move quickly between tasks
Bring the experience to create, learn and modify complex time-series queries
Be able to learn new and complex tasks quickly
Be happy to work independently
Be curious, research, and ask questions
Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both oral and in writing
Have exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail
Be a creative thinker, always thinking “how can we”

Experience And Skills That Will Help You Succeed

Experience with large-scale cloud architectures
The ability to recruit and build a team

Tech Stack Experience In

Airbyte, BigQuery, RedwoodJS (TypseCript, React, Prisma, Apollo, GraphQL), Python, Nest alongside others

What we offer

There are many reasons to come on board our team of talented professionals, but here are just a few…

We are collaborative, fair, consciously inclusive, and flexible
We trust, value, and support our people to make the difference
We believe that diversity of thought and experience provides the platform for innovation and creativity
We invest in the development of our people to drive our ambitions forward

We offer a great work environment in an internationally successful enterprise in the online services industry

If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us or need us to make any reasonable adjustments, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at talent@centralnic.com

title: Sr. Backend Engineer
subTitle: At-Bay
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
About At-Bay

At-Bay combines world-class technology with industry-leading insurance to help clients meet risk head-on. Partnering with brokers and business owners alike, we provide modern insurance products and active risk monitoring services for companies of every size and in every industry. Our team boasts many backgrounds and skills, from analysts and developers to designers and underwriters, and everything in between — all working together to redefine what it means to be an insurance company.

We’re proud to be a diverse company and to have expertise from multiple industries driving our culture. At-Bay is expanding rapidly, and as we grow, we’re prioritizing inclusive hiring practices and supportive team environments. We’re committed to building a company culture where people of all identities and backgrounds are empowered to thrive, develop their career, and bring their full self to work.

At-Bay is a globally distributed company with hubs in Atlanta, New York City, San Francisco, and Tel Aviv. To date, we have raised $292 million in funding from Acrew Capital, Glilot Capital, Icon Ventures, ION Crossover Partners, Khosla Ventures, Lightspeed Venture Partners, M12, entrepreneur Shlomo Kramer, and Qumra Capital.

Responsibilities

Join a team of highly motivated developers to work together to fill At-Bay’s growing software and scaling needs

Work on a range of customer-facing and internal projects, including scaling up our web-based and infrastructural software and internal security and insurance tools

Directly work on matters that are critical to the company, building software that is used actively by our insurance team and our customers whilst solving challenging software problems

Writing well-tested, organized and robust code to support a rapidly growing organization

Proactively taking on software tasks to give efficient turnaround to the requirements of the rest of our international company

Work in a modern software environment with continuously deployed and integrated code in our cloud-based infrastructure

Taking responsibility of your code, quickly responding to bugs and making sure new and existing software runs smoothly

Communicating and working openly with other developers to solve problems and produce high-quality code

Qualifications


4+ years of hands-on experience as a backend engineer in Python (preferred) , Java or Go
Experience with RESTful API development
Experience in coding to cloud production environments such as AWS
Strong desire to bring products to life, supporting a demanding user base, constantly introducing innovative features whilst keeping things stable
Experience with relational databases such as MySQL, Postgresql
Excellent communication skills in Hebrew and English
Knowledge in Cyber Security/ Networking- Advantage
Experience with microservices architecture - Advantage
Experience with Event based architecture and infrastructures such as: Kafka, Kinesis, SNS/SQS - Advantage
Experience with Docker & Kubernetes- Advantage


Location: Tel Aviv, Israel

What you'll get

A competitive salary, and equity in a super fast growing company, taking over commercial insurance

A strong emphasis on work-life balance

Beautiful offices in the heart of Tel Aviv, near the train station and main bus stops

Passionate, smart, and fun people to work with

You will never lack a challenge, we are a unique blend of a fast growing tech startup, an international firm, and an insurance company

Learn more at at-bay.com

title: Group Manager of R&D- React, Nodejs

A company that developed a gaming platform that's tailored and made for the gamer’s needs.




As our VP of R&D you will:

● Work together with the management to lead the company's technology side.

title: Principal Backend Engineer R&D
subTitle: Axonius
description:
Axonius is the cybersecurity asset management platform that gives organizations a comprehensive asset inventory, uncovers gaps, and automatically validates and enforces policies. Deployed in minutes, the Axonius cyber asset attack surface management (CAASM) solution integrates with hundreds of data sources to give customers the confidence to control complexity by mitigating threats, navigating risk, decreasing incidents, automating response actions, and informing business-level strategy. Hundreds of customers worldwide like The New York Times, Schneider Electric, and AB InBev trust Axonius to control complexity.




Headquartered in New York, New York, Axonius employs over 600 people worldwide and achieved unicorn status in early 2021. Axonius has been recognized with the Great Place to Work Certification™, was named one of Fortune’s 2021 Best Small and Medium Workplaces™, and was named to Dun’s Best Start Up Companies to Work for Over 100 Employees. Most recently, Axonius was also named to the 2021 and 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 list of the top 100 private SaaS companies in the world, as well as named to Inc. magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces and has been cited as the fastest growing cybersecurity company in history by revenue.

We are growing rapidly and are looking for superstars to join our rocket ship.




Responsibilities:




Take a leading part in building and architecting the Axonius product
Research solutions for challenging problems
Architectural and technological research
Working with a team of top-tier engineers to solve hard problems and scale the product




Requirements:




At least 6 years as a backend developer
In-depth experience with high scale production systems
Highly experienced with Python
Understanding of fundamental design principles for building a scalable application
Experience with MongoDB
Background in Cybersecurity
Deep understanding of networks
Can-do approach




A little more about Axonius:




We are a remote-first culture. We have offices in New York and in Tel Aviv, but the majority of our employees are working from home across the US and Internationally.
Our people aren’t just great professionals, they are great people. We are all here to support each other, ready to help and do what’s best for the entire company.
Focus on Career growth. We love seeing our people grow into new roles and work hard to ensure everyone sees and can realize a long term career path here at Axonius.




At Axonius we support a diverse and inclusive workplace and believe in equal employment opportunity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

subTitle: Transmit Security

description:
Transmit Security gives businesses the modern tools they need to build secure, trusted and end-to-end digital identity journeys to innovate and grow. CX-focused, cybersecurity conscious leaders rely on Transmit Security’s xCIAM platform to provide their customers with smooth experiences protected from fraud across all channels and devices.

Transmit Security serves many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, and other leading brands, collectively responsible for more than $1.3 trillion in annual commerce. For more information, please visit www.transmitsecurity.com.

About the Role:

Transmit Security is a top player in its game and is heading for an exciting year. In this role, you will take an integral part in the creation of a new and innovative SaaS product.

If you are a talented Web-SDK Engineer that likes to solve complex problems and looking for your next challenge we want you to join our team!

What you’ll do:

You'll join a core team in Transmit’s account protection product, that is responsible for Web SDK & Data collection, Risk Recommendation API, Account Protection Challenges, Analytics, Admin experience, Developer experience and Integrations with cross transmit products.

What you’ll need:

At least 4 years of experience as a web developer.
Extensive experience in web sdks and javascript.
Experienced with web browsers’ low-level APIs.

"

title: Full Stack Tech Lead
subTitle: Fabric
description:
Your code can power your next online delivery! If you’ve ever ordered online from Rami Levy or Super-Pharm here in Israel, it’s possible it was fulfilled by Fabric, a retail technology company that combines cloud-scale software with advanced robotics to create amazing customer experiences, from click to delivery. We’re expanding our rapidly growing software team and need talented engineers to tackle huge challenges and bring our cloud-scale software down to earth to make a real impact in the real world.







Our R&D team




We are a team of software engineers, algorithm developers, data scientists and researchers, all dedicated to building our Robotic Fulfillment Platform.

We have a diverse tech stack, with a backend organized in a microservices architecture that helps keep it flexible.

We’re investing in DevOps culture, which means end-to-end ownership from supporting the feature design to monitoring the production deployment.




About the role




The code you will write will live in the heart of our product. It is what we call the “fulfillment platform” domain.




It starts at the top, with exposing customer facing API’s and handling customer updates.
Continues with allocating and managing inventory and stock.
Proceeds with prioritizing and executing picking orders, receiving stock, and other robotic operation tasks.
Finally, seeing the order through packing and delivery processes.







Our code sets the pace of the site operation. We optimize movement in the site so that operations are smooth, fast, and efficient.







Modern, scalable, complex

Microservices done right
Production in k8s on cloud (GCP)
Kafka and HTTP based inter-service communication
Node.JS / TypeScript / React
MongoDB / Redis
100% continuous deployment







Here are just some of the challenges you’ll tackle:

Robot choreography: You want to move a robot from point A to B. Simple, right? Wrong.
Coding for scale: How do you work with software at scale when robots are involved?
Tote selection: How do you optimize for efficiency in constantly moving, complex sites?







Requirements







5+ years of experience of coding and design of large cloud based systems
Experience working with complex, large-scale applications
A deep understanding of production systems and the architecture of web applications
Independent, fast learner and excited about learning new technologies.
Proactive team player with a desire to impact our team, our product and our customers







About Fabric




Founded in 2015, Fabric has raised $338 million to date and is backed by leading investors including Corner Ventures, Innovation Endeavors, Aleph, Playground Ventures, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments), Evolv (Kraft Heinz), Temasek, Princeville Capital, and more.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Microsoft Defender for Identity - TLV
subTitle: Microsoft
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Cyber-attacks are increasing in volume and sophistication, evading traditional defenses, and posing a growing risk to enterprises from outside criminal organizations and malicious insiders in the organization.

The Microsoft Defender for Identity (MDI) team develops and weaponizes a unique built-in cloud service that works to change this reality.

MDI builds security around active directory identity infrastructure that protects thousands of organizations and millions of enterprise users by safeguarding their identities from attacks.

MDI alerts security teams of possible identity compromise and ensures enterprises can better control and improve their identity posture to minimize their risks. Join our team of product experts to help us define and shape the next big leap in the Microsoft Defender for Identity journey.

We deal with extremely complex security challenges, hard-core scale and performance requirements and own a unique market position to make Microsoft the world's leader in cyber security.

Our culture

Our team focuses on diversity of all types in candidates for our roles and we strive to hire people with different experiences and perspectives into our team. To that end, we know that no candidate has every desired skill and experience, but all of us together makes our team strong.

We are an agile team of very strong engineers, researchers and PMs, with a \move-fast" attitude, passion for solving tough problems, building things the right way and delighting our customers.
We encourage autonomy, collaboration, creativeness, and proactivity.
We possess a great interpersonal atmosphere within the group, it's a group of people who respect and love working with each other both on the professional level as well as the human interpersonal level.
Our work culture based on vast autonomy and built on trust and high professional skill and passion.
If like us, cyber security is something you’re passionate about, you live and love data, want to make the world a safer place for millions of customers, you love creating products for and with customers and you are a team player - come join us

Responsibilities

Build features end to end - from our sensor installed in the enterprise network, through our cloud backend, detection and profiling algorithms and our highly acclaimed detection and investigation UI.

Be a role model for engineering excellence, demonstrating very high quality in design, implementation, and collaboration with your peers.

Lead engineers through development of our most complex features.

Apply a critical view of our infrastructure, technologies, and development process, proactively pushing to improve our product and our group

Qualifications

You have 6+ years of experience in software development (extensive Object Oriented experience) - MUST HAVE
All-around technical wealth – ability to move between backend, frontend, infrastructure, and algorithms tasks
Team player, both highly effective working independently and highly collaborative
Proven technical leadership experience
A role model for other engineers – responsible, thorough, proactive
Passion for learning and implementing the newest technologies
B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or relevant practical experience (e.g. service in elite technology unit in IDF)

Preferred Qualifications

Background in at one of the following areas: Networking, Cyber security, Cloud-based applications.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

#ILDC-MPS"

title: Frontend Developer
subTitle: Nebius
description:
Nebius is looking for a Frontend Developer to help develop our hyperscaler cloud platform.




Who we are?

Nebius is a modern technology venture that enables country-scale B2B companies to build their own local hyperscaling cloud platforms, connecting businesses, tech communities and public organizations. We provide not only the technologies, but also a launch-ready business model including customizable tools for support, sales and marketing.




Innovation is the core of our DNA. We design and build server racks for the data centers to make sure they can work under any load, heavily invest in data management, machine translation, and speech recognition so our partners can enhance own IT-infrastructure and provide cutting-edge cloud solutions for the local markets. In compliance with ISO and GDPR, we carry out in-depth security checks to ensure the highest level of data sovereignty.




Our team




Our team is the most valuable asset that we have. Our R&D engineers and business professionals have a proven track record of using technologies to create value for other businesses. Our diverse backgrounds empower us to come up with brilliant ideas and implement them into complex IT-solutions.




We have our headquarters in Italy & Israel, with additional offices in Serbia, Germany and Netherlands.




One key aspect of our team is the sheer variety covered by our projects and work. We develop multiple interfaces and tools (from the site and internal admin panel to documentation tools) for internal and external users with a central tech and library stack: NodeJS, TypeScript, React.

At our disposal are all the services our cloud has to offer, and we can pick the most applicable to use as needed. Data is stored in a PostgreSQL cluster, ClickHouse is our tool for telemetry, and we use Elasticsearch for searches. Dogfooding is also important since all of the above is rolled out in our cloud.




From designing UX/UI with the design team and working with the backend team to settle on an API format to coming up with infrastructure and deployment models, we’re embedded throughout the entire service lifecycle.




What you’ll be doing:

Meet major project challenges
Work with designers to develop the UX
Interact with adjacent teams to find compromises
Suggest solutions and ideas




What we expect from you:

Ability to keep the big picture in mind
Experience working with relational databases




Preferred qualifications:

Ability to write tests and understand why they’re needed
Familiarity with infrastructure, rollout, and the related processes




As an employer we provide our employees with ambitious challenges, exceptional and thoughtful colleagues, competitive compensation, and benefits package.




We strive to find the best talent, enthusiastic self-driven individuals to achieve our common goals together in a fast-paced collaborative environment.




We’re a globally diverse team full of positive vibes and love it that way.

Looking for a new challenge? Join us now!

title: Senior Backend Engineer, R&D
subTitle: Axonius
description:
Axonius is the cybersecurity asset management platform that gives organizations a comprehensive asset inventory, uncovers gaps, and automatically validates and enforces policies. Deployed in minutes, the Axonius cyber asset attack surface management (CAASM) solution integrates with hundreds of data sources to give customers the confidence to control complexity by mitigating threats, navigating risk, decreasing incidents, automating response actions, and informing business-level strategy. Hundreds of customers worldwide like The New York Times, Schneider Electric, and AB InBev trust Axonius to control complexity.




Headquartered in New York, New York, Axonius employs over 500 people worldwide and achieved unicorn status in early 2021. Axonius has been recognized with the Great Place to Work Certification™, was named one of Fortune’s 2021 Best Small and Medium Workplaces™, and was named to Dun’s Best Start Up Companies to Work for Over 100 Employees. Axonius was also named to the 2021 Forbes Cloud 100 list of the top 100 private SaaS companies in the world and has been cited as the fastest growing cybersecurity company in history by revenue. Most recently, Axonius has been named to Inc. magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces list.

About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




The Front-End Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda’s marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills.




The Opportunity:




We are looking hands-on Development Managers / Senior Managers who have unique knowledge and abilities to contribute to our highly scaled web products and mobile applications. You must be a strong leader who can guide our staff beyond our already high standards of engineering to the next level.




The manager and director roles at Agoda are some of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. We are looking for world class managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams.




In this Role, you’ll get to:




Maintain ownership and responsibility of mission critical systems.
Guide one or more Agile teams to success.
Get involved with full stack, server, and mobile app engineering and guide server, client, and infrastructure technical staff to the best solutions.
Directly manage between 5 and 10 technology professionals as a manager or between 3 and 5 direct manager reports as a director and be responsible for their performance at the company.

Proficient in one or more mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Web)

Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, VIPER, MVVM, MVP, SOLID principals, and TDD
Excellent people management and communication skills
B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred

Deep experience in multiple platforms including iOS, Android, Web, and API services
Have managed teams and been a key player at an Internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second
Have experience managing in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data
Created new teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems
Previously worked with VP or Senior leadership at a large company
Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and dat

title: Senior Web Engineer (ASP.NET)
subTitle: SeatGeek
description:
SeatGeek Enterprise is our innovative open-ecosystem enterprise ticketing software that allows teams, venues, and promoters to efficiently run their businesses and captivate fans.

We’re proud to partner with some of the most recognized names across the globe including the Dallas Cowboys, Brooklyn Nets, and Liverpool F.C., as well as the NFL, MLS, half of the English Premier League, and theaters across NYC’s Broadway and London’s West End.

We believe rights-holders, not ticketing companies, should have full control over the tools they use and partners they choose within their ticket-selling ecosystem. Third-parties make that ecosystem better – from tools that provide analytics, data visualization, dynamic pricing, and more – and our flexible, open, modern SRO (Standing Room Only) platform makes those integrations possible.

We're looking for bright, curious software engineers who want to help millions of people experience the thrill of live entertainment through our SRO product. The ticketing industry is messy, complex and makes attending live events more difficult than it is; we believe a thoughtful application of software can fix that.

Who You Are

5+ of experience building web applications, both backend and frontend, ideally within a microservices architecture. We'll be most interested in hearing about what you've built.
Experience working with C# and ASP.NET in production
Experience working with JavaScript or TypeScript in production
Experience with JQuery and CSS/LESS
Passion for software craftsmanship and product. You have well-considered opinions about how software should work, and hold yourself and your code to a high standard
Understanding of object-oriented concepts and design patterns
Experience with .NET Core, MS SQL, Cloud Platforms (AWS) are a plus but not required
Fluent in English (verbal and written)

The tools we use

Languages: Python, C#/.NET Core, and Go
Datastores: MS SQL Server
Clientside: Javascript, Typescript
Version control: GitHub and GitLab
Infrastructure: AWS, Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD

Additionally

If you are interested in the role, please include an English-language resume or CV with your application
You will be working with our Israel-based development teams. We are open to remote hiring, as long as you are comfortable with working hours that overlap considerably with the Israel time zone. We happily encourage the occasional office visit from our remote teammates, especially for team events!

SeatGeek is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. As an equal opportunities employer, we recognize that diversity is a positive attribute and we welcome the differences and benefits that a diverse culture brings. Come join us!

subTitle: R2Net Inc - JamesAllen.com

R2Net Inc. is an international software company, owned by the world's largest retailer of diamond jewelry, Signet Jewelers (NYSE SIG). What began as a modest trading network to sell diamonds has steadily transformed into a robust e-commerce and supply chain platform that connects the entire span of the diamond industry’s ecosystem, including manufacturers, retailers, and consumers. R2Net owns and operates three distinct brands, James Allen, Segoma, and Brio Animation Studio.

JamesAllen.com is the fastest-growing online retailer of engagement rings and loose diamonds, allowing customers to personalize and order engagement rings and other fine jewelry online.




What’s It Like To Work For Us?

At R2Net, we’re proud of our unique and diverse work environment, striving to employ people from many different backgrounds and cultures. Every team member has a voice within the company and contributes to our overall development. We provide ample opportunities for growth and cultivate a collaborative and entrepreneurial approach to our day-to-day work. Additionally, it is very important to us to promote a strong work-life balance for each of our employees.







Responsibilities:

Full Stack Tech Lead - 80% Development 20% Lead.

Participate in the architecture, design, development, and delivery of complex features in a distributed and dynamic development environment.

Develop with the latest technologies, such as recoil, socket.io, micro frontend, module federation.

Write JavaScript/Typescript for Node.js web services and React Web apps.

Write well-designed, testable, efficient code that complies with specifications.




Requirements:

At least 5 years of experience in developing web applications using React.

Experience in NodeJS and JavaScript/Typescript Development.

Experience with DevOps tools; Docker/ Kubernetes/ CI\CD.

Extensive experience with full-stack development, distributed systems, and relational databases (MySQL or other).

Experience in AWS or another cloud environment.

Team player, strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and empathy.

title: Senior Software Engineer - UX infrastructure
subTitle: Microsoft
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nHybrid
description:
Would you like be part of an exciting and impactful product?

Make our world a better and safer place and defend millions?

Use cutting-edge technologies at huge scale? (we process more data than twitter)

Microsoft 365 Defender is an innovative, industry leading integrated solution for the Microsoft 365 threat protection services that breaks down traditional security solutions silos to deliver detection and response across all data sources.

Using AI and automation to integrate Microsoft’s industry-leading products for protecting users, endpoints, cloud apps, and data, we merge signals from numerous security solutions such as Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Defender for Email, Microsoft Defender for Identity, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and apply deep correlation logic to provide holistic prevention, detection, investigation, and response capabilities for all assets protected by Microsoft and empower defenders to move from reacting to employing their unique expertise to keep bad actors out.

We use state of the art cloud technologies and big data solutions at hyper scale and modern UX platform to deliver the highest value for our customers.

Responsibilities

We are looking for a Senior to Principal engineer, with strong front end technical and leadership skills that is self-driven and can balance drive for results, team-work and the ability to quickly learn and pick up new technologies & applications.

You will join a team of FE infrastructure experts that:

Set the vision, builds and evolve micro-front-end infrastructure that drives UX at scale, impacting hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of developers across multiple divisions.
Works collaboratively to drive and continously improve UX engineering excellence and velocity, customer experience and quality at scale across multiple groups with wide collaboration.

Qualifications

B.Sc./M.Sc. in Computer Science (or equivalent)
6+ years of software development experience
2+ years of experience with HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS/LESS/SASS
3+ years of experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React
Autodidactic abilities to ramp up quickly on new technologies
Great people skills, leadership and collaboration

Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge in one of the following is an advantage:

Experience with .NET/C#.
Experience with large scale applications
Experience in cyber security domain

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. You develop it all! Including products and features.

title: 38676 - Head Of Software Engineering Digital Delivery
subTitle: Teva Pharmaceuticals
description:
Job Description:

Teva Pharmaceuticals, Digital Platforms unit is looking to hire a mature Head of Software Engineering (HSE) for a leadership role accountable for successfully delivering software and IT processes. Managing a growing team of developers and IT specialists (currently more than 30 in three locations), the HSE will work closely with the Delivery Director and peers in order to deliver software and IT services that meet customer needs. The HSE will be accountable for creating and delivering the strategic, software, technical vision, leadership, and all aspects of the development and integration of software.




Responsibilities:

Leading large software engineering teams in the design and development of high-volume, high-performance, media publishing workflow systems, and consumer-facing products, including cutting-edge web-based applications.
Prioritize, assign and monitor application design and development tasks across multiple concurrent software maintenance and enhancement projects.
Guide teams of developers to analyze customer requests/requirements, identify viable technical solutions, make recommendations, and develop/test/deploy technical solutions
Serve as a subject matter expert and provide other developers and team members with guidance and best practices for using new/modern technologies. Meet with customers as needed to discuss technical requests/issues
Stimulate hiring, training as well as performance reviews for software engineering teams, and provide technical and career mentoring for the engineering organization.
Review internal deliverables and deliverables received from the vendor(s) who might be delivering a set of modules/features.
Research and evaluate alternative solutions and recommend the most efficient and cost-effective solution considering requirements, available technologies, governance, and best practice guidelines
Participate in hands-on application solutions architecture, design, development, testing, and deployment activities.
Deliver presentations, briefings, and technical documentation.




You will be successful in this role when you have:

10+ years of demonstrable and substantial experience in leading and managing teams of software developers (35+ indirect reports)
Experience in successfully designing and developing sophisticated software products deployed in a variety of environments
Hands-on experience of coding using more than one recognized industry-standard language (e.g. Java, Golang)
Web application development experience with Microsoft Office365 tools/technologies, specifically PowerApps, Power Automate, DataVerse, and SPFx.
Experience in leading teams working in an Agile environment
Strong understanding of the Agile software development cycle
Experience with more than one software development methodology
Experience with cloud technologies (eg. Google, AWS, Azure) and software deployment to the cloud (CI/CD, scalability, containerization, serverless) would be an advantage
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Outstanding interpersonal skills
An understanding of databases and handling of large data sources
Experience in using Atlassian JIRA, Confluence is a plus

title: Senior Software Engineer – Full Stack (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
subTitle: Agoda
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




The Full Stack Engineering Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda’s marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills.




The Opportunity:




We are looking for key contributors to our industry leading front-end websites. You’ll be working on products which have evolved tremendously over the past several years to become the global market leader.




You’ll be using the most current technologies and best practices to accomplish our goals. Our typical day involves the creation of new end to end systems, building advanced architectures, creation of new features on our high uptime / frequently published websites and apps, development of fast and reliable automated testing systems and working in a culture that is always looking to improve our quality, tools, and efficiency.




In this Role, you’ll get to:




Lead development of features, experiments, technical projects and complex systems
Be a technical architect, mentor, and driver towards the right technology
Build high volume websites with current technologies including TS, React, and GraphQL
Continue to evolve our architecture and build better software
Be a major contributor to our agile and scrum practices
Get involved with full stack engineering and collaborate with server, other client, and infrastructure technical team members to build the best solution




What you’ll Need to Succeed:




At least 3 years of experience developing web applications in client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, VueJS, etc. 5+ years preferred
B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred
Working experience with agile, analytics, A/B testing, GIT Flow
Excellent HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too
3-5+ years’ experience developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using one of the backend languages/frameworks such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python
Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript
You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack
Great communication and coordination skills
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
You have a good command of the English language




It’s Great if you have:




Knowledge in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions
Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (CouchBase, ElasticSearch, Redis), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ)
Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions would be a plus
Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript
Strong experience in all aspects of client-side performance optimization,
Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, Clean Code, SOLID principals, and TDD.
Experience in multiple front-end platforms including iOS, Android, Web, and API services
Have worked on an app or internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second
Have experience in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data
Lead teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems
Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and data




This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)

Axonius is the cybersecurity asset management platform that gives organizations a comprehensive asset inventory, uncovers gaps, and automatically validates and enforces policies. Hundreds of customers worldwide like The New York Times, Schneider Electric, and AB InBev trust Axonius to control complexity.




Headquartered in New York, New York, Axonius employs over 600 people worldwide and achieved unicorn status in early 2021. Axonius has been recognized with the Great Place to Work Certification™, was named one of Fortune’s 2021 Best Small and Medium Workplaces™, and was named to Dun’s Best Start Up Companies to Work for Over 100 Employees. Most recently, Axonius was also named to the 2021 and 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 list of the top 100 private SaaS companies in the world, as well as named to Inc. magazine's 2022 Best Workplaces and has been cited as the fastest growing cybersecurity company in history by revenue.




We are growing rapidly and are looking for superstars to join our rocket ship.

We are a remote-first culture. We have offices in New York and in Tel Aviv, but the majority of our employees are working from home across the US and Internationally.

At Axonius we support a diverse and inclusive workplace and believe in equal employment opportunity. title: Front End Developer
subTitle: Tenable
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel\nOn-site
description:
Description

Job Description

Who is Tenable?

Tenable® is the Exposure Management company. 40,000 organizations around the globe rely on Tenable to understand and reduce cyber risk. Our global employees support 60 percent of the Fortune 500, 40 percent of the Global 2000, and large government agencies. Come be part of our journey!

What makes Tenable such a great place to work?

Ask a member of our team and they’ll answer, “Our people!” We work together to build and innovate best-in-class cybersecurity solutions for our customers; all while creating a culture of belonging, respect, and excellence where we can be our best selves. When you’re part of our #OneTenable team, you can expect to partner with some of the most talented and passionate people in the industry, and have the support and resources you need to do work that truly matters. We deliver results that exceed expectations and we win together!

Your Role

We're a small, but growing, team that builds a unique security monitoring and management solution for industrial control systems and we’re looking for talented Software Engineers to join our growing team in Tel Aviv.

Your Opportunity

Growth and Development: As part of working on a small team, you'll have a broad scope and an opportunity to grow as a software engineer. You will team up with engineers to drive initiatives, define the architecture, and build new features.
Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, other engineers, and designers to continuously improve the product.
Creativity: We welcome engineers that are motivated and come up with their own ideas to help us build a better product.
Architecture & Design: Help with design decisions and the ability to understand and improve our performance and stability.

What You'll Need

At least 3 years of experience as a Front-end Developer - Preferably Angular Framework.
At least 3 years of experience with JavaScript and Css (experience with sass/less is advantage)
Experience with TypeScript
Knowledge of performance optimizations techniques in JavaScript and frontend framework
Excellent knowledge of browser troubleshooting and debugging practices and techniques
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company’s success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player
Great interpersonal and communication skills

If you’ve reached this point, and you’re still not sure if you should apply…..Just do it! We’re human and we don’t fit a perfect mold. Having diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives, that’s a good thing! If you’re coming from outside of the cyber industry - great! If you’re looking to try something new - awesome! All we ask is you bring passion to all that you do, crave creativity and innovation, and embrace the hard work of gaining new skills and accepting big challenges.

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of March 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $41.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.2 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

Team work and organization skills

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
